We can only be truly relevant when we create a truly inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. That means – we are tough on the work but gentle with each other. We lead with empathy and are always listening and always learning. We support each other, we cheer for each other, we win together. We celebrate difference as the only way to make the work that makes a difference.

Title: Business Data Analyst | AdKaora
HTML:
AdKaora


AdKaora è una digital company del Gruppo Mondadori, leader nell’innovazione mobile, che offre strumenti e soluzioni efficaci in ottica multicanale ai brand e ai publisher per raggiungere, coinvolgere e influenzare il proprio target, portando risultati concreti e misurabili.


AdKaora è una digital company leader nell’innovazione. Offriamo strumenti e soluzioni multicanale efficaci per brand e publisher, mirati a raggiungere, coinvolgere e influenzare il target, ottenendo risultati concreti e misurabili.


AdKaora Value Network è la nostra innovativa concessionaria pubblicitaria, che fa dell'innovazione tecnologica il suo cavallo di battaglia. Con oltre 1500 partner globali, realizziamo e proponiamo al mercato formati pubblicitari innovativi, utilizzati dai più grandi publisher italiani e internazionali.



Di cosa ti occuperai

Stiamo cercando una/un Business Data Analyst che voglia essere una figura chiave nell’analisi dei dati di business. In questo ruolo contribuirai in modo attivo alla definizione delle strategie aziendali, interpretando dati complessi provenienti da media, digital marketing e finance. Ti occuperai di:


  • analisi avanzata dei dati provenienti da campagne media, mobile, web e proximity, con l’obiettivo di monitorare performance e individuare insight strategici;
  • sviluppo di reportistica automatizzata e dashboard interattive per i team interni (Sales, Product, Marketing) e per i clienti, utilizzando strumenti come Power BI, Tableau o Looker;
  • definizione e monitoraggio dei KPI di business legati a campagne advertising e customer behavior, con focus su conversioni, engagement e ROI;
  • integrazione e pulizia dei dati provenienti da fonti eterogenee (DMP, DSP, CRM, piattaforme di advertising, SDK di terze parti);
  • collaborazione con il team tecnico e di prodotto per strutturare flussi di dati ottimizzati e supportare progetti di data governance e tracking;
  • supporto alla definizione di modelli predittivi o segmentazioni comportamentali con tecniche statistiche avanzate (machine learning opzionale);
  • produzione di analisi ad hoc su esigenze strategiche interne o richieste cliente, con capacità di sintesi e storytelling data-driven.



Il tuo profilo

Professionalmente hai:

  • Laurea in Statistica, Economia, Matematica, Ingegneria gestionale o discipline affini.
  • almeno 5 anni di esperienza come Business Data Analyst;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati e BI (Excel, SQL, Google Analytics, Google BigQuery, Power BI, Looker, etc. )
  • competenze avanzate del pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel);
  • Competenza in ambito di lettura dei principali indicatori economico-finanziari;
  • capacità di lavorare in team cross-funzionali (marketing, sales, finance);
  • ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta);
  • mentalità data-driven, precisione e curiosità intellettuale.


Plus

  • Esperienza in agenzie digitali o in contesti adtech/martech;
  • conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione statistica (Python, R);
  • familiarità con ambienti cloud (GCP, AWS).



Cosa ti offriamo

  • Inquadramento e retribuzione commisurati in base alla tua esperienza;
  • Possibilità di smartworking, buoni pasto nei giorni di presenza in sede, accesso al welfare e a tutti i servizi aziendali.


Sede di lavoro: Via San Gregorio 1, Milano


Siamo felici di ricevere candidature da profili diversi per genere, età e cultura, perché crediamo nelle pari opportunità, ma ancor più nel valore aggiunto che ogni individuo, con la propria unicità, può apportare al nostro Gruppo.

(Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Our Reward Team helps clients navigate the total reward landscape in a tailor-made and result-oriented way. From developing rewards strategy to implementing innovative solutions, they bring together the right mix of expertise—covering everything from reward, tax & legal, employee communication, to tech and processes.

Role Summary

In today’s reward landscape, data and analytics are becoming central drivers of change. Pay transparency and pay equity are rapidly gaining importance, accelerated by global legislation and the upcoming EU Pay Transparency Directive. At Deloitte, we help our clients prepare for these changes and achieve fair, transparent and effective reward strategies.

As a Rewards Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in this journey. Working as part of our multidisciplinary Global Employer Services (GES) reward team—which brings together experts in job architecture, job grading, tax & social security, people law, compensation, benefits, processes and reward technology—you will help clients translate complex data into meaningful insights and actionable solutions.

We Are Looking For Both Junior And Senior Profiles


Junior Data Analyst: you will focus on preparing and executing analyses, supporting senior colleagues in delivering client-ready outputs.
Senior Data Analyst: in addition to performing analyses, you will review the work of junior colleagues, engage directly with clients, and contribute to shaping client deliverables and recommendations.


Key Responsibilities

Junior Data Analyst


Prepare reward and compensation datasets for analysis, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Conduct statistical and regression analyses under the guidance of senior colleagues.
Develop dashboards and visualisations (Power BI, R, Python) to support client discussions.
Draft initial reports and presentations for senior review.
Support the implementation of pay equity & transparency analyses.


Senior Data Analyst


Lead the design and execution of advanced reward analytics projects.
Review and validate analyses prepared by junior colleagues, ensuring quality and accuracy.
Translate findings into clear insights and recommendations for clients.
Engage directly with clients to present results and provide advice on next steps.
Act as a key contributor within Deloitte’s pay equity & transparency offering, helping clients adapt to evolving legislation (incl. EU Pay Transparency Directive).


Let’s Talk About You!


Strong interest to bring advanced analytics (and artificial intelligence) into our client solutions & applications
At least 1 - 3 years (junior profile) or 4 - 6 years (senior profile) of experience in data analytics
Experience in applying statistical techniques
Experience working with R or Python and Power BI (or other data visualisation tools)
Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably one additional language (Dutch or French)
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and data visualisation tools


Our story

Global Employer Services (GES) team is fully aware today’s digital revolution is rapidly rewriting the environment for employers and their global workforces. The need for mobility is greater than ever. We help our clients achieve control, gain perspective, and lead with confidence through this period of uncertainty and technological change. Our professionals focus on providing personal tax, compensation & benefits and international assignment/HR services to our clients. We assist our clients to streamline their HR, Mobility and Rewards programs, while managing tax effectiveness, compliance and employment costs, both in a global and domestic context.

Reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll advisory designed just for you! Our professionals help you design cost-effective, tax-efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs.

Our story - Global Employer Services (GES)

In today's digital revolution, the environment for employers and their (global) workforces is rapidly evolving, with an increased need for adaptability. The GES team is dedicated to helping clients navigate these challenges with confidence, providing expertise in rewards, compensation & benefits, personal tax and international assignment/HR services.

Our focus is on streamlining HR, Rewards and Mobility programs to ensure effectiveness, compliance, and cost management in both global and domestic contexts. We offer specialised advisory services in reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll, tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.

Our professionals are committed to designing cost-effective, efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs. We are here to support your journey towards pay transparency and equity, ensuring your compensation strategies are both attractive to employees and beneficial for your business.

Why work in GES?


Passion: Driven by a love for mobility, payroll, and rewards services, crafting both local and global solutions in a sustainable way.
People-focused: Working with and for people. Investing in coaching, learning, and developing the team, making sure everyone grows.
Professionalism: Delivering excellence as a united team, ensuring success for their clients and for each other.


Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:


My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities


Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality


Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst F/M/X
Description:
Are you a talented Data Analyst looking to take the next step in your career?

Amaris Consulting is seeking a motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Belgium. This is a fantastic opportunity for professionals with a keen analytical mindset, technical expertise, and strong communication skills to grow and make an impact in a dynamic, multicultural environment.




🔥 Your Role:

Analyze data and create reports to help the business make decisions.
Build dashboards and visualizations to share insights.
Work with different teams to understand their data needs.
Make sure data is accurate and clean.
Present your findings to both technical and non-technical people.




🎯Your Profile:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Good knowledge of SQL and data analysis tools (like Python or R).
Experience with data visualization tools (like Power BI or Tableau).
Team player with good communication skills.
Speak English and Dutch (bilingual) or English, French, and Dutch (trilingual).




🚀 Advantages:

An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.




💡 We are an independent company that values:

Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.







Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez,
Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN,
Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions.
Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !
Show more

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualisation
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

Who We Are

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

The Opportunity

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.

Responsibilities


Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank’s digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization


Your Profile


Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills; ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.
Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.


What We Offer


Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.


Why Join Us?

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wil je meewerken aan innovatieve oplossingen voor toonaangevende klanten? En hou je ervan om de brug te slaan tussen technologie en business? Dan hebben wij bij LACO dé uitdaging voor jou!




Met de komst van enkele nieuwe projecten bouwen we ons team verder uit. En daarvoor zoeken we een Data Analyst die impact wil maken binnen het Microsoft-ecosysteem




🛠️ Wat je gaat doen:

Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:

Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven écht vooruithelpen.
Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega’s uit verschillende disciplines.
Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.




🎯 Wat wij zoeken:

Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.




Extra punten als je ook …

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.




💡 Wat wij bieden:

Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, …
Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt — wij staan open voor beide.
Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden …




📩 Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?

Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje – ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.

We horen graag van je!




LACO is geen doorsnee IT-bedrijf. We zijn een Belgische pionier in Data & AI, al meer dan 35 jaar. Als trotse partner van zowel SAS als Microsoft (Data & AI Solutions Partner) en specialist in Data Governance bouwen we dagelijks mee aan de groei van data-gedreven organisaties.

Wat ons écht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten én collega’s en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.

Show more

Title: Junior Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst
Description:
About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels’ WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices – our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Nestlé, EU and Belgian institutions, fuelling their success internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a "lab” mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

ROLE

As a Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst, you’ll help uncover meaningful insights from social, digital, and search data to support strategic thinking and creative development. You’ll explore what people are saying, sharing, and searching online to better understand audience behaviours, identify cultural trends, and help shape recommendations for leading international brands.

This role is perfect for someone who’s naturally curious about people and culture, excited by the ever-changing digital world, and eager to grow in a collaborative, social-first agency environment.

Responsibilities


Support the analysis of social and digital data using tools like Talkwalker, Tubular, RivalIQ, Semrush, GlobalWebIndex, and proprietary OSL dashboards.
Help build clear, insightful reports that highlight audience behaviors, cultural trends, and campaign opportunities.
Work closely with strategists and planners to contribute data that informs content and communication strategies.
Assist in developing regular social listening and trend-monitoring reports.
Participate in client presentations and internal meetings to share insights in a clear and engaging way.
Collaborate with data teams across Ogilvy and WPP, as well as third-party providers.
Stay curious about the digital world; new platforms, tools, formats, and audience behaviours.


PROFILE


1–3 years of experience in digital, social, or search data analytics, insights, or related roles.
Strong interest in digital culture, social media trends, and emerging technologies.
Familiar with tools such as Talkwalker, Tubular, RivalIQ, GlobalWebIndex, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, or similar (training can be provided).
Comfortable working with both quantitative and qualitative data and turning findings into simple, useful insights.
A basic understanding of digital performance metrics (organic and paid) across key platforms.
Proficient in English. French or Dutch is a plus.
Curious, detail-oriented, and motivated to learn from more senior analysts and strategists.
Good communicator with strong reporting and visualization skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Google Slides, or data viz tools).
A team player who thrives in a collaborative, fast-moving environment.


OFFER


Full-time opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels - the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional, and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency - Our words and promises produce actions.
Attractive package and benefits
Strong flexibility plan
Continuous training opportunities
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 We’re Hiring – Data Analyst




At Degetel, a human-sized IT consultancy firm, we empower professionals through meaningful, high-impact missions. We’re currently looking for a Data Analyst to join one of our key client projects.




Your mission:

-Analyze Power BI reports to identify semantic models, DAX measures, data sources

-Document data models, transformations, dependencies (Power BI, ETL, databases)

-Participate in data governance (traceability, quality, GDPR) and migration

-Propose improvements in modeling, report structuring...




What you bring:

-Experience in Power BI (DAX, models, paginated reports)

-Experience in SQL and SQL Server, Azure SQL

-Knowledge of Kimball, Data Vault, GIT

-Experience in technical documentation and complex models interpretation

-Fluent in French, Dutch, and English (written and spoken).




📆 Long-term mission | Freelance or Consultancy




Want to learn more ? Do not wait any longer to apply ! We can't wait to discuss and be a part of you journey !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions. 




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position description

Category

Support Centers - Finance

Job title

Data Analyst

Job Description

LET’S TALK ABOUT THE JOB!

Are you a data enthusiast with a passion for solving real-world problems? Join our Analytics & AI team as a Data Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to revolutionize the self-storage industry through data-driven insights. You report to the Data & AI Manager.

LET’S TALK ABOUT YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES!


Use Cases
Customer Segmentation: You analyze customer data to identify distinct segments and preferences, enabling us to tailor marketing efforts and improve customer retention.
Occupancy Optimization: You create algorithms to optimize unit allocation and ensure maximum occupancy while minimizing operational costs.
Pricing Strategy: You analyze market data and competitor pricing to recommend dynamic pricing strategies that maximize revenue.
Security & Access Analytics: You develop models for monitoring access patterns and identifying anomalies to enhance security measures for our self-storage facilities.
Customer Satisfaction: You analyze customer feedback and reviews to identify trends and areas for improvement in our services.
Building maintenance Analytics: You analyze IoT data from Shurgard stores to drive insights and recommend improvements on the maintenance operations.
Main Tasks
Data Analysis: You analyze large datasets to extract valuable insights and trends related to self-storage operations, customer behavior, and market trends.
Data Visualization: You create compelling data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings and insights effectively to stakeholders.
Data Engineering: You enrich Shurgard Enterprise Data model with new features and facts by developing data engineering pipeline in collaboration with the data engineering team.
Collaboration: You work closely with our analytics & AI team, collaborating on projects and learning from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Research: You stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in analytics and AI, and contribute ideas for innovative projects.


LET’S TALK ABOUT YOUR SKILLS!


You are innovative and creative; you dare to think outside of the box.
You have excellent writing skills.
You have strong organizational skills and are able to build structure out of chaos.
You have a problem-solving attitude.
You show flexibility and are open to change.
You can work independently and complete work to deadlines.


Profile (ex. Education, experience, competencies, etc)

LET’S TALK ABOUT YOUR PROFILE!


You hold a master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analysis, Statistics, or a related field.
You are fluent in English. Any other language is considered a plus.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
You demonstrate excellent communication and teamwork skills.
You are proficient in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, PowerBI).
You have strong knowledge of DAX and SQL.
You have experience with Python, which is a pre-requisite.
You possess a solid understanding of statistical concepts.


And colleagues? Well, they are very important to you too. You like sharing and collaborating. You want to contribute to a fun and constructive work climate. And needless to say, you love to learn and to develop your knowledge and skills.

Contract type

Permanent

Full Time Equivalent %

100%

We offer

Join the European leader in self-storage.

At Shurgard, you'll be part of a dynamic, supportive team where your contributions truly matter. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive package of extra-legal benefits—because we believe great work deserves great rewards.

Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Belgium at hire and must maintain authorization to work in Belgium throughout their employment with our company.

Position description

Category

Support Centers - Finance

Job title

Data Analyst

Job Description

LET’S TALK ABOUT THE JOB!

Are you a data enthusiast with a passion for solving real-world problems? Join our Analytics & AI team as a Data Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to revolutionize the self-storage industry through data-driven insights. You report to the Data & AI Manager.

LET’S TALK ABOUT YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES!

  • Use Cases
  • Customer Segmentation: You analyze customer data to identify distinct segments and preferences, enabling us to tailor marketing efforts and improve customer retention.
  • Occupancy Optimization: You create algorithms to optimize unit allocation and ensure maximum occupancy while minimizing operational costs.
  • Pricing Strategy: You analyze market data and competitor pricing to recommend dynamic pricing strategies that maximize revenue.
  • Security & Access Analytics: You develop models for monitoring access patterns and identifying anomalies to enhance security measures for our self-storage facilities.
  • Customer Satisfaction: You analyze customer feedback and reviews to identify trends and areas for improvement in our services.
  • Building maintenance Analytics: You analyze IoT data from Shurgard stores to drive insights and recommend improvements on the maintenance operations.
  • Main Tasks
  • Data Analysis: You analyze large datasets to extract valuable insights and trends related to self-storage operations, customer behavior, and market trends.
  • Data Visualization: You create compelling data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings and insights effectively to stakeholders.
  • Data Engineering: You enrich Shurgard Enterprise Data model with new features and facts by developing data engineering pipeline in collaboration with the data engineering team.
  • Collaboration: You work closely with our analytics & AI team, collaborating on projects and learning from experienced data scientists and analysts.
  • Research: You stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in analytics and AI, and contribute ideas for innovative projects.

LET’S TALK ABOUT YOUR SKILLS!

  • You are innovative and creative; you dare to think outside of the box.

  • You have strong organizational skills and are able to build structure out of chaos.
  • You have a problem-solving attitude.
  • You show flexibility and are open to change.
  • You can work independently and complete work to deadlines.

Profile (ex. Education, experience, competencies, etc)

LET’S TALK ABOUT YOUR PROFILE!

  • You hold a master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analysis, Statistics, or a related field.
  • You are fluent in English. Any other language is considered a plus.

  • You have strong knowledge of DAX and SQL.
  • You have experience with Python, which is a pre-requisite.
  • You possess a solid understanding of statistical concepts.

And colleagues? Well, they are very important to you too. You like sharing and collaborating. You want to contribute to a fun and constructive work climate. And needless to say, you love to learn and to develop your knowledge and skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 51.000 colleagues in nearly 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst at Sopra Steria, you will play a pivotal role in guiding clients from various industries through their dynamic data journey. You will assist clients in transforming their data processes. By thoroughly analysing and understanding customer needs, you’ll match their requirements with meaningful data solutions. Your innovative approach will enable you to generate impactful analyses that deliver efficient, user-focused solutions. Through your expertise and advice across the data value chain, you’ll ensure the successful implementation and support of Sopra Steria’s diverse portfolio of data services.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer or Data Analyst
You help customers in their data transformation, focusing on data architecture, data strategy and governance, data foundation, and more
Based on your advice across the entire data value chain, you ensure that Sopra Steria’s portfolio of relevant data services is implemented and supported
You collect, analyze and match customer demand with meaningful data
You have knowledge and experience with databases and data modeling
You have good knowledge and experience with SQL
You have practical experience with Microsoft cloud or comparable alternatives
Knowledge of a programming language like Python is a plus
Experience with using and implementing AI in your and the client’s workflow is a plus
You have analytical thinking, communication skills and a practical attitude
You are proficient in English; knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a must


What We Can Offer You

Become part of a major Tech player in Europe that is recognised for consulting, digital services and software development. Work among high-level professionals who dare to make bold choices to deliver results.

Additionally, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.  

Additional Information

Are you ready to further develop your career? Then we’d love to point you in the right direction. With offices in more than 30 countries, that direction might lead you to places you’ve never been to before. Would you prefer to grow internally? That’s possible, too. We challenge you to keep pushing yourself to become the best you can be.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


Ready to take the next step?

We’re here to support you all the way and we are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
FREELANCE Data Analyst

ASAP

Brussels, hybrid (2 days on site / week)

English + French Mandatory (Fluent)




Our leading banking client is urgently seeking a Data Analyst to join their compliance and transformation team. This is a high-priority hire, with interviews taking place immediately and an ideal start date next week.




Key Responsibilities

Manage and stabilise data flows and audits to support compliance, client studies, and strategic initiatives.
Produce clear analyses and reports using Excel, Tableau, Access, and Python for executive and regulatory needs.
Contribute to process improvement, automation, and compliance monitoring.
Act as a bridge between business, compliance, and technical teams, ensuring smooth implementation of policies.
Apply a business-focused mindset to transform data into actionable insights.




Requirements

Minimum 2 years of relevant data analysis experience.
Strong proficiency in Tableau / PowerBI, Excel, Access, Python
Experience in data modeling, reporting, and stakeholder communication.
Fluency in French and English.
Analytical, adaptable, and able to work independently.




Location: Brussels (with occasional travel to Paris)

interviews now, ideal start next week

Title: Junior Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Contribute to creating a better tomorrow

The only way we can tackle the challenges of this fast-changing world is with passionate people. Led by our purpose of building trust and solving important problems, we come together at PwC to address the biggest issues facing the world in a way that drives positive impact. Are you eager to join a team fuelled by open and curious minds? People who are passionate about their work and create new solutions for a new day? Then you’re at the right place.

Bring your talent. Learn new skills. Make a positive impact.

PwC Advisory is a network of multiple possibilities - where you want to make an impact is always up to you. Under the expert stewardship of our Advisory experts, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you’ll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that’s making a difference.

A career within Managed Services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients face their big complex and operational problems. We focus on understanding the forces shaping their business and developing industry tailored solutions that support our clients through the entire lifecycle. As a (senior) associate within the IT Support Team, you'll get the opportunity to help our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution and beyond.

Are you looking for a challenging job in a dynamic and innovative environment? You are about to find the perfect match!

Are you a data and IT enthusiast who also talks the language of business? Do you have a passion for solving complex data-based problems, creating, and developing reports, dashboards and troubleshooting data errors and issues?

What you will do and learn:

Your impact


Act as point of contact to collect, clean, transform and analyze data for efficient decision making to meet business expectation
Participate in the data analytics tool selection process (RfX, etc.)
Report and modelize key insights from performed analysis to be shared with key stakeholders (e.g: via PowerBI, Tableau, Slides, etc.)
Working closely with different teams to ensure issues and requests are addressed timely
Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise
Follow risk management and compliance procedures
Share and collaborate effectively with others
Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner – verbally and in the materials I produce
Build and maintain an internal and external network
Use creative problem-solving methods and work in an international, multidisciplinary team
Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct
Seek opportunities to learn about how PwC works as a global network of firms


About You


A relevant university degree in IT (management) or IT technology-related programmes or Business Administration/Management, Economics, Computer and Information Science, or any other relevant university degree that showcases your capabilities
You have a strong interest in data analytics, IT tools and the opportunities they offer as well as a good understanding of how to leverage them
You have a strong ability to leverage and turn your key findings into clear and outstanding presentations
0 to 2 years of experience in data analytics
Extensive experience developing and deploying reports, dashboards, and metrics
You are bilingual in Dutch & French, with professional working proficiency in English.
Strong Analytical skills
Strong verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Excellent time management skills under tight deadlines
The ability to work independently and as part of a team
Keep upskilling yourself via training and on the job learning


Moreover, you have an interest, experience and/or technical expertise in several of the following:


Alteryx, PowerBI, Tableau knowledge
Knowledge of PowerApps and Power Automate is a plus
SQL / Python knowledge is a plus
Project management & Microsoft certification is a plus (e.g. Prince II, PMI, Agile/Scrum, Azure AI, Power BI Data Analyst Associate, etc.)
Interest in new technologies like generative AI


Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at what life at PwC looks like:


Flexible work patterns: Achieve the perfect balance between office and home life with our flexible hybrid work arrangements and family-friendly schemes.
Lifelong learning: Grow with us! Take advantage of our diverse training opportunities and exciting career pathways to explore new disciplines and expertise.
Flexible rewards: Tailor your benefits to suit your lifestyle with our customizable rewards plan.
Sustainable mobility: Choose eco-friendly mobility options, from our soon-to-be fully electrified fleet to public transport, shared cars, ebikes, and more.
Inclusive culture: Thrive in a diverse, inclusive workplace that values and celebrates every individual's contributions.
Wellbeing focus: Enjoy a positive environment with our comprehensive wellbeing programs, engaging sports communities, and confidential support for all your professional and personal challenges.
Global network: Expand your horizons with opportunities to work abroad and tap into extensive industry expertise within the PwC network.


Let’s build something great together. What are you waiting for?

Equal Opportunity Employer statement

At PwC, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic environment. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all candidates and employees, regardless of race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace drives innovation and strengthens our ability to serve our people, clients and communities. Join us in fostering a culture where everyone feels valued, respected and empowered to achieve their full potential.

Additionally, we provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, in accordance with applicable laws.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Core Responsibilities




Data Structuring & Management

Stabilize and structure data to accelerate client and project studies
Manage, consolidate, and analyze data related to cash flows, operational audits, and sensitive client activities
Build dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau Desktop, Microsoft Access, and Python




Compliance & Risk Monitoring

Support compliance-related data initiatives and advisory tasks
Monitor client flows in sensitive countries and highlight risk exposure
Contribute to improving flow filtering processes while ensuring risk mitigation




Strategic Support

Contribute to strategic boards to monitor Cash Management performance in line with ExCo and regulatory expectations
Assist in developing conceptual models, business cases, and data-driven solutions
Support the Advisory Head in implementing corporate customer journey improvements related to compliance




Stakeholder Collaboration

Act as liaison between Business, Compliance, and Project Owners to align requirements and deliverables
Ensure proper communication and understanding of business needs across all stakeholders
Support change management and ensure smooth implementation of policies and tools




Communication & Reporting

Prepare reports and presentations for senior management and regulatory committees
Contribute to communication within the Cash Management community on compliance and regulatory topics




Soft Skills Contribution

Provide leadership in data initiatives, driving innovation and efficiency
Work independently with a proactive and problem-solving mindset
Apply a structured and analytical approach to complex challenges

Show more

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en écht impact te maken als Data Analist?

Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.




Wat ga je doen?

Je verzamelt, zuivert en analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten bloot te leggen
Je bouwt dashboards en rapporten die stakeholders helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
Je werkt nauw samen met data engineers, business teams en andere analisten om vragen te vertalen naar bruikbare analyses
Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen
Je zorgt voor datakwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid door middel van validatie en documentatie
Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologieën en methodes binnen de datawereld




Wie zoeken we?

Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid




Wat mag je verwachten?

Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad
Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts
Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget
Flexibiliteit: werk bij de klant, op het darwind-kantoor of van thuis uit
En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen




Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!

Show more
HTML:
Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en écht impact te maken als Data Analist?

Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.


Wat ga je doen?

  • Je verzamelt, zuivert en analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten bloot te leggen
  • Je bouwt dashboards en rapporten die stakeholders helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
  • Je werkt nauw samen met data engineers, business teams en andere analisten om vragen te vertalen naar bruikbare analyses
  • Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen
  • Je zorgt voor datakwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid door middel van validatie en documentatie
  • Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologieën en methodes binnen de datawereld


Wie zoeken we?

  • Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
  • Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
  • Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
  • Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
  • Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
  • Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid


Wat mag je verwachten?

  • Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad
  • Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts
  • Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities
  • Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget
  • Flexibiliteit: werk bij de klant, op het darwind-kantoor of van thuis uit
  • En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen


Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!

Title: Data & Business Analyst
Description:
Who we are




Phinest is a Belgian Management Consulting firm providing tailor-made services for Bel20 and Bel20-like companies.




We are a human-sized organisation working with a broad portfolio of clients in various sectors (Utilities, Pharmaceutical, Banking & Insurance, Retail, Transport, Public, Telecom).

Based on a holistic approach, our objective is to implement our client's strategic Projects and Programs and to ensure their business efficiency.




We strive for excellence through 6 essential Values: Quality, Cohesion, Honesty, Balance, Respect, and Openness.




Our mission is to create a unique experience where the most talented people and strategic projects magnify together. We are a human-centered organisation that believes in our people.




Position: Energy Business & Data Analyst




Your Mission:

Join a team at the forefront of the energy transition! As an Energy Business & Data Analyst, you will be the key link between business and IT teams, driving the design, development, and optimization of an innovative Energy Management System (EMS).




Your Responsibilities:

Analyze business needs related to energy management and optimization.
Translate these needs into clear functional specifications for technical teams.
Collect, structure, and analyze energy data to identify performance drivers.
Collaborate with stakeholders (business, IT, engineering, data) to ensure project success.
Monitor performance indicators and propose continuous improvements.




Your Profile:

A unique mix of business insight and data/IT mindset.
Knowledge in the energy sector
Comfortable with data analysis, modeling, and reporting tools.
Strong ability to bridge technical and non-technical discussions.
Curious, collaborative, and eager to contribute to the energy transition.




What we offer:




Our focus is to develop a long-term collaboration with our talented consultants. Therefore we invest in our people as of day one to support them into a blossoming career within Phinest.

Our Talent Management Services department (a.k.a TMS) is designed and fully dedicated to the development and well-being of our employees.




We also offer:




A company culture focused on well-being
A wide range of trainings and career development opportunities (certification, practical training)
A collaborative, dynamic and fulfilling working atmosphere with a supportive and collaborative team
The opportunity to work with a fast-growing firm and talented people
A competitive remuneration package with fringe benefits
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Teddy, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Context

The GM Tech Division is part of Bank Degroof Petercam’s Investment Banking / Global Markets department.

Its Activities Consist Mainly In


Project management and business analysis for strategic, regulatory or Life Cycle Management projects.
Deliver strategic and tactical improvements (systems and processes).
Data Science serving Global Markets and BDP:
Provide insights, predictions and analysis for better business decisions;
Increase automation and simplify processes;
Build a strong bridge with Chief Data Officer;
Reporting solutions to monitor performance.
Strengthen the cooperation with IT: clarify the “What” and challenge the “How”
Active participation in system architecture discussions
Deliver scalable and innovative solutions to remove dependency on End User Computing


Your position

As a member of the GM Tech team, you will:


Develop creative solutions to support the monitoring and reporting of GM activities.
Coordinate change requests on behalf of Global Markets
Gather, analyze and clarify business requirements.
Support GM in its regulatory and compliance obligations (ex. BCP, BIA, Critical Outsourcing assessments, user access review, etc.)
Identify improvement areas (technology and processes).
Actively participate to projects


Your profile


You have a bachelor’s degree in business administration, information technology, Finance or equivalent, with 3/5 years working experience.
You are passionate about technology and data with extended knowledge of Python (Django, AirFlow, DBT, ..) and SQL.
You are familiar or are attracted by the Financial Markets world.
You are curious and you learn fast.
You have strong analytical skills with an eye for details.
You are a creative problem solver, you take ownership.
Very good verbal and written skills in English and in the 2nd national language.
You have excellent communication and relationship management skills.
You are a real team player who can work in an autonomous way.


Our offer

For more than 150 years, Degroof Petercam has been a reference investment house. Entrepreneurship is our DNA, expertise is our fuel. You will become part of a company with highly skilled, talented and passionate experts that aim for nothing less than excellence. The impact of our work goes beyond profit by looking at business from a broader perspective, challenging those who want to intellectually. As a part of Indosuez Wealth Management and Crédit Agricole, we offer our people ongoing learning and development and mobility on an international scale.

In addition to our fascinating work environment, we also offer:


A broad offer of learning & development programs including a Degroof Petercam Academy for both professional and personal goals.
An attractive and market conform compensation package
Flexible working hours & teleworking
An Employee Social Engagement Program
Access to the same Private Banking Expertise as our clients

Title: Data analist
Description:
1 - Werken bij de VUB

Ben jij ons nieuw talentdat graag de tanden zet in data analyse en uitkijkt naar een volgende stap in je loopbaan?

VUB is steeds op zoek naar nieuw talent om samen mee te groeien!

De Vrije Universiteit Brussel staat al meer dan 50 jaar voor vrijheid, gelijk(waardig)heid en verbondenheid en dat leeft sterk op onze campussen bij zowel studenten als personeel. Bij de VUB vind je een diverse verzameling aan persoonlijkheden: innovators pur sang, maar vooral mensen die 100% hun authentieke zelf zijn. Met zo’n 4000 medewerkers zijn we de grootste Nederlandstalige werkgever, in de privésector, in Brussel; een internationale stad waarmee we ons maar al te graag verbinden en waar(rond) onze 4 campussen gelegen zijn.

In het algemeen strategisch plan van de universiteit wordt ICT gedefinieerd als een “key enabler” voor onderwijs en onderzoek. De VUB is zich bewust van de uitdagingen die op haar afkomen en plaatst daarom ICT en de modernisering van haar applicaties (Studentenadministratie, Onderzoeksadministratie, Finance, HR, …) hoog op de agenda. Ze investeerde bijvoorbeeld ook in het Nexus datacenter, dat de nieuwe Vlaamse Tier-1 supercomputer zal huisvesten.

2 - Functiebeschrijving

Situering

De Directie ICT telt in totaal een 100-tal medewerkers en is onderverdeeld in vijf afdelingen: Operations & Infrastructure, Service Center, Scientific Data & Compute, Applications en Office of the CIO. Als 'Data analist' maak je deel uit van het data-team dat valt binnen de afdeling Applications.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

Je rol is van cruciaal belang bij het ontsluiten van data uit verschillende applicaties, zoals het studentenadministratiesysteem, het onderzoeksinformatiesysteem, het HR-systeem, het gebouwenbeheersysteem en meer. Gegevens worden verzameld en opgeslagen in een geavanceerd datalake, en er wordt een gestructureerd datawarehouse gebouwd binnen het Azure-ecosysteem.

Als Data analist werk je nauw samen met onze business units om hun op data gebaseerde projecten tot leven te brengen in verschillende dashboards.

Een greep uit je taken


Business analyse: samen met andere leden van het datateam en de relevante business units functionele vereisten omzetten naar technische vereisten.
Bv, om het gevraagde dashboard of rapport te realiseren, welke data is nodig? Waar halen we die, en hoe halen we die op? Hoe moeten we de data interpreteren en transformeren? Welke bedrijfslogica moeten we toepassen?
Modelleren van data en data interfaces: semantische modellen, star schemes, datamart, ...
Bouwen van dashboards en rapporten: helpen bouwen van dashboards en rapporten in bijvoorbeeld PowerBI, met ondersteuning van de developers in het team, om aan de noden van de business te voldoen.
Bewaker van gegevensstandaarden: je speelt een cruciale rol bij de data governance (bv. handhaven van data kwaliteit, consistentie en beveiliging). Actieve deelname aan het bijwerken van deze normen maakt deel uit van je taken.
Documentatie en testen: je legt je toe op documentatie en helpt met het testen van dashboards en rapporten.
Innovatie in gegevensanalyse: je verkent en evalueert nieuwe mogelijkheden voor data-analyse en governance.


Je krijgt de kans om zowel zelfstandig als waardevol teamlid te werken en jouw expertise bij te dragen aan collectief succes.

3 - Profiel

Wat verwachten wij van jou?


Je hebt een bachelor of master diploma behaald of gelijkwaardig door ervaring.
Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands of het Engels.
Je hebt ervaring met datamodellen, databanken, API's en SQL.
Je gaat complexe vraagstukken niet uit de weg en je zoekt binnen een pakket naar de meest optimale oplossing.
Kennis van data analytics tools zoals PowerBI, en bijhorende query-talen zoals DAX of Power Query (M).
Je hebt ervaring met dataprojecten.
Technische expertise (programmeren, data pipelines, ...) is een plus.
Je houdt ervan om kwalitatieve oplossingen te zoeken en werkt zeer nauwkeurig.
Je weet jezelf te organiseren om doelgericht, proactief en efficiënt te handelen en neemt de nodige initiatieven.
Je bent stressbestendig en werkt resultaatgericht.
Je bent een flexibele teamplayer maar kan ook autonoom functioneren.


VUB wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de maatschappij waar ieders talent wordt gewaardeerd, ongeacht het gender, geslacht, leeftijd, religie, huidskleur, migratieachtergrond, functiebeperking en neurodiversiteit.

4 - Aanbod

Word jij onze nieuwe collega? 

Dan bieden we je een voltijds contract van onbepaalde duur aan met een bruto maandsalaris gekoppeld aan graad 8 of graad 9.

Het salaris is afhankelijk van je competenties en het aantal jaren relevante werkervaring.

Bij De VUB Garanderen We Een Open, Betrokken En Diverse Werkplek En Geven We Je Kansen Om Je Loopbaan (verder) Uit Te Bouwen. Daarnaast Geniet Je Van Voordelen Als


Uitgebreide thuiswerkmogelijkheden, een telewerkvergoeding en de tools om goed uitgerust thuis te kunnen werken;
Een open informele werkomgeving met aandacht voor je work-life balance, een uitzonderlijke verlofregeling met 35 verlofdagen, sluiting tussen Kerstmis en Nieuwjaar en 3 extra verlofdagen;
Een kosteloze hospitalisatie- en zeer mooie groepsverzekering met gewaarborgd inkomen; 
Maximale terugbetaling woon-werkverkeer met het openbaar vervoer en/of een fietsvergoeding;
Gevarieerde maaltijden in onze campusrestaurants aan een aantrekkelijk tarief;
Voordelige sportmogelijkheden, een gamma aan kortingen via Benefits@Work (in allerlei winkels, op vluchten, in tankstations, pretparken...) en Ecocheques;
Kinderdagverblijf vlak bij de campus, korting op vakantiekampen; 
De ruimte om je job-inhoud mee te vormen en voortdurend bij te leren via onze VUB-leerplatformen en opleidingen;
En tot slot: toffe collega's met een gezonde drive en een goed gevoel voor humor.


5 - Geïnteresseerd?

Spreekt deze job je aan?

Stel je dan kandidaat vóór 20 september via jobs.vub.be [en laad volgende documenten op: cv, motivatiebrief en diploma]

Ons Sollicitatieproces Ziet Er Als Volgt Uit

Stap 1: CV-screening door een van onze recruiters

Stap 2: Een vergelijkende proef, waar we naar je aanpak en inzicht peilen en waarmee we in kaart willen brengen wat al goed gaat en wat je nog moet leren.

Stap 3: Een jobinterview

Contacteer ons!

Vragen over de job zelf?

Contacteer reinout.roels@vub.be 

Vragen over de selectieprocedure en/of het aanbod?

Contacteer annelies.jongert@vub.be

Wil je graag weten hoe het is om te werken bij de VUB en wil je meer info over EUTOPIA?

Ga dan naar  jobs.vub.be   en ontdek alles over o.a. onze campussen, voordelen, strategische doelen en collega’s.

Lees ook verder over eutopia-university.eu als je meer wil weten over ons Europees netwerk van universiteiten.

6 - Kenmerken

Personeelsformatie: patr

Contract: Contract onbepaalde duur

Hoofeenheid: Directie ICT

Omvang: 1

Functie: Functioneel informatie beheerder

Gradengroep: 8-9

Wijze van begeven: werving
Show more
