  • Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands of het Engels.
  • Je hebt ervaring met datamodellen, databanken, API's en SQL.
  • Je gaat complexe vraagstukken niet uit de weg en je zoekt binnen een pakket naar de meest optimale oplossing.
  • Kennis van data analytics tools zoals PowerBI, en bijhorende query-talen zoals DAX of Power Query (M).
  • Je hebt ervaring met dataprojecten.
  • Technische expertise (programmeren, data pipelines, ...) is een plus.
  • Je houdt ervan om kwalitatieve oplossingen te zoeken en werkt zeer nauwkeurig.
  • Je weet jezelf te organiseren om doelgericht, proactief en efficiënt te handelen en neemt de nodige initiatieven.
  • Je bent stressbestendig en werkt resultaatgericht.
  • Je bent een flexibele teamplayer maar kan ook autonoom functioneren.

VUB wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de maatschappij waar ieders talent wordt gewaardeerd, ongeacht het gender, geslacht, leeftijd, religie, huidskleur, migratieachtergrond, functiebeperking en neurodiversiteit.

4 - Aanbod

Word jij onze nieuwe collega? 

Dan bieden we je een voltijds contract van onbepaalde duur aan met een bruto maandsalaris gekoppeld aan graad 8 of graad 9.

Het salaris is afhankelijk van je competenties en het aantal jaren relevante werkervaring.

Bij De VUB Garanderen We Een Open, Betrokken En Diverse Werkplek En Geven We Je Kansen Om Je Loopbaan (verder) Uit Te Bouwen. Daarnaast Geniet Je Van Voordelen Als

  • Uitgebreide thuiswerkmogelijkheden, een telewerkvergoeding en de tools om goed uitgerust thuis te kunnen werken;
  • Een open informele werkomgeving met aandacht voor je work-life balance, een uitzonderlijke verlofregeling met 35 verlofdagen, sluiting tussen Kerstmis en Nieuwjaar en 3 extra verlofdagen;
  • Een kosteloze hospitalisatie- en zeer mooie groepsverzekering met gewaarborgd inkomen; 
  • Maximale terugbetaling woon-werkverkeer met het openbaar vervoer en/of een fietsvergoeding;
  • Gevarieerde maaltijden in onze campusrestaurants aan een aantrekkelijk tarief;
  • Voordelige sportmogelijkheden, een gamma aan kortingen via Benefits@Work (in allerlei winkels, op vluchten, in tankstations, pretparken...) en Ecocheques;
  • Kinderdagverblijf vlak bij de campus, korting op vakantiekampen; 
  • De ruimte om je job-inhoud mee te vormen en voortdurend bij te leren via onze VUB-leerplatformen en opleidingen;
  • En tot slot: toffe collega's met een gezonde drive en een goed gevoel voor humor.

5 - Geïnteresseerd?

Spreekt deze job je aan?

Stel je dan kandidaat vóór 20 september via jobs.vub.be [en laad volgende documenten op: cv, motivatiebrief en diploma]

Ons Sollicitatieproces Ziet Er Als Volgt Uit

Stap 1: CV-screening door een van onze recruiters

Stap 2: Een vergelijkende proef, waar we naar je aanpak en inzicht peilen en waarmee we in kaart willen brengen wat al goed gaat en wat je nog moet leren.

Stap 3: Een jobinterview

Contacteer ons!

Vragen over de job zelf?

Contacteer reinout.roels@vub.be 

Vragen over de selectieprocedure en/of het aanbod?

Contacteer annelies.jongert@vub.be

Wil je graag weten hoe het is om te werken bij de VUB en wil je meer info over EUTOPIA?

Ga dan naar  jobs.vub.be   en ontdek alles over o.a. onze campussen, voordelen, strategische doelen en collega’s.

Lees ook verder over eutopia-university.eu als je meer wil weten over ons Europees netwerk van universiteiten.

6 - Kenmerken

Personeelsformatie: patr

Contract: Contract onbepaalde duur

Hoofeenheid: Directie ICT

Omvang: 1

Functie: Functioneel informatie beheerder

Gradengroep: 8-9

Wijze van begeven: werving

Title: Internship in Data Analytics
Description:
The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. It employs roughly 418,000 associates worldwide (as of December 31, 2024). The company generated sales of 90.3 billion euros in 2024. Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. With its business activities, the company aims to use technology to help shape universal trends such as automation, electrification, digitalization, connectivity, and an orientation to sustainability. In this context, Bosch's broad diversification across regions and industries strengthens its innovativeness and robustness. Bosch uses its proven expertise in sensor technology, software, and services to offer customers cross-domain solutions from a single source. It also applies its expertise in connectivity and artificial intelligence in order to develop and manufacture user-friendly, sustainable products. With technology that is “Invented for life,” Bosch wants to help improve quality of life and conserve natural resources.


You will be working as a Data Analytics Intern in the Business Intelligence department at Bosch Thermotechnology in Mechelen.
Your main responsibility will be to further develop and maintain the 360-degree view of our customers, which will be used to steer the departments (Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, etc).
You will support in projects and process optimization.
You will maintain and harmonize the data present in different applications.
You will be responsible for several Sales reports (in Power BI and Excel) and may be asked to conduct several analyses.
Currently studying Data Analytics, Statistics, International Business Management, Marketing, Economical Studies at a Bachelor's or Masters level.
Fluent in English. Dutch or French is a plus.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Good knowledge of Excel and Power BI
Good knowledge of Python, SQL, Alteryx, KNIME and/or data modelling is a plus


What's in for you?


A competitive renumeration.
Professional development in one of Europe's leading global tech and innovation companies.
Growth of professional network across European Institutions and Brussels policy community.
A learning opportunity to develop critical policy skills and gain practical knowledge about industry, technology, innovation and public funding dynamics.


If you are a student enrolled in a University/College (or if you are available for a voluntary internship outside a university curriculum) you will be granted an allowance of € 1056,00/month.

If you want to apply for a voluntary internship, you must be a citizen of the EU or have a work permit in Belgium.

In case that you need to do a mandatory internship, your University/College must be located in a member state of the EU.

Ready to Take the Next Step?

If you're eager to make a difference and gain hands-on experience, we want to hear from you! Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Bosch in Brussels!

Join us and be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and growth!

Don't worry if you don't meet every single requirement—if you're passionate and believe you can contribute to our team, we encourage you to apply! Your unique perspective and enthusiasm could be just what we're looking for.

We are looking forward to receiving your application by email in English. Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any further questions.

Starting date: October 2025

Duration: 6 months

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Title: Data Analyst - no Experience Required
Description:
For thousands of years, MAPS have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a MAPS Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

Your responsabilities


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct.
You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately, resulting in better user experiences.
With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office.
The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.
So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge, a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Job requirements


Must be living in Belgium for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, MAP applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.


Ideal candidate:


Fluent in English and Dutch
Excellent research skills
Excellent local knowledge of your home country
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Belgium
Analytical mindset


Benefits


Work up to 20 hours per week
Earn a competitive rate of pay
Develop your research skills
Avoid the long commute
Work from the comfort of your home office
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours


Apply online today!

Title: Reward Data Analyst
Description:
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Our Reward Team helps clients navigate the
total reward landscape in a tailor-made and result-oriented way. From
developing rewards strategy to implementing innovative solutions such as the EU
Pay Transparency Directive. They bring together the right mix of expertise—covering
everything from reward, tax & legal, employee communication, to tech and
process.

Role Summary: 

As a Rewards Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in
supporting our clients' rewards and compensation & benefits strategies. You
will leverage your analytical skills and statistical expertise to
provide insights and solutions that drive pay transparency and equity. This
position offers an exciting opportunity to work with a multidisciplinary team
and contribute to impactful projects that shape the future of reward systems.

Key Responsibilities:

Conduct comprehensive reward & compensation
analyses using statistical methods and regression models.
Pivotal member of our pay equity & transparency
team (see more information: Pay
Transparency and Pay Equity)
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to
implement pay equity & transparency initiatives.
Utilise R and Python for data analysis and
visualisation to support reward strategies.
Assist in the development of tailored reward
programs that align with organisational goals.
Prepare detailed reports and presentations to
communicate findings and recommendations.
Support the implementation of innovative
solutions such as the EU Pay Transparency Directive.

Let’s Talk About You!

At least 1 – 3 years (junior profile) or 4 - 6 years (senior profile) of experience in data analytics.

Experience in applying statistical techniques

Experience working with R, Python and Power BI.

Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably one additional language (Dutch or French).

Strong analytical skills with proficiency in compensation analysis, market benchmarking tools, benefits management systems, Excel, PowerPoint, HRIS, and data visualisation tools.

Demonstrated ability to think strategically, innovate, provide high-impact solutions, and effectively manage projects to successful completion.


Global Employer Services (GES) team is fully aware today’s digital revolution is rapidly rewriting the environment for employers and their global workforces. The need for mobility is greater than ever. We help our clients achieve control, gain perspective, and lead with confidence through this period of uncertainty and technological change. Our professionals focus on providing personal tax, compensation & benefits and international assignment/HR services to our clients. We assist our clients to streamline their HR, Mobility and Rewards programs, while managing tax effectiveness, compliance and employment costs, both in a global and domestic context.
Reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll advisory designed just for you! Our professionals help you design cost-effective, tax-efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs.
Our story - Global Employer Services (GES)
In today's digital revolution, the environment for employers and their (global) workforces is rapidly evolving, with an increased need for adaptability. The GES team is dedicated to helping clients navigate these challenges with confidence, providing expertise in rewards, compensation & benefits, personal tax and international assignment/HR services.
Our focus is on streamlining HR, Rewards and Mobility programs to ensure effectiveness, compliance, and cost management in both global and domestic contexts. We offer specialised advisory services in reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll, tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.
Our professionals are committed to designing cost-effective, efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs. We are here to support your journey towards pay transparency and equity, ensuring your compensation strategies are both attractive to employees and beneficial for your business.

Why work in GES?

Passion: Driven by a love for mobility, payroll, and rewards services, crafting both local and global solutions in a sustainable way.

People-focused: Working with and for people. Investing in coaching, learning, and developing the team, making sure everyone grows.

Professionalism: Delivering excellence as a united team, ensuring success for their clients and for each other.


Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:


My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities

Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte

Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte

Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte

Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities


Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality

Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).

Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead
Description:
📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)




At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.




Your Mission:

Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.




What You Bring:

4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.




Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.




This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.




If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.




Full job description & application details here.




Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤖 The Job

As a Data Analyst within Dataroots, you'll be a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll display your passion for translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

Your role will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.




✅ Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various sources.
Optimize data processes and workflows for efficiency and scalability.
Support data-driven decision-making by providing actionable recommendations.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business processes.
Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in data analytics.




🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fueled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.




Job requirements




🔎 The profile

You have at least 2 years experience.
You have worked on a data visualisation project in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.




💪 The Skills

You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have experience in working with Power BI in a professional setting.
You have experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R and cloud platforms AWS, GCP and Azure.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You possess both strong technical abilities and soft skills to align technical- and business stakeholders and drive change.
You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
You speak fluent English and either Dutch or French.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...
Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Ready for a new chapter as a Data Analyst at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! 🎉

🤖 The Job

As a Data Analyst within Dataroots, you'll be a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll display your passion for translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

Your role will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.

Title: Data Analyst Senior (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI / Datamarts)
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Analyst with strong reverse-engineering skills to support a major strategic project: the replacement of the current Data Vault. This role is central to modernizing and securing the organization’s data infrastructure, ensuring better traceability, higher quality, and more efficient data flows.




You’ll work closely with BI, Data Engineering, and business teams to untangle complex data chains and improve how information is modeled, documented, and delivered.




What you’ll do

Analyze Power BI reports to identify semantic models, DAX measures, transformations, and data sources.
Reconstruct data flows back to datamarts and source databases.
Document data models, ETL transformations, and dependencies.
Collaborate with technical and business teams to validate flows and propose optimizations.
Contribute to data governance (traceability, quality, GDPR/security).
Suggest improvements in modeling, query performance, and report structures.
Support migration or evolution of source systems.




What are we looking for?

You hold a university degree in computer science, data science, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in BI or data analysis, with proven work in complex Power BI environments.
Advanced knowledge of Power BI (DAX, data models, paginated reports).
Strong skills in SQL and relational databases (SQL Server, Azure SQL).
Familiarity with BI concepts (Kimball, Data Vault).
Ability to interpret ETL flows and complex data models.
Experience in technical documentation and collaborative environments (Git).
Analytical mindset, rigor, autonomy, and good communication skills.
Languages: French or Dutch (native/bilingual) + English (professional level).




What do we offer?

Location: Hybrid (on-site in Brussels or Braine-l’Alleud on certain days)

Start: ASAP

Duration: Until 31/12/2025 (4-month contract, with possibility to extend)

Workload: Full-time

Terms: Freelance or CDD

Show more

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Sopra Steria biedt op maat gemaakte end-to-end corporate technolgy en software solutions aan die organisaties helpen gedurfde keuzes te maken en resultaten te boeken. En met succes! Met meer dan 51.000 collega’s in bijna 30 landen behoren we tot de top van de Europese digital solutions leveranciers. Succesvolle organisaties in Europa vertrouwen op onze technologie omdat we blijven streven naar innovatie, samenwerking en zakelijke ontwikkeling.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Vacatureomschrijving

Als Data Analyst bij Sopra Steria speel je een cruciale rol in het begeleiden van klanten uit diverse sectoren tijdens hun gehele datatraject. Je helpt klanten bij het transformeren van hun dataprocessen. Door klantbehoeften grondig te analyseren en te begrijpen, weet je hun eisen te vertalen naar datasolutions. Dankzij jouw innovatieve aanpak lever je impactvolle analyses die efficiënte, gebruiksgerichte oplossingen opleveren. Met jouw expertise en advies over de volledige datawaardeketen zorg je voor een succesvolle implementatie en ondersteuning van het diverse portfolio aan dataservices van Sopra Steria.

Functie-eisen

We zijn op zoek naar gepassioneerde collega’s die graag de grenzen willen verleggen op het gebied van digitale transformatie en technologie consulting. Bij Sopra Steria krijg je de kans om te werken aan impactvolle projecten en je vaardigheden te ontwikkelen in een constructieve team omgeving. Jij wilt tot de besten behoren. Dat is waarom jij altijd naar manieren zoekt om jouw kennis uit te breiden en op de hoogte te blijven van de laatste trends en ontwikkelingen. Hou je van een uitdaging en vind je jezelf in (de meeste van) deze criteria? Dan kijken we nu al uit naar jouw sollicitatie.

Je beschikt over kennis en ervaring in het volgende:


Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Data Engineer of Data Analyst.
Je ondersteunt klanten in hun datatransformatie, met focus op data-architectuur, datastrategie en -governance, datatransformatie, datafundamenten en meer.
Op basis van jouw advies over de volledige datawaardeketen zorg je ervoor dat het relevante dienstenportfolio van Sopra Steria wordt geïmplementeerd en ondersteund.
Je verzamelt, analyseert en vertaalt de klantvraag naar zinvolle dataoplossingen.
Je hebt kennis en ervaring met databases en datamodellering.
Je hebt goede kennis en ervaring met SQL.
Kennis van een programmeertaal zoals Python is een pluspunt.
Je beschikt over analytisch denkvermogen, communicatieve vaardigheden en een pragmatische ingesteldheid.
Je spreekt vlot Engels; kennis van Nederlands en/of Frans is een vereiste.


Dit mag je verwachten

Je zal deel uitmaken van een grote naam in de tech wereld die bekendstaat voor consulting, digital services en softwareontwikkeling. Je begeeft je tussen high-level professionals die durven in te zetten om hoge resultaten te behalen.

Daarnaast maak je deel uit van ons Data & AI-team, waar we bedrijven en instellingen ondersteunen om meer datagedreven te worden. We helpen onze klanten om hun operationele efficiëntie te verhogen en impact te creëren met data.

We bieden een volledig portfolio aan diensten en oplossingen om organisaties te ontzorgen in elke stap van hun transitie: van het definiëren en uitvoeren van de datastrategie en governance, over het opzetten van dataplatformen, tot het visualiseren van dashboards en het toepassen van de nieuwste methoden op het gebied van data science en artificiële intelligentie.

Aanvullende informatie

Klaar voor de volgende stap in je carrière? Dan wijzen we je graag in de juiste richting. Met kantoren in bijna 30 landen die je leiden naar plaatsen waar je nog nooit bent geweest. Wil je liever intern groeien? Ook dat is mogelijk. We dagen je uit om jezelf te blijven uitdagen en zo telkens de beste versie van jezelf te zijn.

We bieden een aantrekkelijk voordelenpakket, waaronder:


Een waaier aan extralegale voordelen, zoals mobiliteitsopties (inclusief een bedrijfswagen), verzekeringsdekking, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques en meer.
Voortdurende leermogelijkheden via de Sopra Steria Academy zodat je je professioneel kan blijven ontwikkelen.
De kans om je collega’s van Sopra Steria te ontmoeten tijdens diverse teamevents.


Lijkt deze job iets voor jou?

Ben je klaar om met ons de wereld vorm te geven? Fantastisch! We kijken nu al uit naar jouw sollicitatie.

______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.

Je zal deel uitmaken van een grote naam in de tech wereld die bekendstaat voor consulting, digital services en softwareontwikkeling. Je begeeft je tussen high-level professionals die durven in te zetten om hoge resultaten te behalen.

Daarnaast maak je deel uit van ons Data & AI-team, waar we bedrijven en instellingen ondersteunen om meer datagedreven te worden. We helpen onze klanten om hun operationele efficiëntie te verhogen en impact te creëren met data.

We bieden een volledig portfolio aan diensten en oplossingen om organisaties te ontzorgen in elke stap van hun transitie: van het definiëren en uitvoeren van de datastrategie en governance, over het opzetten van dataplatformen, tot het visualiseren van dashboards en het toepassen van de nieuwste methoden op het gebied van data science en artificiële intelligentie.

Aanvullende informatie

Klaar voor de volgende stap in je carrière? Dan wijzen we je graag in de juiste richting. Met kantoren in bijna 30 landen die je leiden naar plaatsen waar je nog nooit bent geweest. Wil je liever intern groeien? Ook dat is mogelijk. We dagen je uit om jezelf te blijven uitdagen en zo telkens de beste versie van jezelf te zijn.

We bieden een aantrekkelijk voordelenpakket, waaronder:

  • Een waaier aan extralegale voordelen, zoals mobiliteitsopties (inclusief een bedrijfswagen), verzekeringsdekking, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques en meer.
  • Voortdurende leermogelijkheden via de Sopra Steria Academy zodat je je professioneel kan blijven ontwikkelen.
  • De kans om je collega’s van Sopra Steria te ontmoeten tijdens diverse teamevents.

Lijkt deze job iets voor jou?

Ben je klaar om met ons de wereld vorm te geven? Fantastisch! We kijken nu al uit naar jouw sollicitatie.

______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.

We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.

Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.

The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:


Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.


Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.

The program

Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.

Role ID – 2025-0278

Role Duties And Responsibilities


Develop Power BI Dashboards and Reports
design and build a set of interactive dashboards in Power BI Desktop, following specifications provided by the Purchaser. Dashboards are expected to provide clear insights, intuitive navigation, and alignment with stakeholder reporting needs;
deliverables should directly support decision-making in Finance, Procurement, Project, and Asset Management domains;
where appropriate, create mock-ups or wireframes of dashboards and reports to validate design choices with stakeholders before full development. This ensures clarity of expectations and reduces rework.
Implementation of Data Models and Measures
support the design, creation and optimization of Power BI data sets, including relationships and measures, to ensure accurate KPI calculations;
apply best practices to optimize refresh times, maintain integrity, and ensure scalability of solutions.
Application of Visualization and Performance Standards
apply recognized best practices in layout, usability, and performance tuning. Dashboards should be consistent in look-and-feel, easy to interpret, and responsive under normal usage conditions.
Delivery of Documentation and User Guidance
prepare lightweight but clear documentation describing the data model, key measures, and visual design logic;
where appropriate, short user navigation guides will also be produced to support adoption and knowledge transfer.
Production of Functional Specifications and User Stories
translate clarified business needs into structured functional specifications, user stories and acceptance criteria that can be directly used by developers. These outputs will serve as the basis for development, ensuring requirements are testable, traceable, and prioritized.
Support Testing and Validation Activities
support the preparation of test cases for BI deliverables, including validation of critical data sets and KPIs;
assist the project team and stakeholders in validating deliverables against requirements;
conduct basic SQL-based data checks and participate in dashboard walkthroughs to confirm the accuracy and completeness of outputs ensuring that business expectations are reflected in both the data and the dashboard outputs.
Facilitation of Stakeholder Alignment and Approvals
collaborate closely with business users and project sponsors to collect inputs, clarify objectives, and refine incomplete or evolving requirements;
manage alignment sessions to review clarified requirements and specifications with stakeholders;
ensure that stakeholder perspectives are captured and transformed into actionable BI deliverables;
formal agreement and sign-off will be sought to confirm readiness for development.
Coordinate Delivery Tracking and JIRA Updates
support tracking of deliverables through JIRA by updating and maintaining JIRA tickets with structured requirements, ensuring the backlog is clear, organized, and current. This also includes coordinating with the development team to track progress, changes and testing results;
ensure visibility of progress and timely identification of risks;
ensure transparency of work throughout execution.

Essential Skills, Experience And Certifications


5 years+ as a Power BI Developer in a reporting environment.
2 years+ Proven experience as a Business Analyst, BI Analyst, or Project Coordinator in a data or reporting environment.
2 years+ Extensive knowledge of the business processes in the area of Finance, Procurement, Project and Asset Management.
2 years+ working experience using SQL to create queries, understand and validate data logic together with basic use of SQL tools (e.g. MS SQL Management Studio, SQL Developer).
2 years+ expertise in Power BI tools, Power BI Desktop specifically (data modelling, dashboard development, KPI development).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Working knowledge of JIRA (basic).
Excellent communication and facilitation skills, particularly in requirements gathering and documentation.
Strong organizational skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Desirable Skills, Experience And Certifications


Experience working in institutional or public sector environments with formal governance structures.
Understanding of BI project lifecycles: from requirements to delivery to UAT.
Prior experience of working in an international environment comprising both military and civilian elements.
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum practices in a BI or analytics context.
Prior experience of working in Agile development methodologies.
Prior experience of working in an international environment comprising both military and civilian elements.
Knowledge of NATO responsibilities and organization, including ACO and ACT.
A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable.


Language Proficiency


Full proficiency in the English language.


Working Location


Braine L’Alleud, Belgium


Working Policy


30% On-site and 70% Off-site


Travel


Some travel to other NATO sites may be required


Security Clearance


Valid National or NATO Secret personal security clearance


We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
HTML:
e5 is een puur Belgisch familiebedrijf dat in 1979 werd opgericht als een pionier in betaalbare mode voor dames en heren. Onze doelstelling is om iedereen te laten stralen door kwalitatieve Belgische mode met een excellente service op maat aan te bieden.

Sinds 2021 schrijft e5 een nieuw verhaal met de nieuwe familiale eigenaars die naast passie voor het metier ook opnieuw groeiambities hebben.

Met 56 winkels en een webshop speelt e5 een hoofdrol in de Belgische fashion retail. e5 staat voor comfy, stijlvolle en trendy kleren die iedereen laten stralen. Daarmee kan jij op elk moment en voor elke gelegenheid helemaal je eigen verhaal schrijven. Zoals jij het wil. In stijl. Wij willen dat onze klanten én onze medewerkers zich goed voelen bij e5. Daarom heerst een aangename en ongedwongen werksfeer waar iedereen zichzelf mag zijn. Hier krijg je de kans om je talenten te ontplooien en deel uit te maken van een betrokken en gemotiveerd team.

Onze values : Samen, pragmatisch, enthousiast, echt goed en durvend!

Werk je graag met digitale tools, duik je moeiteloos in klantgedrag en krijg je energie van het optimaliseren van campagnes? Dan ben jij misschien wel onze nieuwe Marketing Data Analyst!

Bij e5 zorg jij ervoor dat onze marketing slim, persoonlijk en datagedreven is. Van klantsegmentatie tot het verbeteren van nieuwsbrieven en het voorspellen van omzet— jij draait mee in het hart van onze marketingmachine.


Marketing Data Analyst@ e5, what is it ?


Als Marketing Data Analyst bij e5 adviseer je het management proactief over de kansen en verbeteringen in het gebruik van klanten & mediadata. Met jouw analyses adviseer je hen over te benaderen doelgroepen en te voeren campagnes. Of het nu gaat over het recruteren van nieuwe klanten, het verlagen van churn of het optimaliseren van de online newsletters en campagnes, jij weet de slimme manieren hoe je geld verdient met data en zorgt voor een gepersonaliseerde aanpak.


Verder bevat de functie de volgende verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Het samenstellen van selecties van klantgroepen voor de direct marketingactiviteiten;
  • Het mee opstellen van klantsegmentaties en klantwaarde modellen;
  • Het verhogen van de klantwaarde. Jij ziet het niet alleen als jouw doel om meer klanten te winnen, maar de bestaande klanten ook te behouden;
  • Het berekenen en inschatten van geplande DM en emailcampagnes in functie van het te realiseren budget; alsook het forecasten van de mogelijke jaaromzet te halen uit de actieve klanten;
  • Het mee in kaart brengen van de customer journey van de klant;
  • Het opleveren van standaardrapportages op de marketingactiviteiten en het creëren van diverse nieuwe rapportages met het oog op het verbeteren van de ROI van de marketingcampagnes (zowel on- als offline);
  • Het verhogen van de performance van off- en online campagnes op basis van data. Je volgt het (aankoop)gedrag van klanten en doet op basis daarvan aanpassingen;
  • Het verder ontwikkelen en verbeteren van de marketing automation tool;
  • Het bewaken en optimaliseren van de datakwaliteit van onze klantendata.


Can you feel it?


  • Je hebt een Master, bij voorkeur Econometrie, Economie, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde of Marketing Analytics;
  • Ervaring van 4+ jaar in een data-analist functie, waaruit blijkt dat je in staat bent om data-gedreven besluitvorming te stimuleren en meetbare resultaten te leveren;
  • Uitstekende communicatie- en presentatievaardigheden om complexe data-inzichten effectief over te brengen aan zowel technisch als niet-technisch publiek;
  • Je bent dynamisch, proactief en communicatief met een innovatieve mindset;
  • Gevorderde vaardigheid in SQL voor datamanipulatie, -analyse en -modellering. Ervaring met tools voor datavisualisatie (bijv. Tableau, Power BI, Looker) om indrukwekkende dashboards en rapporten te maken;
  • Kennis van de detailhandel (idealiter mode) en e-commerce is een sterke troef;
  • Kennis van Adobe Campaign, Adobe/Google Analytics, Nosto, Looker Studio;
  • Bekendheid met statistische analysetechnieken, machine learning algoritmen en A/B testing;
  • Sterke kennis van datawarehousing en ETL / ELT processen;
  • Ervaring met cloud-gebaseerde dataplatformen (Google Cloud is een grote pluspunt) of big data technologieën.


Beschik je ook nog over volgende capaciteiten?

Dan ben je zeker onze ideale kandidaat!

  • Sterke probleemoplossende en analytische vaardigheden met het vermogen om kritisch en creatief te denken;
  • Het vermogen om effectief samen te werken met cross-functionele teams en om sterke relaties op te bouwen met belanghebbenden. Zelfgemotiveerd en proactief met het vermogen om zelfstandig te werken en “ownership” te nemen voor projecten;
  • Passie voor data en een drive om voortdurend te leren en trends in de sector voor te blijven. Sterke aandacht voor detail en streven naar nauwkeurigheid.


What's in it for you ?


  • Een afwisselende job waarbinnen je zelfstandig kan werken;
  • Een contract voor onbepaalde duur binnen een dynamische fashion bedrijf;
  • Een marktconform salarispakket inclusief extra-legale voordelen.

Title: Internship Data Analytics
Description:
Looking for a challenging internship in Data Analysis, starting in January, February or March 2026? It’s time to apply!

Who are we?

At Unilever, we share one simple purpose: To make sustainable living commonplace. Through our powerhouse brands such as Dove, Axe and Lipton, we are creating a bright future for our business and our planet – and you can be part of it!

 

We believe that companies with purpose last, people with purpose thrive and brands with purpose grow.  We meet every day needs for nutrition, hygiene and personal care with brands that help people feel good, look good and get more out of life.

Main Purpose Of The Internship

When joining Unilever in Belgium, you will get the opportunity to have an impact on a leading-edge company and our outstanding brands. During this internship you will get real responsibilities that will provide you with a good insight into the organisation and support your personal development.

Our Data Analysis team ensures that Unilever’s brands are available to its consumers and customers all over the world. During this internship you will gain a deep understanding of the business and the many challenges it faces, and you will learn how to make a success out of a product in a fast-paced environment.

Your Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities Could Be (amongst Others)


Collaborating in data driven project
Collecting and cleaning up data to ensure quality is up to standard
Thinking collectively on how to present the analysis best towards our business colleagues and external stakeholders
Collaborating in maintaining and optimizing the Sell/Out In database
Collaborating in perfect store online project
Business process optimisation


What We Ask


You must be enrolled as a Bachelor or Master student from a University, Business School or equivalent during the entire internship.
You are available for a minimum of 3 months and ideally for 6 months (at least 32 hours a week).
You are fluent in English + Dutch or French.
You are a team player with a strong sense of responsibility.
You are a self-starter, able to work autonomously.
You are a pro-active and dynamic person, able to anticipate the needs of your team.
You are curious, eager to learn new things and to explore new ideas and approaches to solving challenges.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and feel comfortable with data analysis.
You are able to work with a diversity of people and teams.
You are familiar with MS office tools in particular Excel and Powerpoint.
Experience with Power BI is a big plus!


What We Offer


An outstanding chance to bring our unique purpose to life!
An opportunity to take a look behind the scenes at one of the biggest FMCG-corporations in the world.
An opportunity to learn from a variety of concrete projects.
A wealth of experience, where you will be at the heart of the business.
Lots of responsibility, but also good guidance during your internship.


EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE?

 

To apply, please send your CV and a motivation letter where your preferred internship topics, internship duration and ideal start date are highlighted.

 

We look forward to meeting you!

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department)
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following

  • Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
  • Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
  • Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
  • Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
  • Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
  • Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
  • Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis

Skills & Expertise

  • Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
  • Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
  • Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
  • Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
  • You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
  • Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English

What We Offer You

  • The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
  • An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
  • Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
  • A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
  • A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
  • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
  • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

Title: Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.


Your profile

We are looking for someone who :


Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.Is eligible for security clearance.


Success in this role often comes down to :


Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.


Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:


A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.


Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Forensic Investigations
Description:
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us
Do you want to sharpen your profile in the field of Financial Advisory – Forensic and broaden your horizons in interdisciplinary projects? Our team ensures the investigation and prevention of financial and white-collar crime across all industries. Secure our joint success and make a difference with us: as a Experienced Consultant Data Analyst Forensic.
Location: Brussels, Belgium
Your impact:
As an Experienced Consultant Forensic, you will support the reappraisal of financial and white-collar crime as well as their prevention - and thus contribute to the security and business viability of companies.
Investigation: You will support us in conducting special investigations in cases of economic and corporate crime.
Dispute and Litigation: To this end, you will prepare expert opinions on accounting law or business management issues for legal disputes, for example.
Fraud Prevention: You will be actively involved in the design and implementation of preventive measures as well as the improvement of internal processes and control systems.
Innovative approaches: In addition, you will develop solutions with us that take into account current and future customer needs and offer significant added value.
Teamwork: You will work with other Deloitte Practices in Belgium and abroad on an interdisciplinary basis and take on responsible tasks at an early stage.


Let's talk about you
Your skillset:
Degree  business engineer,  economics, business informatics or a comparable course of study successfully completed
Proficiency in advanced data analytics techniques and tools (e.g., statistical modeling, data mining, machine learning) with the ability to apply these skills to complex business problems.
Ideally, initial practical experience in the areas of forensic, compliance, audit, tax consulting, accounting or controlling
High self-motivation, Independence and enjoyment of complex issues and conceptual tasks
Strong team orientation, good presentation and communication skills
Willingness to travel as well as very good written and spoken Dutch and English

Your chance:

Best-in-class continuing education at Deloitte University as well as within the framework of individual qualification offers and training courses
Comprehensive development opportunities through structured career planning, inclusive leadership, secondment programs, project-based job rotation as well as promotion of social commitment and corporate volunteering
Work-life balance thanks to mobile working & part-time, sabbaticals and family services, e.g. to support family caregivers, parental leave counselling and much more
Focus on health and fitness through regular health days, cooperation with fitness providers and support for sports and team events
Attractive employer benefits including bike and car leasing, company smartphone for private use and flexible working models such as trust-based working hours and EU remote working
Diverse creative freedom and active promotion of an inclusive corporate culture - including through our Diversity & Inclusion employee networks
Our Risk, Regulatory & Forensic practice is a global leader in helping clients manage risk and uncertainty from the boardroom to the network. We provide a broad array of services that allow our clients around the world to better measure, manage and control risk to enhance the reliability of systems and processes throughout their organization.



Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:



My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities


Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte


Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte


Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte


Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities




Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:



Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).


Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.




Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!
Show more

Title: E&BI Insights Monitoring Partner
Description:
We are looking for a E&BI Insights Monitoring Partner who is detail-oriented, collaborative, and proactive to join our Ethics & Business Integrity team, based at our HQ office, in Brussels, Belgium.




About The Role

You will be working in a team that ensures ethical business practices as the owner of the E&BI global monitoring program. Your work will help identify process gaps, mitigate risks, support transparency, and strengthen compliance across the organization.




Who You’ll Work With

You will be part of the Ethics & Business Integrity team, collaborating closely with local leads and external monitoring vendors. You’ll also engage with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement.




What You’ll Do

Manage external vendors conducting monitoring activities, including sample selection, quality checks, and regular reviews
Share monitoring results and insights with local leads to support compliance and transparency
Conduct centralized monitoring and analytics aligned with the annual monitoring plan
Support decentralized monitoring in collaboration with local teams
Collect and analyze data to generate dashboards and insights on monitoring results
Contribute to the development of analytics methodologies and implementation of tools




Interested? For this role we’re looking for the following education, experience and skills

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field
3+ years of experience in compliance, risk management, or a related function
Strong knowledge of global healthcare regulatory standards and compliance monitoring
Excellent organizational and project management skills, including vendor coordination
Strong communication skills and ability to work independently with discretion
Experience in data analytics and tools such as Qlik or Power BI




Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!




About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.




Why work with us?

At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equal opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions will be made without regard to any characteristic protected by applicable laws.




Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Show more
