Title: BI Analyst.
Description:
BI Analyst

Afin de supporter l’entreprise dans sa transformation BI, le Data Office d’AXA Belgium est à la recherche d’un BI Analyst au sein de l’équipe de Transformation BI.

L’équipe de Transformation BI fait partie du Data Office d’AXA. Elle s’occupe de la définition et de la mise en place de la gouvernance BI au sein d’AXA, de la promotion à l’utilisation des assets transversaux existants dans l’enterprise data warehouse et la création de nouvelles sources sur base des besoins en synthétisant les attentes des différentes BU’s et fournit des formations sur les bonnes pratiques de reporting, modélisation de données et gestion de la performance.

En étroite collaboration avec les clients internes et les développeurs BI (Azure Analysis Services, SQL), les analystes fonctionnels Data et les data engineers:


Vous menez des projets de reporting :
Vous supportez un ou plusieurs projets de reporting avec une attention particulière à l’analyse et communication des priorités, risques, problèmes, agendas & résultats.
Vous menez les entretiens avec les clients internes (équipes de direction et middle management) afin de comprendre comment traduire la stratégie d’AXA en indicateurs pertinents et n’hésitez pas à les challenger
Vous garantissez l’acceptance commune de ces indicateurs par les différents acteurs avec lesquels vous interagissez sur un projet
Vous êtes le garant des bonnes pratiques d’exploitations des données, de construction de modèles efficients et de l’utilisation des reportings tools
Vous communiquez régulièrement avec le sponsor business et toutes les parties prenantes des projets. Vous donnez régulièrement du feedback, des mises à jour et des présentations.
Vous supportez la définition et transformation de la gouvernance BI
Dans un premier temps, vous aidez à la définition de la gouvernance BI au sein d’AXA et réfléchissez avec l’équipe à sa mise en pratique
Vous participez aux réflexions concernant le développement d’un enterprise data model ‘target’ qui soit le plus transversal possible et permette des utilisations tant pour le reporting que pour les analyses de statistiques avancées et d’intelligence artificielle
Vous donnez des formations aux développeurs BI et analystes fonctionnels concernant les bonnes pratiques à respecter en termes de modélisation de données pour le reporting en assurant une réutilisation des modèles qui puisse être transversale au sein d’AXA
Vous faites partie des réflexions concernant l’établissement d’une BIG Picture des assets transversaux existants et des liens permettant une exploitation simple de ceux-ci, d’un reporting glossary et le développement du data glossary. Vous vous assurez aussi de leur adoption par le business.
Vous animez la BI community qui rassemble les utilisateurs des équipes de reporting décentralisées afin de partager les expériences et faire converger les différentes BU’s sur les meilleurs pratiques en termes d’utilisation des données et publication des informations.


Pour les projets BI dont vous êtes responsable, vous devez assurer la livraison, dans les temps et budgets assignés, des visuels qui soient intelligents et pertinents, permettant à leurs utilisateurs d’avoir une compréhension rapide et complète de leur situation par rapport à la stratégie ‘business’ qu’ils veulent mettre en place.

Vous participez à la montée en maturité d’AXA en terme de modélisation de données et de BI.

Votre profil :


Idéalement, vous disposez d’un Master (domaine quantitatif) et d’une expérience d’au moins 2 ans en tant qu’analyste business ou fonctionnel et intérêt marqué pour la gestion de données dans une entreprise
Vous disposez de connaissances techniques permettant d’extraire, manipuler et présenter des données (SQL, PowerBI, Azure Analysis Services, Excel, PowerApps, other)
Vous avez aussi des connaissances des standards de modélisation de données (modélisation dimensionnelle, data warehouse, data marts)
Connaissances linguistiques : vous avez une connaissance de base en Français, Néerlandais et Anglais.
Les compétences indispensables :
Très bonnes capacités d’organisation, de priorisation et de gestion du temps
Capacité à négocier et influencer ses stakeholders
Faculté à travailler dans un environnement en perpétuelle évolution et à promouvoir les changements
Les compétences utiles :
Communication claire et efficiente
Capable d’interagir efficacement avec les développeurs BI
Capable de mener une interview et de débattre d’un point de vue de façon constructive
Esprit analytique et logique ; esprit critique ; esprit d’équipe ; curiosité ; précision et attention aux détails ; orientation données, qualité et client
Intérêt pour les technologies liées à la prise de décision et la gestion de données

AXA souhaite refléter la diversité de la société dans laquelle nous vivons et mène donc depuis des années une politique active en faveur de la diversité, de la non-discrimination et de l'égalité des chances. Dans ce cadre, nous garantissons un suivi égal et un accès équitable au recrutement, indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, du contexte culturel, du handicap, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou d'autres caractéristiques.

AXA Belgium

Nous sommes plus de 3000 employés, travaillant dans nos bureaux modernes situés à Bruxelles, Anvers, Eupen et Liège. Nous servons 3 millions de clients en partenariat avec 3200 courtiers et nous sommes fiers d’être le premier assureur auto du pays. Notre ambition est de ne pas seulement être un payeur, mais plutôt un véritable partenaire pour nos clients.

Nos quatre valeurs principales nous poussent chaque jour à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes pour nos clients, tout en collaborant efficacement avec nos collègues: Customer First, Integrity, Courage et One AXA

Chez AXA, nous rejetons toute forme de discrimination déloyale ou illégale. Plus d’informations sur notre politique de Diversité et d’Inclusion.

Ce que nous vous offrons

Une rémunération et des avantages en lien avec votre travail

Vous bénéficierez d’un salaire compétitif, complété éventuellement d’un bonus discrétionnaire lié au résultat personnel et d’un bonus collectif, avec des chèques-repas, des écochèques, du remboursement total des transports en commun et un plan cafétaria.

Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur

Vous bénéficierez d’une assurance pension et d’une assurance hospitalisation et soins ambulatoires (également à un tarif préférentiel pour les membres de votre ménage) ainsi que d’une réduction allant jusqu'à 30 % sur nos autres produits d'assurance.

Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves

Un horaire flexible de 35 heures par semaine, 36 jours de congé par an pour vous ressourcer, ainsi que la possibilité de travailler partiellement depuis la maison.

Vous bénéficierez de cours de sport au travail, de programmes de bien-être pour les employés et de formations, afin de vous maintenir en pleine forme, tant physiquement que mentalement.
Show more

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quantitative analyst

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

About S&EM:

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It’s mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the “Pricing” team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.

Role:

The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:


Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, …).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.


Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, …)
Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Familiar with Git




Good to have:

Experience on the power markets
Experience on different optimization methods
Experience in a trading environment

Soft skills:


Must have:

Practical and conceptual thinking
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Ability to deliver concrete solutions
Autonomy
Working together

Ed ucation and professional background:


Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.


Languages:


English


Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

HTML:
Quantitative analyst

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

About S&EM:

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It’s mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the “Pricing” team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.

Role:

The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:

  • Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
  • Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
  • Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
  • Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, …).
  • Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
  • Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.

Hard skills:

    • Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
    • Familiar with Git

    • Experience in a trading environment
Soft skills:

    • Ability to deliver concrete solutions
    • Autonomy
    • Working together

  • Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
  • 0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description

As Stephen Few states: “We are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.” Capgemini Data & AI is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to help our clients in their digital transformations.

YOUR ROLE


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems
Ensure data pipelines and data stores are high-performing, efficient, organized, and reliable, given a set of business requirements and constraints
Create and design data models
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design


YOUR PROFILE


One more more leading Data platforms: Azure, Databricks, Snowflake, Google Cloud Platform and it's infra and CI/CD context
Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure SQL database, Azure Devops, Azure Analysis Services, ...
Databricks
Snowflake, Snowpipe, Snowflake Native Apps, ...
Keen understanding of Data Modeling methodologies (Kimball, Data Vault 2.0)
Knowledge of Lakehouse principles and medallion architecture
Expert knowledge of SQL and T-SQL or DBT
Fluent in Dutch with professional working proficiency in English


Relevant certificates


DP-203: Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure
Snowpro core/advanced
Databricks Lakehouse Professional


WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?

At Capgemini Belgium we offer flexibility in more than one way: next to our hybrid way of working, where we offer you can work 70% from home, we also offer our flex abroad program. With this program you can work up to 45 days abroad, this to maintain a good work-life balance.

Next to this we also offer following additional benefits:


Net expenses
Company car or mobility budget (whatever works best for you)
Health insurance
Meal vouchers
Pension plan
Eco vouchers from €250/year.
A flex plan where you can buy extra days off, update your insurance or buy home office supplies.
32 vacation days + Bank holidays.
Show more

Title: Internship Data & Analytics - Academic Year 2025-2026
Description:
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us


Join us and you’ll be immersed in a dynamic company where you’ll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You’ll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.

This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.

Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:


You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity

You’ll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs

You’ll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.

You’ll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.

You’ll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.

You’ll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.

You'll structure and leverage our clients’ data to improve their businesses.

The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.







Let’s talk about you

You are in the final year of your bachelor or master’s degree or your pre-final master year.

You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.

You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.

You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.

You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.

You are results oriented.

You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).

You work methodically and conscientiously.

You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.












Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte?   
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you. We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Real impact: interns at Deloitte contribute to real client projects, making tangible business impacts from day one.
Mentorship: access to a structured support system, including a mentor and buddy.
Lunch & Transport allowance: interns receive an amount for meals and commuting, adding to overall comfort and convenience.
Network opportunities: building a strong professional network through firmwide events, team activities and leadership exposure.
Interns Ignite event: a signature experience designed to connect interns across the firm, foster innovation and putting our interns in the spotlight.
Career perspective: as we highly value & believe in the potential of our interns, we offer our final year interns the opportunity to start working within our company after graduation.
Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!
Show more

Title: Consultant - Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Your Role




As a BI Analyst, you play a crucial role in analyzing, modeling, visualizing and optimizing data to gain strategic insights. You will work with various teams to develop robust data models, create impactful visualizations and ensure that data is accurately, consistently, and efficiently mapped and processed.




Requirements




At least 3 years of experience as a BI/Data Analyst or in a similar role
Deep expertise in Power BI, including designing and maintaining dashboards that deliver clear, actionable insights
Strong SQL and DAX skills, with experience creating efficient queries, calculations, and measures
Hands-on experience with Databricks for data transformation, preparation, and modeling to support BI solutions
Proven experience designing, maintaining, and optimizing tabular models for high-performance analytics
Knowledge of data modeling (e.g., star schemas, dimensional models) and experience applying these in BI projects
Familiarity with implementing role-based data access and security measures (RLS/OLS)
Excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly convey complex insights
Strong analytical thinking and a structured approach to complex problems
Languages: Bilingual – Fluent in Dutch & English or French & English







What You Will Do




Develop and optimize data models that support strategic decision-making
Build, enhance, and maintain Power BI dashboards that transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders
Work with large datasets in Power BI, ensuring efficient processing and responsive visualization
Streamline and enhance data transformations using best practices in tools like Power Query and DAX
Implement and manage data security measures to ensure the right users access the right information at the right time
Analyze data using statistical and analytical techniques
Contribute to organization-wide BI strategies, including guidelines and knowledge sharing
Improve current data governance and implement procedures for high-quality, trusted, and consistent data




Why Choose Exsolvæ?




Work on impactful data projects
Collaborate with experts in an innovative and learning-driven environment
Access professional development opportunities to strengthen your skills
Hybrid work environment with a healthy balance between remote and on-site
Competitive salary package and comprehensive benefits

Title: Data Analyst-Developer
Description:
Within our department IT Front & Packages with the mission of developing and maintaining our web applications and all our third-party applications, we are seeking a Data Analyst-Developer. The person will play a central role in developing IT Data & BI solutions to reach business objectives. She/He will ensure the availability, performance, and evolution of key business applications that support operational and strategic needs. She/He will strive to maximize the use of the company’s data assets.

The team consists of 8 colleagues who are eager to welcome you!

Your responsibilities

As An Analyst-Developer, Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into technical specifications.
Designing, developing, and implementing data warehousing and BI solutions to meet business requirements.
Performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using tools such as SQL, Python, and ETL frameworks.
Developing and maintaining dashboards, reports, and visualizations using BI tools like Power BI.
Ensuring data integrity, quality, and security across all data platforms.
Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Supporting the business in understanding and using the available data to facilitate creation of their own reports and dashboards Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in data analytics, BI & AI.
Participating in data & BI documentation (implement and manage tools supporting the documentation and contribute to the content along with other team members).
Implementing and managing tools that will improve data security and governance.


Your profile


You hold a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, a related field, or possess equivalent experience.
You have proven experience as a Data Analyst, BI Developer, or similar role.
You have proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and database management.
You have experience with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
You are familiar with programming languages such as Python.
You are fluent in English and French or Dutch, with a good command of the other national language.
You can learn quickly and adapt in a dynamic environment.
You have an analytical mindset and are solution-oriented.
You are proactive and can communicate effectively with various stakeholders.
You value teamwork and can work both on-site and remotely, including with offshore developers.


Good reasons to join us


A permanent employment contract.
A company that values human scale within a dynamic group where you can make a significant impact.
Accessible management that is close to its employees and fosters a pleasant working environment.
Numerous development opportunities, particularly through our Athora Academy.
A balance between professional and private life with generous holidays (at least 39 days a year), flexible working hours, and up to 3 days of teleworking per week.
An attractive salary package with various fringe benefits.
Modern, bright offices that encourage collaboration.
A central location in the Porte de Namur district, easily accessible by train and public transport, with parking available if needed.
Last but not least… a sunny terrace, after-work gatherings, team-building activities, an annual staff day, and many other events to discover… 😉


If you are looking for a friendly organization with a human touch and value collaboration and mutual support, you have come to the right place!

Apply By

31-07-2025


Show more

Title: Data Functional Analyst
Description:
Data Functional Analyst




About the Role: We are looking for a skilled Functional Data Analyst to join our “Data Team” within the B2B Supply Belgium business platform. This platform serves B2B customers in Belgium and consists of around 180 people, including 120 on the business side and 60 on the IS and Data side. You will work on various data use cases, including Metering Data Management, customer reporting, and Green Energy Reporting.




Key Responsibilities:

Act as a liaison between product owners and the technical Data Team, ensuring a clear understanding of business requirements.
Quickly familiarize yourself with the business domain (Metering Data Management) and analyze business requirements to interpret the specs accurately.
Translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications that guide Data Engineers in building data pipelines.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand business processes and document functional requirements.
Plan and organize functional testing and actively manage business validation processes.
Work with application and data source owners to map out functional data flows, using your technical knowledge and market expertise to ask relevant questions.




Required Skills and Experience:

Must-Have:

Experience in the Utilities sector, specifically with Metering/Allocation data.
Proven experience in Functional Analysis and data modeling.
Proactive, hands-on approach with the ability to work autonomously.
Strong communication and negotiation skills, able to engage with stakeholders effectively.
Experience working in Agile methodologies and familiarity with Agile tools such as Azure DevOps or Jira.

Nice-to-Have:

Knowledge of the Belgian Utilities Market (ATRIAS).
Previous experience with utilities market, metering, and allocation data management.
Familiarity with technical systems like SAP ISU.
Knowledge of data platform concepts.




Soft Skills:

Must-Have:

Strong ability to translate business requirements into clear and effective technical solutions.
Eagerness to work on and understand business logic, especially related to pricing.
Flexible and adaptable, able to support multiple topics as required by the business.
Excellent communication skills, particularly when engaging with diverse stakeholders.
Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with global teams.
Ability to work under pressure, especially during month-end closing periods.
Disciplined in documentation practices and time management.
Ability to meet deadlines and complete tasks within established timeframes.




Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree.
5-7 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.




Language Skills:

Fluent in Dutch or French.
Fluent in English.




If you're passionate about data and eager to make an impact in the Utilities sector, we would love to hear from you!




#Nexeo #Belgium #Brussels #Data #Functional #Analyst #Agile #Azure #DevOps #Jira #

  • Proactive, hands-on approach with the ability to work autonomously.
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills, able to engage with stakeholders effectively.
  • Experience working in Agile methodologies and familiarity with Agile tools such as Azure DevOps or Jira.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Knowledge of the Belgian Utilities Market (ATRIAS).
  • Previous experience with utilities market, metering, and allocation data management.
  • Familiarity with technical systems like SAP ISU.
  • Knowledge of data platform concepts.


Soft Skills:

Must-Have:

  • Strong ability to translate business requirements into clear and effective technical solutions.
  • Eagerness to work on and understand business logic, especially related to pricing.
  • Flexible and adaptable, able to support multiple topics as required by the business.
  • Excellent communication skills, particularly when engaging with diverse stakeholders.
  • Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with global teams.
  • Ability to work under pressure, especially during month-end closing periods.
  • Disciplined in documentation practices and time management.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and complete tasks within established timeframes.


Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree.
  • 5-7 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.


Language Skills:

  • Fluent in Dutch or French.
  • Fluent in English.


If you're passionate about data and eager to make an impact in the Utilities sector, we would love to hear from you!


#Nexeo #Belgium #Brussels #Data #Functional #Analyst #Agile #Azure #DevOps #Jira #

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Teddy, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Temporary staff (NATO HQ)
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

31-Aug-2026, 11:59:00 PM

Grade

TEMP

NATO is looking for applicants to fill temporary positions that arise occasionally at NATO Headquarters, Brussels, Belgium.

Are you a national of a NATO member state, with skills in a relevant discipline, and proficiency in English or French (preferably with a good knowledge of the other language)?

Do you have experience in political affairs, public diplomacy, project management, finance, IT, Cyber, legal affairs, translation, HR or administrative support?

Then this might be an opportunity for you!

In view of the nature and of the urgency of the temporary positions we are looking to fill, it is important for candidates to be available for temporary employment on short notice. In practice, this implies either being in possession of valid NATO security clearance at the time of application, or having been in possession of such a clearance with the possibility to reactivate it swiftly. We therefore only encourage applications for temporary positions if you are already, or have previously been, in possession of a valid NATO security clearance.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:



You will have experience in one of the following areas:


Administrative Support
Legal Affairs
Finance (budgeting, accounting); Audit
Procurement & Purchasing
Logistics (supply chain, warehouse & stock management); Infrastructure and facilities management
Information Knowledge Management (Data entry/encoding, document management/registry/archives)
Event & conference management
Project and Programme Management
Engineering
Information Technology (Software, Hardware, Web Programming)
Human Resources (recruitment, staff services, organisational development)
Cyber defence / security
Public Diplomacy (Press and Media, Journalism, Communications); Graphic Design and Printing; Web Design, online editing, social media management
Linguistic services
Defence (Defence Planning, Defence Investment)
Natural sciences (research and analysis)
Political affairs (drafting policy, diplomacy, public administration)
COMPETENCIES:



You will demonstrate:


Clarity and Accuracy (Checks own work);
Customer Service Orientation (Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems);
Empathy (Listens actively);
Flexibility (Acts with flexibility);
Initiative (Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation);
Organizational Awareness (Understands the Organization's structure);
Teamwork (Expresses positive attitudes and expectations of team or team members).
RECRUITMENT PROCESS



When submitting your application, please note that you are applying to a candidate pool, and not for a particular assignment. You will receive an acknowledgement of receipt from the system of your application.

It is a condition of employment that before a temporary staff member can be appointed, the Organization must have received a security clearance certificate (minimum NATO Secret) from the government of the country or countries of which he/she is a national.

Important:

Note that this process is only to be included in our temporary database, and does not constitute a guarantee of employment.

Please attach an updated CV and relevant certifications to your application.

You are responsible for keeping your information up-to-date by making the appropriate changes (e.g. availability, clearance, etc.) directly in your Taleo application, if and when required! Please do not re-apply if changes occur, but edit your application at any time.

Any questions on this subject should be sent to recruitment@hq.nato.int.


WHAT WE OFFER:
38 hours per week schedule;
2.5 paid days of leave per month;
Fulfilling working atmosphere in an international community;
Contract: in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Regulations, temporary staff may not be employed more than 6 months for the same assignment. However, if later required, contracts may be extended for another period of up to six months
Salary: the remuneration of temporary personnel will be specified in their contracts. It is not exempt from taxation [1] . Temporary personnel are responsible for acquitting themselves of their responsibilities for the payment of taxes.
Benefits package: temporary staff are covered by a benefits package which consists of pension contributions by the Organization (12% of basic salary), medical and accident benefits (death and invalidity) provided under the NATO Group insurance contract, and paid leave of 2.5 days per month worked. For staff eligible under NATO rules, there is also a dependent child allowance and coverage for dependent children for medical benefits;



You will find useful information on our conditions of employment at NATO and other practical details on our website: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/86784.htm


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:



NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply.

Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defense and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work.

Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels is a non-smoking environment.

[1] Subject to bilateral agreements entered into between the NATO body and the Host Country concerned.

Title: Data Analyst Reverse Engineering
Description:
Mission Overview:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst specializing in reverse engineering data from datamarts and Power BI reports. This role is critical to a major strategic project: the replacement of our current Data Vault. The goal of this project is to modernize and secure our data infrastructure by improving traceability, quality, and the efficiency of data flows.

The ideal candidate will be able to trace data processing chains from Power BI visualizations back to datamarts and source databases, in order to document, understand, and improve existing flows. Close collaboration with BI, Data Engineering, and business teams is expected. Our activities cover commercial and operational performance, particularly in After Sales, Customer & Marketing, Dealer Performance, and Importer Performance.

Key Responsibilities:

Analyze Power BI reports to identify semantic models, DAX measures, transformations, and data sources. Reconstruct data flows back to datamarts and relational databases. Document data models, transformations, and dependencies (Power BI, datamarts, ETL, databases). Collaborate with technical and business teams to validate flows and identify optimizations. Participate in data governance (traceability, quality, GDPR/security compliance). Propose improvements in modeling, query performance, and report structuring. Contribute to the creation of repositories and documentation. Participate in migration or evolution projects of source systems.

Required Skills:

Advanced proficiency in Power BI (DAX, models, paginated reports). Strong experience in SQL and exploration of relational databases (SQL Server, Azure SQL, etc.). Knowledge of BI concepts: Kimball, Data Vault. Ability to read and interpret complex models and ETL flows. Experience in technical and functional documentation. Familiarity with GIT and collaborative development environments. Analytical mindset, rigor, autonomy, critical thinking. Good communication skills. Languages: French and/or Dutch, with good command of English (written/spoken).

Education and Experience:

University degree in computer science, data science, or a relevant field. 3 to 5 years of experience in a similar BI or data analysis role. Proven experience in complex Power BI environments and in reverse engineering data flows.

Consultancy Nature of Work:

This position operates within the consultancy model of Keystone Solutions, emphasizing on-site collaboration at the client location. The successful candidate will be contributing as a Keystone Solutions consultant, engaging directly with our client.

Dynamic Projects:

As a Keystone Solutions consultant, you will have the opportunity to tackle diverse challenges across various client projects, enhancing your exposure and experience in the field.

Turbo-Charged Learning and Development:

Keystone Solutions places a strong emphasis on your professional development. You will benefit from broad learning experiences and support that are crucial for your career growth.

Ambition Skyrocketing within a Consultancy Framework:

Become part of a consultancy culture that actively fosters career growth through varied client engagements, enabling you to refine your skills and advance your career swiftly.

Emphasizing Keystone Solutions Values in a Consultancy Context:

Keystone Solutions core values are central to every consulting engagement, ensuring that being a K-Stone means embodying these values in each client project.

If you are ready to tackle technical and strategic challenges in a dynamic consultancy environment, apply today at Keystone Solutions Career Portal.

Title: Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department)
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

Title: Officer, Pensions
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

07-Oct-2025, 11:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

5,043.00

Grade

NATO Grade G11-G15


Summary



The Executive Management (EM) Division has the lead role in the overall management of the NATO HQ. The EM Division covers the following directorates: HQ Support and Transformation (HQST), Human Resources (HR) and Information, Communications, and Technology Management (ICTM).

Within the Executive Management Division (EM), NATO’s International Staff (IS) Human Resources (HR) Directorate is comprised of five pillars: Talent Management and HR Integration (TMHRI); Staff Services (Pay and Allowances, Pensions and Insurances); HR Policy and Strategy Coordination (IS and NATO-wide HR policy); the Data Analytics section; and the Medical Service.

Within the Staff Services, the Pensions Unit is a shared Service operating NATO-wide. The Unit manages two distinct pension schemes, the Co-ordinated Pension Scheme, and the NATO Defined Contribution Pension Scheme.

The incumbent is responsible for managing the NATO Defined Contribution Pension Scheme (DCPS) on a NATO-wide basis. In this respect, the incumbent will in the first place oversee and contribute to the entire operational handling of the scheme including all aspects of data processing and administration. Furthermore, the Officer will answer requests for information from internal and external stakeholders at various levels and in various roles. The incumbent will contribute to the implementation of change projects in connection with the development of the HR IT systems and tools as related to pensions, and the digitalisation of relevant archives, thereby contributing to organisational efficiencies in Staff Services processes. Next to the main task of DCPS-management, the incumbent will also take part in the operational aspects of the DBPS (alternatively known as the Coordinated Pension scheme), mostly oriented to the alignment of processes between both schemes, and the dedication to improvement of efficiencies.

The incumbent will be required to provide input to policy development within the field of pensions on a NATO-wide and Coordinated Organisations’ basis and to assist in the implementation of change projects related to pension policies.

Essential

2. QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

The incumbent must:


possess a university degree or equivalent level of qualification in economics, human resources management, business or public administration, finance, accounting, actuarial studies or related field, from an institute of a recognized standing;
have at least 2 years’ experience in pension administration, personnel administration or financial accounting;
have strong analytical and numerical skills and the ability to interpret and apply complex pension regulations;
have excellent public relations, communication and negotiation skills;
demonstrate strong customer focus;
demonstrate strong drive for teamwork, customer service attitude, and flexibility;
have good knowledge of the standard Microsoft Office software, as well as information technologies and equipment for storing, retrieving, transmitting and handling data;
have experience in pension administration systems and the associated policy and processes;
have experience in implementing and/or handling digital transformation projects to contribute to organisational efficiencies and reporting;
possess the required levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one, III (“Intermediate”) in the other.



DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:


experience in the administration of a defined contribution (DC) pension scheme;
knowledge of, or experience with, investment markets;
professional experience in a national administration and/or international public sector organisation;
experience in ERP software systems.
Main Accountabilities



Expertise Development

Assist in building up an internal centre of expertise on pension schemes for NATO as a whole. Contribute to the development of HR Management policy on a NATO-wide basis by providing subject-matter expertise on pensions. Search for, advice and implement ways to modernise, improve, and make more efficient the work of the Pensions Service.

Information Management

Assist in the management of the flow of information required for the calculation of pension payments, allowances, tax adjustments and deductions from pension benefits. Ensure that the data received from NATO bodies is accurate, timely, complete and in conformity with the Pension Schemes rules.

Stakeholder Management

Respond to and engage with, as appropriate, NATO bodies, investment managers, scheme administrators, staff members and pensioners on all questions related to pensions.

Knowledge Management

Contribute to the research and collection of data in the field of pensions, especially related to international organisations. Gather relevant statistics for use by senior management. Assist with the implementation of knowledge management systems as well as tools to facilitate efficiencies and reporting, including digitalisation of HR data.

Project Management

Support and contribute to projects in the field of pensions, especially as related to international organisations. Contribute as a team member to different initiatives and modernisation projects of the Pensions Unit.

Perform any other related duty as assigned.

4. INTERRELATIONSHIPS

The incumbent reports to the Head, Pensions. The Officer will work in close collaboration with all members of the Unit . The incumbent will interact on a regular basis with internal and external stakeholders of the different pension schemes, including serving staff, future retirees, pensioners, scheme administrators, NATO and external entities. The incumbent may be required to deputise for the Head, Pensions in their absence.

Direct reports: N/A

Indirect reports: N/A

5. COMPETENCIES

The incumbent must demonstrate:


Achievement: Works to meet standards;
Analytical Thinking: Sees basic relationships;
Clarity and Accuracy: Checks own work;
Conceptual Thinking: Sees patterns based on life/work experience;
Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems;
Empathy: Reads non-verbal cues and understands meanings;
Impact and Influence: Takes multiple actions to persuade;
Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation;
Teamwork: Cooperates.
CONTRACT



Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years; possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.

NOTE: Irrespective of previous qualifications and experience, candidates for twin-graded posts will be appointed at the lower grade. Advancement to the higher grade is not automatic, and will not normally take place during the first three years of service in the post. Under specific circumstances, serving staff members may be appointed directly to the higher grade, and a period of three years might be reduced by up to twenty four months for external candidates. These circumstances are described in the IS directive on twin-graded posts.


USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS



Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:


For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link );
For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment



Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.

Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.

More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION



NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply. NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process. Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation. Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work. Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with. Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements. The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements. Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment. For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab. NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

Full-time

  • Summary


The Executive Management (EM) Division has the lead role in the overall management of the NATO HQ. The EM Division covers the following directorates: HQ Support and Transformation (HQST), Human Resources (HR) and Information, Communications, and Technology Management (ICTM).

Within the Executive Management Division (EM), NATO’s International Staff (IS) Human Resources (HR) Directorate is comprised of five pillars: Talent Management and HR Integration (TMHRI); Staff Services (Pay and Allowances, Pensions and Insurances); HR Policy and Strategy Coordination (IS and NATO-wide HR policy); the Data Analytics section; and the Medical Service.

Within the Staff Services, the Pensions Unit is a shared Service operating NATO-wide. The Unit manages two distinct pension schemes, the Co-ordinated Pension Scheme, and the NATO Defined Contribution Pension Scheme.

The incumbent is responsible for managing the NATO Defined Contribution Pension Scheme (DCPS) on a NATO-wide basis. In this respect, the incumbent will in the first place oversee and contribute to the entire operational handling of the scheme including all aspects of data processing and administration. Furthermore, the Officer will answer requests for information from internal and external stakeholders at various levels and in various roles. The incumbent will contribute to the implementation of change projects in connection with the development of the HR IT systems and tools as related to pensions, and the digitalisation of relevant archives, thereby contributing to organisational efficiencies in Staff Services processes. Next to the main task of DCPS-management, the incumbent will also take part in the operational aspects of the DBPS (alternatively known as the Coordinated Pension scheme), mostly oriented to the alignment of processes between both schemes, and the dedication to improvement of efficiencies.

The incumbent will be required to provide input to policy development within the field of pensions on a NATO-wide and Coordinated Organisations’ basis and to assist in the implementation of change projects related to pension policies.

Essential

 2. QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

The incumbent must:

  • possess a university degree or equivalent level of qualification in economics, human resources management, business or public administration, finance, accounting, actuarial studies or related field, from an institute of a recognized standing;
  • have at least 2 years’ experience in pension administration, personnel administration or financial accounting;
  • have strong analytical and numerical skills and the ability to interpret and apply complex pension regulations;
  • have excellent public relations, communication and negotiation skills;
  • demonstrate strong customer focus;
  • demonstrate strong drive for teamwork, customer service attitude, and flexibility;
  • have good knowledge of the standard Microsoft Office software, as well as information technologies and equipment for storing, retrieving, transmitting and handling data;
  • have experience in pension administration systems and the associated policy and processes;
  • have experience in implementing and/or handling digital transformation projects to contribute to organisational efficiencies and reporting;
  • possess the required levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one, III (“Intermediate”) in the other.


DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:

  • experience in the administration of a defined contribution (DC) pension scheme;
  • knowledge of, or experience with, investment markets;
  • professional experience in a national administration and/or international public sector organisation;
  • experience in ERP software systems.

Perform any other related duty as assigned.

4. INTERRELATIONSHIPS

The incumbent reports to the Head, Pensions. The Officer will work in close collaboration with all members of the Unit . The incumbent may be required to deputise for the Head, Pensions in their absence.

Title: Data Engineer - Internship
Description:
Data Engineer Intern on Open-Source Projects

FR or NL + EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.




With 30 years of expertise, we champion open-source innovation and collaborative development, helping businesses unlock the full potential of their data ecosystems through transparent, sustainable, and community-driven technological solutions.




We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. By joining us, you will be part of a global impact on businesses around the world.




Check out some of our ongoing projects:

At Carrefour, Orange Business ensures the seamless operation and evolution of the Data Platform, managing both analytical and operational data flows with a focus on reliability and performance. We handle diverse workloads, including batch and stream processing. By processing everyday terabytes of data that feed dashboards and web APIs, we empower Carrefour to leverage data-driven insights and support their business growth.
Our customer Sappi, a global pulp and paper company, requested our help to significantly reduce energy costs and offer capacity in energy balancing markets on a daily basis. You could join the team creating, deploying and optimizing multiple forecasting algorithms on GCP.
For Paradigm, Orange Business created a data platform and a unified set of tools for all public sector to conduct data projects, with a focus on Kubernetes and DevOps processes to enable self-service and standardization. We were able to handle many projects from all administrations, ranging from API management to data processing & analytics, as well as data science modelling.




If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let’s meet up if that matches your profile!




What You’ll Do:

All the responsibilities we’ll trust you with




As a Data Engineer Intern, you will take part in the development of an innovative open-source dependency mapping platform that will change how organizations understand and manage their IT system interdependencies. This role offers the unique opportunity to build industry-defining technology while gaining high visibility in the open-source community through contributions that will impact companies worldwide.




System Discovery & Mapping:

Design and implement automated discovery mechanisms to identify and catalog IT system dependencies across diverse enterprise environments
Build robust data pipelines to continuously monitor and map relationships between systems ranging from Cloud provider to SAP to BI tools and beyond

Data Pipeline Architecture:

Develop scalable Python-based data processing pipelines on Google Cloud Platform
Design efficient data ingestion, transformation, and storage solutions to handle complex dependency graphs

Business Intelligence & Insights:

Transform dependency data into actionable business insights and recommendations
Create automated alerting and monitoring systems for critical dependency changes




Who you are:

What matters most for this role




Your interests & soft skills:

Proactive mindset and innovative thinking to pioneer solutions that will set new industry standards
Passion for open-source development and building tools that create lasting impact across organizations
Entrepreneurial spirit with enthusiasm for launching projects that gain high visibility and drive industry transformation
Strong collaborative approach, thriving in cross-functional teams while contributing to a global open-source community
Excellent communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch + English to engage with diverse stakeholders and the open-source community




Your technical knowledge:

Data Engineering: Advanced proficiency in Python
Dependency Mapping & Analysis: Understanding of system interdependencies, data lineage, and impact analysis methodologies
Database Technologies: Strong SQL skills and experience with both relational and NoSQL databases
DevOps & Version Control: Proficiency with Git, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code practices
Open-Source Development: Experience contributing to or maintaining open-source projects, understanding of community-driven development practices
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is a plus.




Why you should join us:

Some of the rewards of working as an intern at Orange Business




Career growth possibilities with a possibility to be hired with a permanent contract.
A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular “Guild” workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization, and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid way of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels




Apply now

We can’t wait to meet you!




More about Orange Business:

Check out our we bsite for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

Show more

  • An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.

Apply now

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Sibling is in the market for a leading client in the Belgian energy sector who are looking for a Data Engineer / BI Specialist to design and build data models (Star Schema) that will power analytics and reporting across the business.




Main Focus

Design and build fact/dimension models (Star Schema)
Work closely with business and technical teams to translate requirements into scalable data structures
Optimise ETL/ELT pipelines and data warehouse performance
Support BI/reporting teams with clean, reliable models




Your background:




Strong experience in data warehousing & dimensional modelling (Kimball/Star Schema)
Advanced SQL and experience with modern data platforms (Databricks and Azure)
Familiar with ETL/ELT tools and at least one BI tool (Power BI, Tableau)
Able to work in a hybrid setup (mix of remote + onsite Belgium)







Location: Belgium (hybrid) 3+2
Start: ASAP
Contract: 12 Months+ (Extensions to Follow)

Title: Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !


Show more
HTML:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
  • Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.
