Title: IT Support Officer
Description:
VINCI Facilities draagt zorg voor gebouwen, eindgebruikers en het milieu. Als onderdeel van de groep VINCI Energies, is VINCI Facilities een belangrijke speler op het gebied van Facility Management en Multi Technisch beheer.

VINCI Facilities biedt een volledige waaier aan onderhoudsdiensten aan, met inbegrip van het beheer en de exploitatie, systematische en voorwaardelijke correctief- en preventief, onderhoud. Daarnaast biedt VINCI Facilities ondersteuning op lange termijn met facilitaire oplossingen op maat. Dankzij onze jarenlange ervaring bij onze klanten, hebben we ook een team van interieurarchitecten om kantoren in te richten volgens de New Way of Working.

Wat ga jij doen als IT Support Officer ?


1ste en 2de lijns IT support voor eindgebruikers (interne klanten / business units)
Installeren en configureren van client hardware en software (Pc's / smartphone / tablets / printers / IP phone)
Escalatie van incidenten naar 3de lijns support / andere IT teams binnen de groep
Ondersteuning geven van diverse standaard business applicaties (MS office 365 / Teams / telefonie applicaties / ...)
Je begeleidt gebruikers bij het toepassen , implementeren van softwarepakketten en aanpassingen
Registratie / opvolging van alle IT materiaal in asset management systeem
Opstellen van gebruikershandleidingen
Knowledge sharing : je deelt je kennis met collega's via documentatie
Je rapporteert aan de IT manager


Profiel


Je bent in bezit van bachelor diploma in informatica (bachelor) of gelijkwaardig door ervaring
Je hebt reeds enige ervaring in help/service desk ondersteuning
Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van client operating systems (Windows 10 / Android / IOS) en netwerking
Je hebt een sterke interesse in IT en bent leergierig
Je kan zelfstandig werken maar functioneert tegelijk als betrouwbare schakel binnen het team
Je bent klantvriendelijk, communicatief , gemotiveerd en stressbestendig
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en Frans
Je beschikt over een rijbewijs B


Plaats tewerkstelling : Brussel – VINCI Facilities - Havenlaan 86C (Tour & Taxis)

Je bent bereid ondersteuning / gebruikerstraining te geven op locatie in de diverse Business Units van VINCI Facilities

Waarom zou je voor VINCI Facilities kiezen?

VINCI Facilities wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de Belgische samenleving. We moedigen iedereen aan om te solliciteren (ongeacht origine, huidskleur, leeftijd, geslacht, seksuele oriëntatie, filosofische of religieuze overtuiging, handicap, etc.).

VINCI Facilities Is Een Merk Van VINCI Energies, Dat Deel Uitmaakt Van De VINCI Groep. Wij Zijn Niet Het Zoveelste Bedrijf Dat Je "aantrekkelijke Salarisvoorwaarden En Concurrerende Extralegale Voorwaarden" Biedt. Hoewel Dit Ook Deel Uitmaakt Van Ons Basispakket, Hebben We Nog Veel Meer Te Bieden


Een job die voldoening geeft in een stabiele, dynamische en geëngageerde onderneming.
Een aangename en ondersteunende werksfeer
Een balans tussen je werk en je privéleven
Echte kansen om je vaardigheden en je carrière te ontwikkelen in een gewaardeerde werkomgeving
…


En Om Het Dan Toch Te Hebben Over De Aantrekkelijke Salarisvoorwaarde En Concurrerende Extralegale Voorwaarden, Hierbij Een Greep Uit Wat We Bieden


Maaltijdcheques
Smartphone + abonnement
Laptop
Verlof: 32 dagen/jaar (12 extra ADV + 20 vakantiedagen)
100% sociaal abonnement
Groepsverzekering
Hospitalisatieverzekering
CAO 90 (collectieve bonus in februari)
Fietslease
13de maand
Kortingen bij onze partners
...


Benieuwd om meer te weten? Solliciteer snel of neem contact op met ons.

We kijken er alvast naar uit om je te ontmoeten!

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Title: Junior Associate - Private Capital
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

You will work in teams of typically 3-5 consultants to support private investor clients and their portfolio companies throughout the deal lifecycle, including on diligence, value creation topics and exit support.

You will have the opportunity to assess and identify market attractiveness, provide targeted information and specialized financial analysis on potential acquisitions, prepare and deliver high-impact verbal and written communication of your synthesized findings. You will also have the opportunity to work directly with portfolio companies on their value creation agenda, spanning a diverse set of topics, and you'll be a subject matter expert on topics related to our service to investors. You will be recognized as a valuable resource of experience, information and expertise both inside the firm and by our clients.

As a Junior Associate, you will receive training and coaching on how to better: structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them; synthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative method; work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act; establish trust-based relationships with clients to better-serve their organizations; communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner; develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values.

McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you’ll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals. Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams. When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm that will invest in your professional development.

During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a Junior Associate on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of private investor settings, across different industry and functional areas and develop significant business experience, as well as an investor mindset, you will likely intersect with many elements of our firm’s work including digital, implementation, and tech and analytics capabilities.

This role differs from McKinsey’s generalist Junior Associate role in its focus. This role focuses entirely on serving investor clients and their portfolio companies (though because our clients invest across sectors and types of companies, the role still offers exposure to a wide variety of sectors and functional levers). Private Capital consultants will be staffed full time to client engagements.

You will be based in our Brussels office as part of our Private Capital practice.

Our practice is the world’s leading advisor to the private capital industry and a high growth area for the firm, working with many of the most significant global and local private investors and their portfolio companies.

You will work in teams and directly with our clients. You will also work with the wider McKinsey network including a range of experts in the firm, from industry and functional experts to data scientists to researchers to software and app designers.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Undergraduate degree or master’s degree
2+ years of work experience after completing your degree
Previous experience in IB/VC/PE environment with exposure to transactions and/or working in a PE or VC backed company is a plus
Investor mindset and experience, or strong interest in private equity, real estate and/or venture capital
Background in strategy consulting is highly advantageous
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization
Capability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team project
Comfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situations
Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English, Dutch and/or French

Title: Database Specialist
Description:
🌍 Big Impact. Hybrid Flexibility. Cutting-Edge Tech.




We’re looking for an Azure Cosmos DB Expert to lead a strategic cloud project in Brussels (1–2 days onsite).

Your mission: design & optimize Cosmos DB environments, automate with Terraform, and empower teams through hands-on training.

If you know Cosmos DB inside out (MongoDB/SQL APIs, RUs, indexing, performance tuning) and love mixing deep tech with team enablement — this role is built for you.




💡 Ready to lead and leave a mark? Apply now.




#Azure #CosmosDB #CloudEngineering #AzureExperts #DatabaseArchitecture #HybridWork #Terraform #CloudJobs #BrusselsJobs #TechLeadership

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
(Hybrid: 50% on-site, 50% remote)

Must be based in Belgium




We are looking for a Data Governance Operations Engineer to join our client, a leading bank in Brussels. In this role, you will be part of the bank’s Data Governance team, ensuring the smooth operation of data pipelines, workflows, and governance systems. You will collaborate with engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to maintain data quality, integrity, and availability across the organisation.




Key Responsibilities

Maintain and optimise Linux-based pipelines for efficient, reliable data flow.
Develop and maintain shell scripts to automate processing, transformation, and loading.
Work with data engineers to improve workflows and enhance data quality.
Create, monitor, and manage Control-M jobs to ensure timely delivery.
Coordinate with planning teams to execute releases smoothly.
Analyse logs, troubleshoot failures, and ensure data integrity.
Identify and resolve data-related incidents, minimising impact on operations.
Document incidents, solutions, and lessons learned.
Administer databases, run queries, and resolve connectivity issues.
Support analysts and engineers in strengthening data governance practices.
Design and maintain quality checks to ensure accurate, consistent data.




Skills & Experience

6+ years’ experience in data analytics or operations.
Strong expertise in Linux administration, scripting, and data management.
Experience in job scheduling and release management.
Knowledge of Ab Initio and data governance principles.
Experience with Git or other version control systems.
Familiarity with mainframe systems for data integration.
Previous experience in the banking sector.
Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset.
Clear communication with both technical and business stakeholders.




Languages

Fluent English.
Dutch or French is a plus.




Apply now or reach out via email Lydia.wills@church-int.com

Show more

Apply now or reach out via email Lydia.wills@church-int.com

Title: Project Support Office / Analyst
Description:
Project Support Office / Analyst (Identity & Access Management Programme) – Banking Client

Duration: 12 months

Rate: 400 – 600 per day

Hybrid: 8 days onsite per month, the rest is remote working

Locations: London, Paris, Brussels or Amsterdam




Role description PSO Analyst – Planning & Budgeting (Identity & Access Management Programme)

We’re looking for a hands-on PSO Analyst to help managing the budgeting and planning side in the IDAM programme, which has a portfolio of +/- 20 projects.

You'll work closely with project managers, the central PMO team and other delivery teams across to keep finances on track, support resource planning, facilitate quarterly plannings and make sure reporting runs smoothly.




PMO Responsibilities:

Budget support: Help project managers manage their budgets using tools like Excel, Oracle, and ServiceNow.
Data maintenance: Keep financial and resource data up to date and accurate across systems.
Forecast reviews: Challenge project managers on their forecasts and help them improve accuracy over time.
Financial reporting: Create monthly variance reports to show how actual spend compares to the planned costs.
Stakeholder coordination: Work with different teams to provide budget inputs for steering committees, regulatory reporting, recruitment etc.
Quarterly planning: Support quarterly demand and resource planning across the programme.
Facilitation: Run planning discussions with teams and get demand requests prioritised at the organisation, especially when there are dependencies to sort through.
Benefits & disbenefits tracking: Support project managers in identifying, tracking, and reporting on both expected benefits and any disbenefits, helping to capture the full impact of all projects.
Project status update reporting: Collect input from all project managers and summarise in a project status report on a monthly basis.
Milestone management: Tracking and coordinating key project checkpoints to ensure timely delivery and alignment with goals.
Preparation and facilitation of (steering committee) meetings: Prepare SteerCo slides and collect input from several contributors.
Meeting minutes and action tracking: Summarise key discussion points, actions and decisions and follow-up with action owners.
Quality assurance and controls management: Frequent checkpoints with project managers to maintain a high standard in terms of project life cycle documents, monthly reports and status updates, and steer and support where needed.
Risk management: Prepare programme risk overview and facilitate discussions with Risk Management and Internal Audit.

Required skills/mindset:

Analytical Mindset: You are comfortable with numbers and spotting trends or inconsistencies.
Excel Skills: You know your way around spreadsheets or you are eager to learn quickly.
PowerPoint Skills: You are comfortable with creating slides and visually bringing a message across.
Communication Skills: You can explain things clearly and are comfortable with working with a range of people.
Proactive Attitude: You’re not afraid to ask questions, challenge things, or suggest improvements.
Tool Familiarity: Experience with Oracle or ServiceNow is a plus.

Please do send across an up to date CV to eobiechefu@welovesalt.com

Show more

Title: Head, NATO Broadcast
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

14-Sep-2025, 11:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

6,467.30

Grade

NATO Grade G15


SUMMARY



NATO’s Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Office of Strategic Communications actively strengthens NATO’s public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Office also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands. The Digital Technology and Infrastructure Section manages NATO’s communication technology and infrastructure, including NATO’s broadcast operations and the NATO website.

The incumbent, under the overall direction of the Deputy Director of the Office of Strategic Communications, is responsible for:


the coordination of the broadcast and photographic coverage of high-level public events taking place at NATO HQ and abroad,
the day-to-day management of the teams covering these events, and
overseeing the operation and maintenance of the required digital broadcast equipment and infrastructure.



This includes liaising with internal and external stakeholders, and coordinating the day-to-day activities involving the TV studio and the different video production environments. This is a hands-on position requiring extensive professional broadcast expertise, paired with management and stakeholder’s management experience.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE



Essential

The incumbent must:


possess a university degree in film, video and TV broadcasting from an institute of recognised standing or equivalent qualification;
have at least three years of professional experience in the field of digital radio and television broadcasting equipment;
have extensive professional experience in multimedia production, and/or overseeing multimedia production;
have experience in managing small teams in the broadcast environment;
have proven experience in stakeholder management;
possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one; I (“Beginner”) in the other .



DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:


professional experience in digital asset management systems;
proven experience in working with procurement regulations;
sound political judgement and diplomacy skills;
experience working at an international organisation.
MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES



Planning and Execution

Coordinate the calendar of upcoming events with internal stakeholders (e.g, NATO Spokesperson) regarding expected outcomes and deliverables. Manage the internal and external teams transmitting, recording, editing video, audio and photo deliverables from the different events at NATO HQ and abroad. Ensure availability and operability of the required digital broadcast infrastructure and equipment, including the distribution of live video feeds via online streaming platforms, satellite and optical fibre systems, the TV and radio studio, and the video- and audio pre- and post-production facilities for Digital Technology and Infrastructure Section.

Expertise Development

Remain up-to-date with current technology in the fields of broadcast and developments in digital video transmission, recording and production. Conduct installation and testing of various equipment. Provide staff with the opportunity to learn how to maintain and operate new broadcast equipment.

Stakeholder Management

Liaise with internal stakeholders for the coordination of the required coverage of public high-level events including visits of national dignitaries to NATO HQ, trips of NATO VIPs abroad and recordings in the TV or radio studio. Liaise directly with internal stakeholders such as the NATO Procurement service and the NATO Office of Security, and with external stakeholders to ensure optimal execution of tasks including provision of services and staff, and the acquisition of equipment. Be able to work as part of a team in demanding situations such as Summits, ministerial meetings and special events, both at NATO Headquarters and abroad.

Project Management

Coordinate in close consultation with the relevant Press and Media Officers equipment and staffing needs for Summit, ministerial meetings, press conferences and special events held at NATO Headquarters and elsewhere. This can include extensive liaising with host nations and host nation broadcasters, international media outlets and digital media service suppliers to ensure that strict deadlines are met and that NATO’s message, brand and image are optimally distributed worldwide.

People Management

Oversee directly a core permanent staff and indirectly a more extensive teams of external contractors. Plan their workloads to meet the needs for a given project, as well as for day-to-day operations with the assistance of the Broadcast Coordinator.

Financial Management

Be responsible for the planning of the hiring of services as well as of the acquisition of equipment and infrastructure. This includes the provisioning of human and technical resources through the framework contract for the broadcast and photographic coverage of public events, the rental of services for the transmission and distribution of live video feeds, and the acquisition and maintenance of equipment and infrastructure. Be familiar with and adhere to NATO financial and procurement rules and regulations.

Information Management

Design and implement a proper information strategy to document day-to-day financial and operational activities and to maintain a calendar of events for the internal and external teams.

Perform any other related duty as assigned.


INTERRELATIONSHIPS



The incumbent reports to the Deputy Director of the Office of Strategic Communications. On a daily basis, they supervise permanent and contract staff and their broadcast and photographic work including during Summits, ministerial meetings, special events, trips abroad and other events as required.

Direct reports: 5

Indirect reports: N/a.


COMPETENCIES



The incumbent must demonstrate:


Achievement: Creates own measures of excellence and improves performance.
Analytical Thinking: Sees multiple relationships;
Customer Service Orientation: Makes things better for the customer, addressing underlying customer needs;
Flexibility: Adapts to unforeseen situations;
Initiative: Plans and acts up to a year ahead;
Organisational Commitment: Places the Organization above personal considerations;
Self-Control: Stays composed and positive even under extreme pressure;
Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others.



6. CONTRACT

Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years; possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.


USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS



Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:


For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link );
For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment



Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.

Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.

More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION



NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply.

NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process.

Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation.

Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work.

Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with.

Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements.

The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours.

The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements.

Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment.

For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab.

NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

Title: Young Graduate Business Analyst - Data & Analytics Team
Description:
Working on innovative solutions to address emerging business challenges, you will have the opportunity to make a difference in genuine partnership with market-leading clients, impacting the way people work and live in the future.




We are offering you an interesting and challenging position as




A Young Graduate Business Analyst




Main responsibilities:




Collaborate on the design and implementation of effective data management frameworks.
Work closely with market-leading clients to understand their unique data governance needs.
Assist in developing and executing comprehensive data governance solutions.
Contribute to the development and optimization of data models, structures, and workflows.
Implement and operate data governance tools, ensuring their efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver customer-focused outcomes.
Demonstrate strong analytical and programming skills when needed.




Ideal profile:




Recent MSc or MA graduate in Computer Science, Information Management, Business Engineering, or a related field.
Proficient in English, with a good command in French and/or Dutch.
Keen interest and basic knowledge in data management and data governance.
Familiarity with data models, structures, and workflows.
Exposure to at least one data governance tool is advantageous.
Proactive mindset and entrepreneurial spirit.
Effective communication and presentation skills.
Team player with a customer-success-oriented approach.
Programming skills are considered a plus.

BearingPoint offers you:




An enriching career within a leading European Business Consulting firm with a people-centric approach.
The possibility to work on several international projects within an easy-going team.
Cross-level collaborations with our data experts, eager to share their knowledge.
Excellent growth opportunities while having access to high-quality trainings and tailor-made coaching.
An individual support from a Development Manager.
An attractive salary package (mobile phone and laptop, company car with international energy card or a mobility budget allowance, meal vouchers, hospitalization coverage and group insurance, performance-related bonus).

Apply and become part of a quality-driven practice excelling in Data Governance!

Title: Collaborateur polyvalent F/H/X
Description:
Collaborateur polyvalent (F/H/X)

1 poste(s) recherché(s) - Administration générale de l'Enseignement

Date limite de candidature le 10/09/2025 inclus l Référence : O6 ROSETTA 2025 012

Description

Votre rôle

La Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles recherche un Collaborateur polyvalent (F/H/X) pour le Service Logistique de l’Administration générale de l’Enseignement (AGE).

Dans Cette Fonction, Vous Serez Principalement Amené à


Être le SPOC (Single Point Of Contact), la personne de référence pour le catering des services de l’Administrateur général :
Organiser les salles de réunion, apprêter les tables et chaises et s'assurer du bon fonctionnement de leurs équipements audiovisuels.
Veiller à la remise en état des salles, en particulier les tables à replacer dans leur configuration initiale.
Gérer minutieusement l’organisation des évènements festifs périodiques et/ ou ponctuels pour une coordination fluide entre les intervenants.
Passer les commandes de catering auprès des différents fournisseurs et veiller à leur réception (traiteur), conservation et acheminement dans la bonne salle (réunion ou cafétaria).
Effectuer, en collaboration avec les collègues du Service logistique, les commandes de fournitures, matériels et mobiliers :
Surveiller les niveaux de stock de fournitures bureautiques, accessoires de tables (set de couverts et papiers de tables), matériels, etc.
Passer commande auprès des différents fournisseurs le cas échéant.
Assurer un soutien logistique varié :
Assurer des tâches de manutention légère, comme déplacer du mobilier, installer de l'équipement (informatiques entre autres) ou signaler des problèmes de maintenance.
Utiliser un véhicule de service pour effectuer des livraisons ou récupérer des fournitures pour l'administration.
Aider à organiser des événements, des formations ou des séminaires, y compris la réservation des lieux, l'organisation du transport, la commande de fournitures et l'installation de l'équipement.
Accueillir les visiteurs, répondre aux appels téléphoniques et fournir un service à la clientèle de qualité aux personnes qui entrent en contact avec l'administration en renfort au Service de l’Accueil.
Assurer des travaux administratifs divers à la demande de la hiérarchie :
Prendre en charge les requêtes par courriels, répondre aux demandes d'information et transmettre les messages aux personnes concernées au sein de l'administration.
Classer, trier et archiver des documents administratifs. S'assurer que les documents importants sont facilement accessibles pour les membres de l'équipe.
S'assurer que toutes les informations pertinentes sont à jour dans les systèmes de l'administration, y compris les coordonnées des employés, les dossiers des clients ou les informations sur les fournisseurs.


Cette liste de tâches est non-exhaustive.

Vous avez une question sur la fonction ? Vous pouvez contacter Monsieur Abdourahman IBRAHIMMIGUIL, responsable du Service Logistique : Abdourahman.IBRAHIMMIGUIL(at)cfwb.be

Rôle du service

Le Service Logistique fait partie de la Direction du Support transversal qui dépend de l’Administrateur général. Il gère notamment les aspects logistiques des services de l’Administrateur général et leur coordination au niveau de l’AGE. Il organise entre autres l’indicatage et gère les ressources matérielles pour le personnel du bâtiment de l’Avenue du Port. Il fournit ainsi un support logistique, administratif ou matériel à l’ensemble des services fonctionnels de l’AGE. Il assure aussi le rôle d’interface entre l’AGE et les référents ou correspondants techniques du Ministère, en coordonnant par exemple les actions relatives à la gestion des bâtiments de l’AGE.

De manière générale, le service s’engage à fournir un support le plus complet à l’administration, pour contribuer à son efficacité et sa productivité. Il s’assure pour ce faire que chacun dispose des ressources (fournitures de bureau, matériels et mobiliers) et du soutien logistique dont il a besoin pour réaliser son travail. Cela comprend des tâches aussi diverses que la gestion des documents, le soutien aux événements, l’achat de fournitures de bureau et le suivi de la maintenance des locaux.

Le service mène également divers projets visant à créer un environnement de travail positif et collaboratif.

Profil

Diplôme(s)

Aucun diplôme n’est requis.

Expérience(s) professionnelle(s)

Requis

Aucune expérience n’est requise.

Cette fonction nécessitera des déplacements en voiture. Vous devez obligatoirement disposer du permis de conduire B.

Atout(s)

Une expérience professionnelle ou de stage dans un des domaines suivants constitue un atout important :


Domaine administratif (ex : traitement des mails et suivi, archivage, etc.)
Domaine logistique (ex : catering et gestion des salles, etc.)


Une expérience professionnelle dans une administration publique constitue un second atout.

Compétences évaluées lors de l’entretien de sélection

Compétences techniques


Connaissances élémentaires de l’organisation du Ministère de la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles et des missions de l’Administration générale de l’Enseignement ;
Bonnes techniques d’expression orale (Pondérée) ;
Bonnes techniques d’expression écrite (Pondérée et Eliminatoire);
Bonnes connaissances en traitement de texte (Word) ;
Connaissances élémentaires en tableur (Excel) (Pondérée).


Compétences comportementales


Travailler en équipe (Pondérée) : vous créez et améliorez l’esprit d’équipe en partageant vos avis et vos idées et en contribuant à la résolution de conflits entre collègues.
Faire preuve de fiabilité : vous agissez de manière intègre, conformément aux attentes de l’organisation. Vous respectez la confidentialité et les engagements et évitez toute forme de partialité.
Agir de manière orientée service : vous accompagnez des clients internes et externes de manière transparente, intègre et objective, vous leur fournissez un service personnalisé et entretenez des contacts constructifs.


Votre motivation sera évaluée lors de l’entretien (Pondérée).

Les compétences marquées d’un « Eliminatoire » sont essentielles pour l’exercice de la fonction et doivent impérativement être réussies avec minimum 60%. Sans quoi l’ensemble de l’entretien sera considéré en échec. Les compétences marquées d'un « Pondérée » sont considérées comme importantes pour la fonction. Elles ont donc une valeur plus importante dans le score final.

Vous avez une question sur la procédure ? sophie.nguyen(at)cfwb.be

Lieu de travail

Bruxelles. Cette fonction nécessitera des déplacements en voiture. Vous devez obligatoirement disposer du Permis de conduire B.

Contrat

Contrat à durée déterminée : Contrat à durée déterminée d’un an avec possibilité de prolongation jusqu’à l’âge de 26 ans, sous réserve d’une faisabilité budgétaire et d’une évaluation favorable.

Temps plein (38h)

Salaire annuel


Entre 29.181,63 € brut et 40.042,73 € brut
Echelle barémique : 300/1
Niveau d'emploi : Pas de diplôme


Avantages


Chèques-repas
Pécule de vacances et allocation fin d'année
Gratuité des transports en commun pour les déplacements domicile – lieu de travail
Indemnité vélo
Assurance hospitalisation de base gratuite
27 jours minimum de congé par an
Pour les enfants du personnel : journées récréatives, chèque Saint-Nicolas, indemnités de stages, allocation de rentrée scolaire, ...


Calculer le salaire

Conditions de recevabilité

Votre Dossier De Candidature Doit Comporter


un CV actualisé et rédigé en français
une lettre de motivation
la copie du permis de conduire B


Pour que votre candidature soit recevable, vous devez être dans les conditions pour bénéficier d'un contrat Rosetta (avoir moins de 26 ans).

Sur la base des lettres de motivation, des curriculum vitae et du nombre de candidatures recevables, le jury de sélection pourra limiter le nombre de candidats à recevoir en entretien.

Diversité et égalité

Le Ministère de la Fédération Wallonie Bruxelles promeut la diversité et l’égalité des chances.

Vous êtes une personne en situation de handicap, avec un trouble d’apprentissage ou une maladie ?

Vous pouvez bénéficier d’un aménagement de la procédure de sélection. Faites en mention dans votre acte de candidature en précisant les informations qui nous permettront d’adapter les conditions de l’entretien. Une question ? inclusion.handicap@cfwb.be

Cas particuliers


Diplôme


Pour les diplômes obtenus dans une autre langue que le français, une attestation de votre connaissance de la langue française est requise. Pour l’obtenir : inscrivez-vous sur travaillerpour.be.

Pour les diplômes obtenus hors Belgique, une attestation d'équivalence du diplôme de la Communauté française est requise. Pour l’obtenir : introduisez une demande auprès de la Direction de la reconnaissance des diplômes étrangers (http://www.equivalences.cfwb.be/)


Nationalité


Si vous êtes ressortissant d’un Etat faisant partie de l’Espace économique européen (ou de la Suisse), vous pouvez participer à la procédure de sélection sans démarches particulière.

Si vous êtes ressortissant hors Espace économique européen, vous pouvez participer à la procédure de sélection mais vous devez disposer d’un titre de séjour et d’un permis de travail valides.

Title: Data Analyst (3-month internship)
Description:
Job Description

Purpose of the position:

Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities

Position Functions


Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Connect & Align with Marketing
Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
Competitor Set Mapping
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition
Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)
Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics


Knowledge And Skills Required


Bachelor Degree
Good Excel / Microsoft Office Skills
Power BI knowledge is a plus
English fluent mandatory
Ability to connect with cross functional teams


#PanEurope

About Us

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.

The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.

Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we’re grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst for a client in Geneva







Mission:




Build an action tracking tool using the Power suite technology based on new and existing processes.
Collaborate with the team to establish dashboards that track the status and action plans per entity using the data in their existing tools.
Set up an easy to use template for the monthly reporting of project status, risk results, mitigation measure tracking etc. combining the data from the existing solutions and the new action tracking app.
Support the teams with smaller dashboarding requirements using Power BI or other solutions.




Profile

You have proven experience with Power BI and other data analytics tool.
You are able to hit the ground running and quickly understand and assimilate needs.
A working knowledge of English is necessary in order to communicate with our regional stakeholders and senior management.










Start Date: ASAP

Duration: 3 months with possibility to be extended

Workload: 80 %

Location: Geneva

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities


Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.




Skills and Abilities


Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.


Qualifications


Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.
Show more

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities

  • Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
  • Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
  • Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
  • Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
  • Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
  • Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.



Skills and Abilities

  • Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
  • Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
  • Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
  • GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
  • Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.

Qualifications

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
  • Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
  • Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
  • Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
  • Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.




With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

“Rethink Everything” is our philosophy – it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.




Lombard Odier Investment Managers (“LOIM”) is the asset management business of the Lombard Odier Group. In order to strengthen our IT team, we are looking for a Geneva based:




Business Intelligence Analyst – Temporary




YOUR ROLE




Participate in support and production activities, including monitoring and maintaining BI jobs and servers
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues related to workflows and dashboards
Support our Business & Product Development team with data request and reporting needs
Migrate manual process (excel) into automated Alteryx workflows & Tableau dashboards
Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Product Development and Client Portfolio Managers to build data solution to help decision making & business tracking
Provide guidance and support to business users in utilizing our Business intelligence for self-service analytics and reporting




YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES




University degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent
Familiarity with Business Intelligence platforms – Tableau & Alteryx preferred
Basic knowledge of Python
Team player with strong communication skills
Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work in fast paced environment




Our Maison’s DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.




As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison’s DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy

Title: Junior Investment / Data Analyst (60-100%)
Description:
Progressive Capital Partners Ltd is an independent Swiss investment boutique focused on alternative investments since its founding in 2001.




Progressive Capital Partners is an authorised asset manager of collective investment schemes and representative of foreign collective investment schemes, supervised by FINMA. Our team is focused on managing investments across diversifying hedge funds (incl. global macro, CTAs, long volatility / convexity, commodities) as well as niche alternative strategies. We are specialised in de-correlated strategies, offering diversification benefits to clients’ more traditional portfolios.




To complement our growing team, we are looking for a




Junior Investment / Data Analyst (60-100%)




We offer a dynamic and diverse work environment within an experienced and entrepreneurial team with high personal responsibility. From the very beginning, you will gain broad exposure across different areas of our business and support the team with a wide range of tasks:




Assisting with the analysis and preparation of reporting and market data,
supporting the selection (incl. due diligence) and ongoing monitoring of invested funds and mandates,
contributing to presentations, reports, and research documents for clients and internal use,
maintaining and further developing tools and databases (Excel; programming skills are a clear plus),
collaborating with the portfolio management and operations teams on various administrative, reporting and organizational tasks, incl. shadow accounting, reconciliations, client reportings, etc.,
contributing to market and strategy research (global focus, across different asset classes).




For these demanding tasks, we are looking for a passionate Junior Investment / Data Analyst who is interested in a broad and truly alternative investment universe with the following background:




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g. business administration, economics, finance, mathematics, data science, natural sciences, or related studies),
initial practical experience gained through internships or working student positions is a plus,
strong interest in financial markets and willingness to take on a broad range of responsibilities,
analytical mindset with a structured and detail-oriented way of working is required,
solid knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel (basic programming skills in VBA, SQL, Python, or similar are an advantage, but not required),
team-oriented with a service-minded attitude,
rigorous, detail oriented, organised, and analytical,
fluent in English, at least conversation level in German,
residency in Switzerland or willingness to relocate.




Please send your complete application documents to hr@progressivecapital.com. We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: KFC Europe - Data Analyst Internship (3 month) - M/F
Description:
About us #PANEUROPE




From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.




We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original. For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.




We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact. The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so. Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we’re grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.




Job description




Data Analyst, support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities.




Job functions




Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization

Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Connect & Align with Marketing




Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe

Competitor Set Mapping
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition




Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics

Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics




Knowledge and skills required




Bachelor Degree
Good Excel / Microsoft Office Skills
Power BI knowledge is a plus
English fluent mandatory
Ability to connect with cross functional teams




Location - Candidate should be based in Lausanne.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT:

L’Occitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).




MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L’Occitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins
Support the deployment of Power BI solution




HOW YOU CAN FIT:

Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is preferred
Proficiency in Excel and Power BI
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline




STARTING DATE: January 2026 for 6 months (full-time position)




LOCATION: Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

Title: Business insights analyst Intern
Description:
About Us:

CHANEL is a dynamic and innovative player in the travel retail industry, committed to delivering exceptional experiences for our global customers. As part of our continued growth, we are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Insights Analyst Intern to join our Global Travel Retail Team. This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our business through insightful data analysis and reporting.

Position Overview:

As a Business Insights Analyst Intern with the Global Travel Retail Team at CHANEL, you will have a versatile role that contributes to both analytical tasks and the strategic communication of findings. You will be responsible for synthesizing business intelligence data, producing monthly reports, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making. You will play an important role in enhancing our existing data models, ensuring accuracy, and presenting information in a clear and concise manner. The ideal candidate is proficient in Excel and PowerPoint, possesses strong analytical skills, and is a collaborative team player.

Key Responsibilities:



Data Management and Relationship Building:
Cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with travel retail data providers.
Ensure the integrity and reliability of data sources, fostering trust and transparency.
Data Analysis and Recommendations:
Review and validate data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
Diligently review data to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Act as a problem solver, proactively identifying areas for improvement and recommending data-driven changes to enhance CHANEL's global presence.
Industry Insight and Trend Analysis:
Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate relevant insights into reports.
Communicate insights to our Travel Retail Teams, keeping CHANEL at the forefront of the industry.
Reporting Excellence :
Contribute to CHANEL's Monthly Reports, providing clarity and context to analyse data on the travel retail industry.
Curate industry articles to create monthly newsletter adapted to be shared with different teams.
Present information in a clear and concise manner with a keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity.
Utilize Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools to present data in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand format.
Dashboard Maintenance:
Ensure timely updates of the Power BI platform with the latest data for real-time insights.
Contribute to the improvement and expansion of existing data models.
Support and Collaboration:
Assist the Junior Business Intelligence Manager and the Strategic Projects & Insights Director in daily operations.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to achieve common goals and objectives.
Work closely with CHANEL's Global Insight team to help to conduct surveys within airports worldwide.
Responsively address Ad hoc analysis requests and questions from CHANEL colleagues.
Ensure timely and accurate information is provided to guide decision-making.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. (e.g., Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science).
Proven experience in data analysis or similar role, preferably in the travel retail and/or luxury industry.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Experience with Power Query is a plus.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Detail-oriented with the ability to simplify complex information.
Keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity, ensuring precision and visual harmony in all aspects of the role.
Proficient in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.



Job Conditions:

An internship agreement is mandatory for this position and must meet the following conditions:



The internship must be part of your study program.
The internship must be required for the completion of your degree.
The internship must be validated by the award of academic credits.



Job Information:



Contract: Full-time internship (100%) and in-person
Start date: January 5, 2026
Duration: 6 months
Working days: 5 days a week, Monday to Friday
Location: Geneva



Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !

Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Your mission


Performing data analyses and summarizing financially relevant data from various departments (i.e., target/actual comparisons, KPIs, etc.)
Creating and further developing code-based reports and BI dashboards with a quantitative focus for various stakeholders
Supporting the maintenance, validation, and documentation of databases, data pipelines, and software interfaces
Improving data quality using appropriate tools, further developing existing collection methods, and visualizing the results
Automating and optimizing data processes and assisting with the rollout of new data solutions
Performing backtests on raw data to analyze and evaluate investment, fund, and company data
Assisting with administrative tasks such as coordinating data access or reporting requests and preparing presentation content


Your profile


Completed degree in data science, business informatics, computer science, or a comparable qualification
Initial professional experience in a data-driven environment is an advantage
Solid knowledge of R, Python, SQL, and Excel
Basic knowledge of quantitative financial analysis and data interpretation in an investment context
Strong affinity for numbers, analytical skills, results-oriented approach, and willingness to learn
Confident written and spoken German, ideally good English skills
Independent, self-reliant approach to working in a team


Why us?


Dynamically growing company with flat hierarchies
A wide range of creative opportunities
Committed and motivated team
Attractive salary package
Training and development opportunities
Flexible working hours
Modern offices in a central location


Notes regarding your application

We look forward to receiving your application!

Please fill out our online application form and upload your complete application documents. Once we have received your documents, we will send you a confirmation.

Please note that we can only accept applications submitted via the online form.

Title: Junior Financial Data Analyst Graduate
Description:
Launch your career with impact!

We’re looking for curious, motivated graduates with strong people skills who want to grow, learn, and make a difference. If you hold a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD and have up to three years of professional experience, apply to our 18-month Graduate Programme starting 1 September 2026.

You’ll gain hands-on experience in the fast-paced world of reinsurance, rotate into a different team, and receive tailored training to build your expertise. This is your chance to shape your future – and help protect societies from the world’s most complex risks.

About The Role

As a Junior Financial Data Analyst, you'll work at the intersection of risk analytics and capability development, creating powerful insights that drive decision-making. This cross-functional position offers the opportunity to support multiple product areas while engaging in meaningful project work that makes a real difference.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze scenarios to determine impact on risk measures and balance sheet metrics
Support management reporting through execution and enhancement of risk reports
Evaluate financial market risks embedded within reinsurance transactions using in-house models
Integrate data across various internal and external sources to create unified insights
Develop risk models and tools to enhance analytical capabilities across the organization


About The Team

Risk Monitoring & Analytics (RMA) within the Solvency & Financial Risk Management (SFRM) department will be your homebase during the programme. You will have the opportunity to complete one or two rotations of 16-20 weeks in total (possible destinations could be Treasury, Asset Management or other areas of the Solvency & Financial Risk Management department such as credit risk management, risk modelling, financial model validation). SFRM has presence in Zurich, London, New York City / Armonk, and Bangalore. RMA is mandated to report risks and analytics to internal and external stakeholders (e.g. regulators).

About You

We're looking for a curious, detail-oriented individual with strong analytical skills and a passion for financial data. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with excellent communication abilities and thrives in a collaborative environment where continuous learning is encouraged.

We Are Looking For Candidates Who Meet These Requirements


Master's degree in a quantitative subject (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Finance) with up to 3 years of professional experience
Solid coding skills in at least one major computer language (R and/or Python)
Intellectual curiosity, drive and interest in financial and quantitative topics
Full proficiency in English


Desirable But Not Required


Prior professional experience with financial risk management (quantitative / market / credit etc.), Treasury or within Asset Management in the banking or (re)insurance sector


Opportunities For Further Learning And Growth


Gain insights on how Assets, Liabilities and Capital are managed in a large Reinsurance setup
Understand the modeling and valuation of a wide variety of financial securities and insurance products
MS SQL Server databases and Analysis Services and/or with the DAX query language
Deep R proficiency incl package development, environment management, code optimization, RShiny dashboards etc
Explore opportunities on a variety of Gen AI use cases


The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process.

The application process is open for at least 4 weeks and if you do not hear from us within this time frame, it does not mean your application is ignored. We will get back to you latest by mid-November.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.
