Reference Code: 135186

Title: Safety Science Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Sobi offers the opportunity to work at an international pharmaceutical company focused on specialty pharmaceuticals meeting the high medical needs of rare disease patients and providing treatment and services to them. Our employees come from a variety of backgrounds within research, healthcare, industry and the academic sphere.

Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!

At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.

As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.

We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.

Job Description

The Safety Science Data Analyst supports the Safety Science department’s mission of safeguarding patient health by generating actionable insights from safety data. This role will play a critical role in analyzing, visualizing, and reporting safety data to support signal detection, regulatory compliance, and informed safety-related decision-making. This position is essential to maintaining data accuracy, consistency, and traceability while enhancing the PV data infrastructure in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.

The Safety Science Data Analyst works collaboratively with other members of the Safety Science Team, the Sobi Global Pharmacovigilance team, the Global PV Vendor System Manager, IT, Statistical and Medical Data Intelligence Center, and Quality, and other relevant functions across Sobi, to ensure that safety science activities are delivered to ethical and safety quality standards to ensure safety of patients, and compliance with GVP, GCP and worldwide regulatory requirements. It operates in collaboration with the Global PV Vendor System Manager to provide performance oversight, facilitate the generation of specific Safety surveillance and ad hoc reports and contribute to the proper configuration and maintenance of the vendor safety database. This includes leading internal initiatives for IT system and data handling enhancements, as well as contributing to vendor(s)’ initiatives. Other areas of focus include but are not limited to, piloting and implementing new technologies, integrating safety science advancements and innovation projects e.g. on smart data handling, retrieval and visualization improvements.

Key Responsibilities

Including, but not limited to the following:


Act as super user in the vendor’s safety database, collaborate with the Global PV Vendor System Manager and prepare data retrieval and visualization requests required for process-related or ad hoc activities.
Evaluate and implement (as appropriate) fit for purpose data presentation e.g. for safety surveillance and signal evaluation activities, for aggregated reports or special scenarios including ad hoc requests from Health Authorities.
Generate safety reports and dashboards using tools such as Excel, Power BI, and other data visualization platforms.
Perform safety data queries and trend analyses from the safety database to identify patterns and anomalies.
Support signal detection activities by providing data-driven insights and visualizations of case trends.
Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and traceability of safety data to meet regulatory and organizational standards.
Collaborate with IT teams, safety advisers, and the PV System Vendor Manager to enhance and optimize the data infrastructure.
Translate complex data outputs into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of PV processes by identifying opportunities for automation and efficiency in data handling.
Maintain compliance with global pharmacovigilance regulations and guidelines in all data-related activities.
Acts as back-up for the Global PV Vendor System Manager.


Core Interactions

This Position Will Work Closely With:


Safety Advisers to provide data insights for case evaluations and signal detection.
Statistical and Medical Data Intelligence Center to ensure high-quality clinical outputs and visualizations
IT teams to ensure the robustness and scalability of PV data systems.
The PV System Vendor Manager to address system-related issues and implement enhancements.
Regulatory Affairs and Quality Assurance teams to ensure alignment with compliance requirements.


Size & Dimension of the Role


Responsible for generating and maintaining safety reports and dashboards for ~35,000 cases annually.
Authority to design and review data visualizations and reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Expected to handle multiple projects simultaneously with minimal supervision, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality outputs.


Qualifications

Education/Learning Experience/Work Experience

Required:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Biostatistics, Computer Science, Life Sciences, or a related field.
Knowledge of pharmacovigilance principles and safety databases (e.g., Argus, ARISg)
3-4 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry.
Hands-on experience with pharmacovigilance processes and case data structures is highly desirable.


Skills/Knowledge/Languages

Required:


Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Power BI, SQL, and Python/R.
Strong understanding of pharmacovigilance processes, safety databases, and case data structures.
Excellent data visualization skills with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner.
Knowledge of MedDRA coding and the ability to assess the impact of MedDRA updates on safety data and reporting.
Familiarity with safety database updates and their implications for PV operations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Fluency in English (written and spoken); additional language skills are a plus.
Ability to work effectively to fulfill ambitious goals
Sound and balanced judgment skills; able to assess and handle risks; self-confident, proactive and decisive
Strong collaborator within PV function, leadership and the wider organisation
Has the expertise, determination and courage to resolve or escalate issues as appropriate


Personal Attributes

Required:


Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Proactive and self-motivated with a commitment to continuous learning and improvement.
Adaptable to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
Proven delivery focus and solution builder


Additional Information

How to apply

We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.

Why Join Us?

Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team:


Emphasis on work/life balance
Collaborative and team-oriented environment
Opportunities for professional growth
Diversity and Inclusion
Competitive compensation for your work
Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


Sobi is a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. We are a specialised international biopharmaceutical company transforming the lives of people with rare and debilitating diseases, providing reliable access to innovative medicines in the areas of haematology, immunology, and specialty care. Sobi’s share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. More about Sobi at sobi.com and LinkedIn.

We know our employees are our most valuable asset and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.

Sobi Culture

At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.

As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

Title: Data Analytics Intern
Description:
Gravis Robotics is a startup that turns heavy construction machines into intelligent and autonomous robots. Our unique combination of learning-based automation and augmented remote control lets one operator safely conduct a fleet of earthmoving machines in a gamified environment. Our team has over a decade of academic experience honing the cutting edge of large-scale robotics, and is rapidly growing to bring that expertise into a trillion dollar industry through active deployments with market leaders.

About The Job

At Gravis, we engineer solutions at the nexus of hardware and software every day: bringing new perception and control technologies onto awesome, autonomous machines. Our Rooftop Autonomous Control Kit (Rack) combines sensors, compute, communication and networking modules toward a manufacturer-agnostic solution that can be applied to a variety of construction machines regardless of type and age. We are seeking a passionate and experienced Data Analytics Intern to join our team for a 6-month duration: you will play a crucial role in setting up our data pipeline and analyzing data from our autonomous excavators. You will work closely with a team of talented engineers to build up our analytics infrastructure and extract insights for engineering and business leaders. We are a team that values collaboration & innovation and contributions are directly visible.

Key Responsibilities


Design and implement robust data pipelines for collecting, storing, and processing data from autonomous machine operations and simulations
Set up and maintain data infrastructure, including databases, data warehouses, and ETL processes
Develop and optimize data models to support analytical and reporting needs
Collaborate with engineering and business teams to understand data requirements and deliver scalable data solutions
Automate data-related tasks and build tools to improve data accessibility and usability
Continuously monitor and improve the performance and reliability of the data pipeline



Required Qualifications


Completed Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or a related field
Experience with data pipelines, cloud infrastructure and data analysis
Coding skills in C++ or Python
Clear communication, strong problem-solving skills, and a collaborative mindset



Preferred Skills


Experience with SQL databases
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and data warehousing
Fast learner and not afraid to ask questions
Proactive personality with an urge to deliver high quality outcomes
Self motivated team player who is up to the challenge of bringing data from construction sites to business insights



Don't meet every requirement? If you're enthusiastic about this role but your experience doesn't match every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be the perfect candidate for this or other positions.

This is an opportunity to join a dynamic and versatile team, and to be part of a young startup that will revolutionize heavy construction. Gravis Robotics offers a fair market salary and a working location in the vibrant city of Zurich. As a forward-facing startup, we understand that work-life balance and flexibility are important considerations for many professionals: If you are a highly qualified candidate with the requisite skills and experience, we encourage you to apply and discuss your preferred working arrangement during the interview process.

Gravis is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team, and do not discriminate based upon race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, gender expression, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.

We are an international team that is working to solve problems with a global impact: to facilitate efficient communication and collaboration, proficiency in English is a requirement for all roles.

Title: Data Analyst (CDI - 100%)
Description:
QoQa c'est tout d'abord près d'1 million de membres de notre magnifique Qommunauté qui profitent chaque jour de bons plans dénichés par nos équipes.

Notre succès, nous le devons avant tout au formidable travail de nos 240 loutres qui oeuvrent quotidiennement pour proposer le meilleur service possible.

Nous recherchons désormais la perle rare pour rejoindre la team Data!

Ta mission, si tu l'acceptes


Tu rejoindras l'équipe Data afin de soutenir les départements Finances et Ressources Humaines dans la mise en place d'un environnement de données robuste, sécurisé et orienté analyse.
Ton objectif : garantir la clarté et la fiabilité des indicateurs internes pour permettre un pilotage éclairé et proactif de notre organisation.
En étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers, tu sauras comprendre leurs enjeux pour concevoir des solutions pertinentes, adaptées et réellement data-driven.
Tu participeras également à différents projets transverses de l'équipe, selon les priorités du moment.


Parlons de toi et de tes compétences

Ton expérience - Ta formation


Bachelor en informatique, de gestion des données ou domaine équivalent.
Minimum 3 ans d'expérience en traitement et analyse de données dans un poste similaire.
Une expérience et des connaissances dans les domaines de la Finance, comptabilité et payroll constituent un atout majeur.


Tes compétences - Tes qualités


Excellente maîtrise de SQL et bonne compréhension des bases de données relationnelles.
Expérience confirmée avec DBT (Data Build Tool) ou un outil similaire pour la gestion de pipelines de données.
Connaissance de GitHub
Bonne maîtrise d'un outil de datavisualisation, idéalement Tableau, pour transformer les données en rapports clairs et percutants.
Capacité à collaborer avec les métiers, à comprendre leurs besoins et à concevoir des solutions pertinentes.
Approche rigoureuse et orientée résultats.
Intérêt marqué pour les logiques comptables, RH ou financières.
Connaissance de l'ERP Odoo (un plus).


Pour que tu restes au taQuet, on t'offre


Un environnement sain où tu peux être toi même
Un système de gouvernance en Holacratie
Une ambiance et cadre de travail agréables dans notre nouveau QG
Un temps de travail flexible, et hybride
Des avantages aux petits oignons (LPP avantageuse, plan de mobilité, abonnement téléphonique pris en charge, 5 semaines de vacances, 10 chf crédités chaque jour pour manger dans notre super restaurant du QG...)
La possibilité de formation continue et développement


Les prochaines étapes

Tu sens que tu peux relever ce défi ?

Pour entrer dans la course, il te suffit de nous envoyer au minimum un CV et une lettre de motivation personnalisée. Dis-nous pourquoi tu serais la personne parfaite pour ce job et quels sont tes super-pouvoirs : Surprends-nous!

Nous te remercions (et la planète aussi) de ne pas envoyer de candidature papier.

Si ton parcours correspond avec nos attentes pour le poste, nous t'inviterons à découvrir notre tanière et à nous faire découvrir tes talents sur le terrain. Dans le cas contraire, tu recevras un e-mail des loutres dans les meilleurs délais.

Alors maintenant, jette-toi à l'eau et tente ta chance!

Entrée en fonction : ASAP (mais on pourra t'attendre si tu es la bonne personne)

Taux: 100%

Lieu : Bussigny, QG

HTML:
QoQa c'est tout d'abord près d'1 million de membres de notre magnifique Qommunauté qui profitent chaque jour de bons plans dénichés par nos équipes.

Notre succès, nous le devons avant tout au formidable travail de nos 240 loutres qui oeuvrent quotidiennement pour proposer le meilleur service possible.

Nous recherchons désormais la perle rare pour rejoindre la team Data!

Ta mission, si tu l'acceptes

  • Tu rejoindras l'équipe Data afin de soutenir les départements Finances et Ressources Humaines dans la mise en place d'un environnement de données robuste, sécurisé et orienté analyse.
  • Ton objectif : garantir la clarté et la fiabilité des indicateurs internes pour permettre un pilotage éclairé et proactif de notre organisation.
  • En étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers, tu sauras comprendre leurs enjeux pour concevoir des solutions pertinentes, adaptées et réellement data-driven.
  • Tu participeras également à différents projets transverses de l'équipe, selon les priorités du moment.

Parlons de toi et de tes compétences

Ton expérience - Ta formation

  • Bachelor en informatique, de gestion des données ou domaine équivalent.
  • Minimum 3 ans d'expérience en traitement et analyse de données dans un poste similaire.
  • Une expérience et des connaissances dans les domaines de la Finance, comptabilité et payroll constituent un atout majeur.

Tes compétences - Tes qualités

  • Excellente maîtrise de SQL et bonne compréhension des bases de données relationnelles.
  • Expérience confirmée avec DBT (Data Build Tool) ou un outil similaire pour la gestion de pipelines de données.
  • Connaissance de GitHub
  • Bonne maîtrise d'un outil de datavisualisation, idéalement Tableau, pour transformer les données en rapports clairs et percutants.
  • Capacité à collaborer avec les métiers, à comprendre leurs besoins et à concevoir des solutions pertinentes.
  • Approche rigoureuse et orientée résultats.
  • Intérêt marqué pour les logiques comptables, RH ou financières.
  • Connaissance de l'ERP Odoo (un plus).

Pour que tu restes au taQuet, on t'offre

  • Un environnement sain où tu peux être toi même
  • Un système de gouvernance en Holacratie
  • Une ambiance et cadre de travail agréables dans notre nouveau QG
  • Un temps de travail flexible, et hybride
  • Des avantages aux petits oignons (LPP avantageuse, plan de mobilité, abonnement téléphonique pris en charge, 5 semaines de vacances, 10 chf crédités chaque jour pour manger dans notre super restaurant du QG...)
  • La possibilité de formation continue et développement

Title: Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%
Description:
Du suchst eine spannende Herausforderung in einem dynamischen, europaweit führenden Unternehmen? Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenmodellen gesammelt und möchtest deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und dein technisches Verständnis gewinnbringend einsetzen? Effizienz und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für dich selbstverständlich und du möchtest deine Stärken in einem engagierten Team entfalten?

Dann bist du bei uns als




Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%




genau richtig! Als europaweit führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen im Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk sowie in der Industrie bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und die Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten.

Werde Teil eines traditionsreichen Familienunternehmens, das Innovation grossschreibt und Kundenorientierung lebt. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an wegweisenden Lösungen und schaffen nachhaltigen Mehrwert – für unsere Kunden, für dich und für die Zukunft.

Was dich erwartet

Regelmässiges Reporting und Ad hoc Analysen für Marketing & Vertrieb
Aufbereiten grosser Datenmengen
Selbstständige Weiterentwicklung der Reporting-Landschaft
Laufende Preis-, Konditions- und Provisionsspeicherungen in SAP inkl. Datenaufbereitung
Erstellen von Kunden- und Umsatzlisten sowie Verkaufshistorien
Pricing-Restrukturierung: Preiskalkulation & Konditionsmanagement
Abweichungsanalysen (Plan-Ist)
Auswertungen und Analyse von Sonderprojekten inkl. Aufbereitung der Daten




Was dich auszeichnet

Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im (Marketing-/Vertriebs-) Controlling
Technisches und analytisches Verständnis
Umfangreiche IT-Kenntnisse (SAP, MS Office)
Offenheit und Kommunikationsfähigkeit zählen zu deinen Stärken
Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig und strukturiert, hast eine rasche Auffassungsgabe und verfügst über eine ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise
Eine gewissenhafte und exakte Arbeitsweise ist für dich selbstverständlich
Du kommunizierst auf Deutsch, Englisch und Französisch




Was wir bieten

Die Werte und Nachhaltigkeit eines Familienunternehmens. Gleichzeitig stellen wir uns heute für die Zukunft auf: Kundenzufriedenheit und Digitalisierung stehen dabei für uns stark im Vordergrund. Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Wandlungsprozesses und ebne mit deiner erfolgreichen Arbeit den Weg für deine und unsere Weiterentwicklung.




Wer wir sind

165 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen schweizweit. Über 36.000 Artikel für das Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk. Professionelle Beratung und individueller Service mit über 50 Jahren Erfahrung. Kurzum: ein führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen. So viel zu den reinen Fakten. Aber hinter der Marke BERNER steckt etwas noch viel Wertvolleres: ein Familienunternehmen mit ebenso viel Herz wie Verstand.

Wir freuen uns auf deine detaillierte Bewerbung (Lebenslauf mit Foto, Zeugnisse und Arbeitszeugnisse) mit Lohnvorstellung, bevorzugt per E-Mail an: jobs.berner-ch@berner-ag.ch

Show more

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for candidates with hands on experience in Data Modeling and ability to work directly with customer.




Job Description - Data Modeler

Hands-on experience in designing data models
Hands-on experience with SQLs
Hands of experience on Data warehousing and ETL concepts
Analyzing and translating business needs into long-term solution data models.
Evaluating existing data systems.
Working with the development team to create conceptual data models and data flows.
Developing best practices for data coding to ensure consistency within the system.
Reviewing modifications of existing systems for cross-compatibility.
Knowledge of telecom domain is an advantage.




Are you ready to help the largest enterprises in the world create a more intelligent future with cloud, machine learning and analytics? We are expanding our highly motivated and energetic team to lead our customers through some of their most critical transformation initiatives.




About Impetus

Impetus Technologies is a digital engineering company.
We deliver expert services and products in cloud data engineering and analytics space to help large enterprises in their digital transformation journey /goals. Enabling an intelligent, data-driven future for our customers.
We solve Analytics, AI (Artificial Intelligence), and Cloud puzzle for fortune 500 companies to help drive innovation and growth for them.
Headquartered in Los Gatos, California, with offshore development centers. We also have office in Canada.
Year on Year we have grown more than 40% and have been we have been recognized as one of the best companies to work for.




Impetus's LeapLogic helps customers migrate from their legacy technologies like Teradata, Netezza, Oracle among others to a cloud-native deployment with 90%+ automation. We call it Automagical...and welcome you to share this magic of workload transformation with our customers.




Impetus' services business helps customers build enterprise-class data platforms on the most modern best-in-class cloud technologies and implement use cases that increase revenue, customer experiences, streamline supply chains, by helping build new data products and much more.

As they say, "It takes a village to..." Impetus and its community of Partners will join you on this transformation initiative.

Title: Data Analyst Operations Research (100%, all genders)
Description:
Join our cutting-edge Operations Research & ATM (Air Traffic Management) team to lead the way towards sustainable, efficient, and punctual flight operations! Be a part of the team that is shaping the future of European air traffic management and making air travel more sustainable!

Starting date: November 01, 2025 or upon agreement

12 months limited position

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in SWISS’s engagement in European SESAR research projects and work at the heart of our airline operations with the following tasks:


Lead technical developments, live operational validations and implement the Target Time Management System (TTMS) product in collaboration with industry partners
Collaborate closely with other Operations departments like Flight Dispatch and Operations Control and external partners such as Skyguide and Zurich Airport
Design and develop innovative and tailored solutions to business problems and test them in operations by developing proof of concepts and refine them into productive tools
Provide technical expertise in back- and front-end development for existing and new prototype tools
Visualize and present complex information to internal and external stakeholders and partners
Generate insights from operational data sets & trial results leading to operational improvements


Benefits


Paid maternity and paternity leave
25 days of annual vacation
Flight benefits
Remote working (e.g. from home)
Attractive company pension scheme
Subsidized parking or public transport
13th monthly salary
Diversity programmes
Company health management


Requirements

We are looking for a motivated new colleague to join our team, eager to pursue innovative ideas, exploring new technologies, and applying them in practice.


Master’s degree in aviation, engineering, or data science, or a Bachelor’s degree combined with substantial relevant experience
Min. 2 + years of professional experience as a Data Analyst, ideally in the airline/flight operations industry
Proven skills in Python or C#; experience with front-end frameworks (e.g., Angular, Dash) is an advantage
Solid understanding of modern IT practices (Cloud, DevOps, etc.) and affinity for new technologies
Ability to create clear and effective data visualizations, applying best practices to highlight key insights and support data-driven decisions.
Excellent communication and argumentation skills, proactive and creative mindset, team-oriented
Fluent in English (spoken/written), German is an advantage


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Yannick Gramfort

recruiting.services@swiss.com

Title: Commercial Data & Analytics Intern
Description:
At Bavarian Nordic, we are committed to saving and improving lives by unlocking the power of the immune system. Our commercial product portfolio includes market-leading vaccines against smallpox, mpox, rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, typhoid fever, and cholera. We excel in R&D innovation, manufacturing, and commercialization, striving to improve people's health and quality of life worldwide, protecting our tomorrow. Join us in our mission to make a difference.

As part of our growth journey, we are looking to strengthen the Commercial Operations Team with a full-time Commercial Data & Analytics Intern. The position can be located in either Denmark, Switzerland, or Germany. The role will work in collaboration with the commercial teams to support data analysis and produce and maintain dashboards to track KPIs.

Join our team and let's make a difference together.

Key responsibilities:


Analyze field force and sales performance data to uncover actionable insights
Build, maintain, and enhance Power BI dashboards to improve reporting and transparency
Track SF performance KPIs to support sales managers' activities and improve sales execution
Ensure data consistency and data quality by performing checks and validations
Support the Data & Analytics team with ad hoc analysis and reporting tasks
Respond to data and analysis requests from commercial stakeholders across departments


Qualifications, preferred skills, and experience:


Bachelor’s degree/completion of a Master´s degree in Statistics, Business, Econometrics, Data Analytics, or a related field
Proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling and DAX, and Excel
Comfortable working with large datasets and complex data structures
Familiarity with CRM systems and marketing automation tools is a big plus
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset
Relevant previous experience is a strong plus


The position is for a min. of 6 months.

We offer the opportunity to work in an international company with unique technology and a dedicated workforce. We welcome people who share our passion with a willingness to make a difference. We offer a dynamic and flexible work environment and an opportunity to develop your personal and academic competencies.

Caught your interest?

If you are ready to take on a pivotal role in a growing organization and drive meaningful change in healthcare, apply now and join Bavarian Nordic in our mission to improve health outcomes and foster sustainable growth.

Founded in 1994, we have +30 years of experience developing life-saving vaccines. We are a global leader in smallpox and mpox vaccines. Our commercial product portfolio contains market-leading vaccines against rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, cholera, typhoid, and Ebola. We are headquartered in Denmark and have manufacturing, research, and sales offices across Europe and North America. Our values – our Bavarian Nordic DNA, as we like to call it – are what guide our actions every day. We act as persistent pioneers, embrace change, value being boosted by the team, and believe in protecting lives every day. If that is also a part of your DNA, we invite you to join us in Bavarian Nordic! Bavarian Nordic is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

www.bavarian-nordic.com

Title: Data Analyst- GPS Analytics
Description:
Gefällt Ihnen dieser Job? Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt.

Data Analyst – GPS Analytics

Switzerland-based client in the Banking sector

Your Tasks


Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights
Develop, maintain, and optimize data visualizations, dashboards, and reports for stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision making
Identify opportunities for process improvements through data analysis and automation
Present findings and recommendations clearly to management and business stakeholders



Your Experience/knowledge


Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field
3+ years of professional experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL and Excel
Expertise in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Experience with statistical programming languages such as Python or R
Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes
Knowledge of financial markets, trading instruments, and market data feeds (e.g., stocks, options, futures, forex)
Familiarity with data governance and data quality best practices
Language skills: English required; German is a plus



Your Soft Skills


Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication and presentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment



Location: Switzerland

Work setting: Hybrid

Sector: Banking

Start: Immediate

Duration: 12 Months +

Workload: Full-time

Ref.Nr.: BH 23404

Take the next step and send a resume along with a daytime phone number where the candidate can be reached.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, only applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens, and current work-permit holders for Switzerland can be considered.

Applications are welcomed from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in the application.

As per client requirements, information about marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit is needed. For applicants with disabilities, potential solutions can be explored with the end client.

Title: Business Insights Manager
Description:
Role Profile: Business Insights Manager (80 – 100%)

Position Title: Business Insights Manager

Location: Baar, Switzerland

Department: Innovation and Business Excellence (IBEX)

Reports To: Commercial Excellence Lead

About AstraZeneca

At AstraZeneca, we do things differently. We’re resetting expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening up new ways to work, groundbreaking innovative methods, and bringing unexpected teams together. Here, we see the impact of our collective ideas and expertise, and the power of science to deliver them. Making the impossible a reality can mean taking a chance on an idea and investing in our outstanding capacity for innovation and discovery. We champion trying new things and nurture a 'test and learn' culture, which means we are always progressing close to our goals. Interested? Come and join our journey.

This Is What You Will Do

The Business Insights Manager is responsible for delivering strategic insights that drive key business decisions within our pharmaceutical operations. This role is essential in transforming data into actionable insights that align with and advance our organizational goals, supporting the marketing, sales, and medical teams, and supporting functions with evidence-based strategies. The Business Insights Manager informs and influences decision-making across functions by enabling high-quality analytics, evidence-based decision support, development of dashboards and tools, and supporting operational needs.

Organizationally, you are part of the IBEX area — and at the same time, you work closely with the sales, marketing, supporting functions, and senior leaders across the Swiss Marketing Company.

You Will Be Responsible For


Business Insights: Design, lead, and execute qualitative and quantitative strategic analysis initiatives to address key business questions related to commercial products and or operational data.
Competitive Intelligence: Proactively monitor industry, product, and competitors, economic trends, all on international, national, and regional levels.
Strategy Shaping: Contribute to the development/revision of market strategies and identify actionable insights based on data to sustainably accelerate business performance.
Forecasting: Build patient funnels and ambitious & reliable sales forecasts, and act as a partner and challenger for business.
Market Research: Conduct and consolidate market research to identify new opportunities, assess the competitive landscape, and support strategic planning.
Visualisations: Co-develop adequate Business Intelligence visualisations to transparently assess performance & benchmark across teams & geographies.
Performance Monitoring: Track and report on the performance across brands, identifying trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Customer Engagements & Sales Force Effectiveness: Define KPIs, analyse field and CRM engagement data, and deliver insights that sharpen targeting, channel mix, and next-best actions to drive SFE and customer engagement strategy.
Reporting: Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that deliver comprehensive insights into commercial performance in close collaboration with the cross-functional team
Process Improvement: Identify bottlenecks in commercial processes to increase efficiency and effectiveness in sales and marketing operations
Insight Communication: Present findings and insights to stakeholders and senior management with a high degree of accuracy and appropriate context, providing data-driven recommendations for business strategy.


Qualifications & Experience


Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Life Science, and/or Data Science, or related field; Master's preferred.
Experience: Minimum 3 years in business analytics and reporting or similar roles within the pharmaceutical sector (commercial experience is an advantage)
Skills:
Proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., SQL, Python, Tableau) and MS Office Suite
Demonstrated experience in user-centric dashboard design/development (e.g. Power BI)
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Fluency in English (German and/or French are nice to have)
Experience with CRM and data integration into Power BI (preferred)
Competencies:
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities with deep knowledge of data manipulation, harmonisation, and integration
Proven commercial acumen with the ability to link analytics to business outcomes, prioritise impact, and influence stakeholders with clear recommendations
High learning agility and ability to navigate ambiguity
High standards for data accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to changing priorities
Skilled at working effectively within cross-functional teams
Confidence in requirements gathering and stakeholder management at all levels
Ability to lead projects independently and communicate with leadership stakeholders

We offer

When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we fuel ambitious thinking with the power to encourage life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace, and challenge perceptions. That’s why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office.

But that doesn't mean we’re not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.

Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca, we are leading a transformation, fusing our digital and data capabilities with backing from the business to make it happen. We are leveraging our leading technologies and exploring data to make improved decisions and help the business to reach the right outcomes quickly. We are a diverse team of technical experts, each bringing something different to the table. What unites us is our dedicated desire to learn. We partner across the business, getting involved in projects early on to ensure the right technologies are implemented. We're recognised for the big contributions we make to AstraZeneca. As our data and digital capabilities expand every day, we know we're playing our part in accelerating AstraZeneca's growth.

Ready to make a difference? Apply now and join us in our mission to build a better future for patients worldwide!

Date Posted

09-Sept-2025

Closing Date

22-Sept-2025

AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements.
Show more

Title: Consultant(e) Business Intelligence (Power BI / SAP BO)
Description:
Talan est un groupe international de conseil et d’expertises technologiques qui accélère la transformation de ses clients par les leviers de l'innovation, la technologie et la data. Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille et accompagne les entreprises et les institutions publiques dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation et d'innovation en France et à l'international.

Présent sur cinq continents, dans 18 pays, le Groupe, certifié Great Place To Work, qui comptera plus de 7200 collaborateurs fin 2024, ambitionne de réaliser un chiffre d'affaires de 850 millions d'euros cette même année et de dépasser la barre du milliard d'euros à horizon 2025.

Doté d'un Centre de recherche et d'innovation, Talan met l'innovation au cœur de son développement et intervient dans les domaines des mutations technologiques telles que l'Intelligence Artificielle, la Data Intelligence, la Blockchain, pour servir la croissance des grands groupes et des ETI dans une démarche engagée et responsable. www.talan.com

En plaçant au cœur de sa stratégie « L’innovation Positive » le Groupe Talan est convaincu que c’est en étant au service de l’humain que la technologie démultiplie son potentiel pour la société

Job Description


Nous recherchons un(e) expert(e) Business Intelligence capable de combiner une solide expertise technique et une vision stratégique pour transformer des besoins métiers complexes en solutions IT performantes.

🎯 Vos missions :



Définir la stratégie et les guidelines autour des plateformes BI.
Déployer des solutions avancées Power BI.
Recueillir et challenger les besoins métiers puis les traduire en spécifications techniques.
Piloter et réaliser les upgrades SAP Business Objects.
Concevoir et maintenir les univers SAP BO, développer rapports et dashboards (Webi, Crystal Reports).
Gérer les droits d’accès et le déploiement via CMC.
Concevoir et maintenir des modèles de données en SQL/PLSQL.
Assurer le support des applications Finance et le suivi des batchs quotidiens.
Intervenir sur la résolution d’incidents et requêtes utilisateurs dans le respect des SLA.



Qualifications


7 à 10 ans d’expérience avec Power BI.
Plus de 3 ans d’expérience avec SAP Business Objects (BO).
Une expérience dans le secteur bancaire/financier est un atout.
La connaissance de Microsoft SSAS est un avantage.
Connaissance des langages : SQL, PL/SQL, KSH
Diplôme de niveau Master.
Langues requises : Français ET Anglais courant.



Additional Information


📍 Résidence Suisse obligatoire 📍

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Model Validation Specialist?




Do you enjoy working on Independent Model Validation within Model Risk Management?




Then the role of Model Validation Specialist might be a good fit for you!




Our client, operating in the Financial Services industry, is looking for an expert to support them in the space of Independent Model Validation for regulatory compliance.




As a Model Validation Specialist, you will provide expertise in the domain of US withholding tax regulation (Section 871(m)), equity derivatives modelling, and quantitative analysis.




Setting: As part of the team, you will be focused on delivering the highest quality validation work, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, and producing clear, well-structured validation reports.




Focus: Independent validation of a model developed to determine the US withholding tax status of financial equity-linked instruments in line with Section 871(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.




Background: To succeed in this role, you will need prior experience in withholding tax regulations (US), equity derivatives product knowledge (including Greeks), and strong quantitative modelling skills.




Duration: This is an initial contract from 25.08.2025 to 31.10.2025 with the possibility of extension.




Workload: 80%




Location: Zurich.




For more information on this Model Validation Specialist opportunity or any other similar roles I am currently working on, please send your CV to:




📧 vuk.susa-stupar@nicollcurtin.com




📞+41 43 508 26 71

Title: (Junior) Consultant
Description:
Du bist ein Young Professional und suchst eine Herausforderung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Marktforschung und Unternehmensberatung als:




(Junior) Consultant




Pensum: 100 Prozent Stellenantritt: nach Vereinbarung


Aufgaben



Betreuung von Forschungs- und Beratungsmandaten über alle Phasen des Projekt-managements


Durchführung von Workshops


Erstellen von Kunden- und Marktanalysen


Teilnahme bei Kundenmeetings


Unterstützung bei der Kundengewinnung



Qualifikation



Masterabschluss in Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften

(Universität oder Fachhochschule)


Zahlenaffin und Kompetenzen in empirischen Methoden sowie R-/R-Stuio-Kenntnisse


Sicheres Auftreten und gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch


Hohes Engagement, belastbar und effiziente Arbeitsweise


Erste Berufserfahrung im Bereich Marktforschung, Beratung oder Marketing von Vorteil



Benefits



Professionelles Consulting-Umfeld auf anspruchsvollem, internationalem Niveau mit namhaften Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Wirtschaftsbranchen


Kleines, dynamisches Team im Zürcher Technopark – vernetzt mit Spezialist:innen in der DACH-Region


Selbstständige und flexible Arbeitseinteilung mit Möglichkeit von Home Office


Einblicke in das gesamte Unternehmen


Offenes und entspanntes Arbeitsklima, wo eigene Ideen auf Resonanz stossen.





Wir sind ein international tätiges Beratungs- und Researchunternehmen, spezialisiert auf eine effiziente und effektive Marktbearbeitung. Wir verknüpfen Zielgruppen, Touchpoints und Inhalte und holen so messbar das Maximum aus den Investitionen unserer Auftraggeber.




Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Aufgaben

  • Betreuung von Forschungs- und Beratungsmandaten über alle Phasen des Projekt-managements

  • Durchführung von Workshops

  • Erstellen von Kunden- und Marktanalysen

  • Teilnahme bei Kundenmeetings

  • Unterstützung bei der Kundengewinnung


Qualifikation

  • Masterabschluss in Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften

    (Universität oder Fachhochschule)

  • Zahlenaffin und Kompetenzen in empirischen Methoden sowie R-/R-Stuio-Kenntnisse

  • Sicheres Auftreten und gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch

  • Hohes Engagement, belastbar und effiziente Arbeitsweise

  • Erste Berufserfahrung im Bereich Marktforschung, Beratung oder Marketing von Vorteil


Benefits

  • Professionelles Consulting-Umfeld auf anspruchsvollem, internationalem Niveau mit namhaften Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Wirtschaftsbranchen

  • Kleines, dynamisches Team im Zürcher Technopark – vernetzt mit Spezialist:innen in der DACH-Region

  • Selbstständige und flexible Arbeitseinteilung mit Möglichkeit von Home Office

  • Einblicke in das gesamte Unternehmen

  • Offenes und entspanntes Arbeitsklima, wo eigene Ideen auf Resonanz stossen.


Wir sind ein international tätiges Beratungs- und Researchunternehmen, spezialisiert auf eine effiziente und effektive Marktbearbeitung. Wir verknüpfen Zielgruppen, Touchpoints und Inhalte und holen so messbar das Maximum aus den Investitionen unserer Auftraggeber.


Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Title: Student assistant - analysis of research infrastructure
Description:
The swiss national science foundation (SNSF)




Thousands of scientists supported by the SNSF conduct research into nature, technology, and society. Their findings form the basis for progress. Our task is to select the best research ideas in national competitions. We are committed to promoting Switzerland as a strong research location and communicating the value of research. Become part of our team!




Student assistant - analysis of research infrastructure (m/w/d




The Long-Term Research sector is responsible at the SNSF for supporting certain research infrastructures and conducts evaluation mandates for infrastructures of national importance on behalf of the Confederation. As part of a federal mandate, it is developing a concept aimed at specifying its role in the evaluation and funding of infrastructures, complementing the efforts of higher education institutions, the Confederation, and the Academies. To support the preparation of this concept regarding the SNSF’s future responsibilities in research infrastructures, we identify model infrastructures and analyze their funding mechanisms for both development and operation.




Responsibilities




A list of approximately ten research infrastructures is established by the LTRI committee, which oversees the project at the Research Council level. For each infrastructure on this list, a “case study” analysis is conducted following a predefined framework:

Infrastructure characterization: Scientific domains, nature of services, user base, brief history of the creation and development of the infrastructure, recent examples of supported projects and a brief presentation of their results.
Infrastructure organization: Responsible institutions, partnerships (e.g., academic, industrial, or technological), governance and organizational chart, management and staff (organization, specializations).
Funding: Brief history of past funding (main phases, funding sources, encountered issues and key decisions), current funding (structure, processes, and attached conditions), monitoring and reporting.
Strategy and Development Perspectives: Brief SWOT analysis of the infrastructure, strategy and development plans, main challenges.




Qualifications




Strong interest and sensitivity for research management, particularly in relation to research infrastructure.
Basic training in economics and management is an asset.
Analytical and synthesis skills, ability to design and conduct specialized interviews (case study writing).
Working language: English.
Master’s level education or advanced Bachelor’s level are an asset
Basic training in economics and management is an asset.




What we offer




An exciting working environment at the interface of science, politics and international relations. The SNSF stands for equal opportunities, diversity and the promotion of innovative ideas in science. We offer you a responsible position with creative freedom, flexible working arrangements and attractive employment conditions.




Work package




We estimate that analyzing a case study takes on average 4 to 5 working days. An introductory session and an interview with infrastructure representatives are included for each case study. The person in charge of the project will support you throughout the task. We are looking for three people for this task, with a minimum of 3 infrastructures per person (12 working days). The analysis must be completed no later than October 31, 2025.




Contact




For more information, please contact Stéphanie Wyss (stephanie.wyss@snf.ch, responsible for the project) or Izzettin Sönmez, Talent Acquisition and Employer Branding Partner

Show more

Title: Intern Data Science
Description:
Internship Opportunity: Data Science (Advanced Analytics Team)

At Abbott, we believe in empowering people to live healthier, fuller lives. With a presence in over 160 countries and a diverse team of 114,000 colleagues, we’re committed to innovation in diagnostics, medical devices, nutrition, and pharmaceuticals.

We are looking for a curious, collaborative, and impact-driven Data Science Intern to join our Advanced Analytics team at EPD’s global headquarters in Basel. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to meaningful healthcare solutions while growing your skills in a supportive and inclusive environment.

Location: Allschwil-Basel, Switzerland

Duration: 6 months

Division: Abbott Established Pharmaceutical Division (EPD)

Why Join Us?


Purpose-Driven Work: Your contributions will help shape data-driven strategies that improve healthcare outcomes globally.
Inclusive Culture: We value diverse perspectives and foster a culture where everyone—regardless of gender, background, or experience—can thrive.
Mentorship & Growth: You’ll work closely with experienced data scientists and receive guidance to support your professional development.


What You’ll Work On


Explore ways to reduce latency in LLMOps pipelines using techniques like model distillation, caching strategies, and prompt engineering.
Research and propose frameworks for automating repetitive tasks using multi-agent collaboration.
Collaborate with senior data scientists to understand business challenges across operations, finance, and supply chain.
Conduct data exploration, cleaning, and visualization to uncover insights.
Support model development workflows including feature engineering and validation.
Document findings to promote knowledge sharing and reproducibility.
Stay curious and continuously learn about emerging technologies in AI and data science.


What We’re Looking For


Currently pursuing a Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., applied mathematics, computer science, engineering, statistics).
Experience with full-cycle data science projects and applying methods to real-world problems.
Familiarity with tools like LangChain, Hugging Face, and vector databases.
Programming skills in Python or R; knowledge of object-oriented languages is a plus.
Understanding of software engineering principles and testing frameworks.
Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS/SageMaker is a bonus.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
Fluency in English; other languages are a plus.


We Encourage You To Apply If You


Are passionate about using data to solve meaningful problems.
Enjoy working in diverse teams and learning from others.
Want to grow your career in a supportive and innovative environment.


Ready to Make an Impact?

Send us your CV (PDF format) and show us how your curiosity and skills can help shape the future of healthcare. We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

Title: Reference Data Analyst
Description:
Reference Data Analyst
______________________________________________________________________
Location: Zurich, Switzerland
Type: Full-time
Department: Financial Markets
_______________________________________________________________________
Summary
As a Reference Data Analyst you will be responsible for the accurate creation, maintenance, and governance of static and dynamic reference data across multiple financial products and systems.
This role plays a critical part in supporting collateral management operations by ensuring data integrity, timely updates, and alignment with regulatory and operational standards.
Responsibilities
- Maintain and validate reference data for counterparties, securities, and agreements used in collateral management systems and workflows.
- Set up accounts in Collateral Management Systems, ensuring alignment with CSAs, ISDA, and SMA agreements.
- Collaborate with middle office, risk, and legal teams to onboard new counterparties, secure approvals and update records.
- Liaise with external vendors (e.g., Bloomberg, Markit, DTCC) and internal stakeholders to source and verify data.
- Initiate and coordinate SSIs setup requests and coordinate with Ops teams and stakeholders.
- Address queries related to collateral accounts, SSIs setup.
- Plan and track client onboarding schedules, highlighting dependencies and risks.
- Maintain trackers and provide regular status updates in meetings and calls.
- Ensure timely coordination and escalation of issues/risks.
- Support additional or ad-hoc requests and projects.
- Adhere to operational controls (e.g. SOPs, SLAs, and KPIs).
- Participate in data quality initiatives, including exception reporting, root cause analysis, and remediation.
- Contribute to automation and process improvement efforts using tools such as Alteryx, Xceptor, or internal workflow engines.
- Ensure compliance with internal controls, audit requirements, and regulatory standards.
Eligibility Requirements
- Ideally, 1–5 years of experience in reference data management, preferably within collateral, middle office, or securities operations.
- Good understanding of financial instruments (e.g., OTC derivatives, equities, fixed income, FX) and collateral lifecycle.
- Ideally, familiarity with collateral management platforms (e.g., AcadiaSoft, TriResolve, Murex) and data governance tools.
- Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, lookups), with exposure to SQL or data visualisation tools being a plus.
- Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
- Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
- Preferred Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, or a related field.
- Knowledge of regulatory frameworks impacting collateral and data.
- Experience with reconciliation tools and exception management workflows.

- Languages - German and/or English

- Work Permit - Must possess a Swiss Work Permit or a EU Passport

About eClerx
eClerx is a leading provider of productized services, bringing together people, technology and domain expertise to amplify business results.

The firm provides business process management, automation, and analytics services to a number of Fortune 2000 enterprises, including some of the world’s leading financial services, communications, retail, fashion, media & entertainment, manufacturing, travel & leisure, and technology companies. Incorporated in 2000, eClerx is traded on both the Bombay and National Stock Exchanges of India. The firm employs more than 19,000 people across Australia, Canada, France, Germany, Switzerland, Eqypt. India, Italy, Netherlands, Peru, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, the UK, and the USA.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across the company. As part of our central data team, you will collaborate closely with analysts from various Business Units and our data engineering team to ensure we have the highest quality data. Your analytical insights will directly influence the direction of our tools and key company objectives.

If you thrive on breaking down complexity into actionable tasks using data, are excited about working on innovative and fast-evolving ideas, and are passionate about leveraging data to protect and enhance privacy for millions of users worldwide, we would love to hear from you!

What You Will Do



Design and visualise new KPIs capturing product success and actionable insights able to uncover new opportunities.
Monitor and Synthesize KPIs to create reports capturing key company and cross-product level insights, challenging the status quo.
Translate company-level goals into analytical tasks to ensure a data-driven approach.
Collaborate closely with engineering teams to increase the quality and usability of our data within a privacy-first ecosystem.
Mentor junior team members on statistical techniques and exploratory data analysis to achieve the right balance of analytical proficiency and business impact.
Maintain and improve our A/B testing framework within our privacy-first in-house tool used by all data analysts to evaluate and document A/B tests.
Empower stakeholders to make data-driven decisions by developing training sessions on how to use and extract insights from our dashboards.



Job Requirements



Minimum 6 years' work experience as a Data Analyst with focus on statistics, data exploration and visualisation.
Solid statistical background and experience in conducting hypothesis testing, A/B analysis and exploratory analysis.
Ability to work large business concepts into actionable analytical tasks, including handling uncertainty and open-ended problems.
Excellent knowledge of SQL and at least one programming language, preferably Python.
Proven track record of prioritizing effectively and working independently in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
Great communication skills, with the ability to adapt to both technical and non-technical audiences to achieve results.



Bonus points for:



Previous experience mentoring team members.
Hands on experience with Metabase, Clickhouse, Git and Spark.
Previous experience in Software as a Service (SaaS) products and data privacy applications



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.


Show more

Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management
Description:
Switzerland

Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management

Organization


International Organization for Migration


Posted 1 Sep 2025 Closing date 11 Sep 2025

Job Identification (Reference Number): 16354

Position Title: Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management

Duty Station City: Geneva

Duty Station Country: Switzerland

Classification: Intern, Grade Other

Type of Appointment : Internship, four months with possibility of extension

Closing date: 11 September 2025

Introduction

Established in 1951, IOM is a Related Organization of the United Nations, and as the leading UN agency in the field of migration, works closely with governmental, intergovernmental and non-governmental partners. IOM is dedicated to promoting humane and orderly migration for the benefit of all. It does so by providing services and advice to governments and migrants.

Context

IOM established the Global Data Institute to harness the power of its data for operations, making meaning of global migration patterns, and providing foresight. The Global Data Institute capitalizes on synergies between its two units--the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) and the Global Migration Data Analysis Center (GMDAC)--and collaborates with a network of regional data specialists to illuminate the global data story of human mobility.

The Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) has been IOM’s main operational tool for tracking and monitoring the movements and evolving needs of displaced populations since 2004. It has been systematically deployed in medium to large-scale humanitarian response operations in the last four years, including in all Level 3 emergencies. As of 2023, DTM was active in 100 countries, tracking and monitoring over 57 million IDPs.

Under the overall supervision of the Global DTM Coordinator and direct supervision of the Data Science Support Officer, the DTM Visualization and Data Management Intern will be responsible and accountable for providing support to the activities and services provided by DTM support team in headquarters for DTM implementation in the field worldwide, to support development and implementation of supplementary and interoperable systems for quality assurance and further improvement of global DTM data and analysis.

Responsibilities

Technical


Utilization of relevant business intelligent tool for interpreting and analysing raw data into meaningful information and key findings.
Visualizing data, designing, and creating reports for accessibility in compliance with the DTM standards


Teamwork


Provide support to ensure standards in published DTM data on IOM websites, primarily displacement.iom.int, but may include any other portal as required by operations and global developments.
Implement data quality control mechanisms for DTM operations worldwide as set by the global standard.
Contribute to the implementation and roll out of responsible data mechanisms in DTM implementation worldwide. This includes the aspect of data governance, data protection, data security, and ethics in the collection and use of DTM data.
Support the development and adaptation of standard operating procedures for DTM field data collection and management.
Support the implementation of global DTM survey, tracking system for DTM operations worldwide, as well as addressing queries on data collected by DTM field operations, based on data consolidated in the Central Data Warehouse and any other databases available.
Support the development and implementation of Kobo forms to support DTM field operations worldwide.
Perform any other tasks as assigned.


Training Components and Learning Elements


Gain a thorough understanding of DTM methodologies, forms development and data management at DTM.
Develop technical knowledge of DTM data quality standards and tools used to support DTM operations at global, regional and country levels.
Gain a good understanding of humanitarian data collection and the use of data collection, management and analysis tools in the context of emergencies.
Develop communication skills to analyze, report and present on status, challenges and solutions related to data collection and management at country level.


Qualifications

Education


Pursuing degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Analytics or related field; with two years of relevant professional experience. Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured.


Accredited Universities are those listed in the UNESCO World Higher Education Database.

Experience


Knowledge of databases management, querying, quality assurance and control systems. Additional work experience is an advantage;
Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured;
Experience in the development and implementation of the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) or similar assessment and information management activities; and,
Experience in building interactive dashboards using Microsoft Power BI and/or Tableau is preferred.


Skills


Good data visualization skills in HTML5 or JavaScript environments; experience with AngularJS, NodeJS, or D3 is a plus;
Valued proficiency in using two or more of the following tools: XLS forms for ODK or Kobo, Microsoft Access, Python, Stata, or R;
Strong skills in working with relational databases, including SQL and/or Azure SQL, particularly for managing survey data;
Excellent communication skills, with a high degree of efficiency and adaptability;
Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage multiple tasks;
Strong attention to detail, commitment to data quality, and ability to meet tight deadlines; and,
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with a creative approach to data interpretation and visualization


Languages

For this position, fluency in English and Spanish is required (oral and written). Working knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, French, Chinese, and Spanish) is an advantage.

IOM’s official languages are English, French and Spanish. All staff members are required to be fluent in one of the the three languages.

Proficiency of language(s) required will be specifically evaluated during the selection process, which may include written and/or oral assessments

Note

Eligibility and Selection

In general, the Internship Programme aims at attracting talented students and graduates who:


have a specific interest in, or whose studies have covered, areas relevant to IOM programmes and activities;
are holding a scholarship for internship placements in international organizations and/or for whom internship is required to complete their studies; or
are sponsored by governmental/non governmental institutions and/or academia to work in specific areas relevant to both IOM and the sponsor.
are either enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (minimum Bachelor’s level or equivalent) or have graduated in the last 12 months.
are between 20 and 36 years of age.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, and additional enquiries will only be addressed if the candidate is shortlisted.
Depending on experience and location, IOM provides a small monthly stipend to help offset costs.
Please consider the cost of living in the duty station prior to applying.


Required Competencies

IOM’s competency framework can be found at this link Competencies will be assessed during the selection process.

Values - all IOM staff members must abide by and demonstrate these values:


Inclusion and respect for diversity: Respects and promotes individual and cultural differences. Encourages diversity and inclusion.
Integrity and transparency: Maintains high ethical standards and acts in a manner consistent with organizational principles/rules and standards of conduct.
Professionalism: Demonstrates ability to work in a composed, competent and committed manner and exercises careful judgment in meeting day-to-day challenges.
Courage: Demonstrates willingness to take a stand on issues of importance.
Empathy: Shows compassion for others, makes people feel safe, respected and fairly treated.


Core Competencies – behavioural indicators


Teamwork: Develops and promotes effective collaboration within and across units to achieve shared goals and optimize results.
Delivering results: Produces and delivers quality results in a service-oriented and timely manner. Is action oriented and committed to achieving agreed outcomes.
Managing and sharing knowledge: Continuously seeks to learn, share knowledge and innovate.
Accountability: Takes ownership for achieving the Organization’s priorities and assumes responsibility for own actions and delegated work.
Communication: Encourages and contributes to clear and open communication. Explains complex matters in an informative, inspiring and motivational way.


How to apply

To apply, interested applicants are invited to submit their applications HERE via the IOM Career Gateways by 11 September 2025.

Title: Internship Global Master Data Analyst 80-100% (m/f/d)
Description:
Switzerland, Visp

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Key Responsibilities

The Master Data department in Visp is a global team responsible for the development of master data processes and standards that are to be followed by the whole organization. As an intern, you will play an active role in:


Perform various data analyses and reports to support Master data or Business projects
Assisting with SAP Master Data mass maintenance and migration efforts
Gathering feedback from global and local Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) across the organization
Defining functional and technical requirements for the development or enhancement of Master Data processes
Updating and improving training materials, and delivering hands-on training sessions to teams across Lonza


As a part of the Global Master Data team, you will be able to learn SAP Materials Management (MM), Production & Planning (PP) and Sales & Distribution (SD) modules, key business processes as well as SAP data structures. Overall, you will interact with many different departments and experts across the company worldwide.

Key Requirements


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or equivalent experience) in data science, computer science, business information technology, or mathematics
Solid understanding of data structures or hands-on experience with databases
Proficiency in English; German and other languages are a valuable plus
A passion for optimizing processes, improving IT tools, and exploring innovative solutions
You are interested in being a reliable team member in a multi-cultural environment.


Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Reference: R69860

Apply
