Title: Data Specialist – CDO Global Black Belt
Description:
Microsoft’s Commercial Solution Area (CSA) sets the sales strategy, leads technical sales, and operations as a hub for the Commercial Solution Areas and Support Services that power the Microsoft Cloud. Data & Analytics is a growth opportunity for Microsoft Azure, as well as its partners and customers. It includes a rich portfolio of products providing unified Data Platform supporting customers’ Data needs in the era and AI.

The Azure Global Black Belt (GBB) Cloud & AI Data Specialist is a pivotal role in building trust with the Chief Data Officers (CDOs) of our customers, guiding them to build the Data Foundations for their companies’ AI Transformation and influencing them to standardize on the Microsoft Intelligent Data platform. This role is crucial for driving the adoption of Azure Data & AI Services, with a particular focus on the MACC (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitment) accounts.

The role engages with CDOs of our largest accounts and accounts in complex competitive situations, documenting best practices and learnings. The role also involves guiding the broader field on the winning formulas for successful CDO engagements.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

Accelerate Data & AI growth while influencing Product Excellence and Go-To-Market with the insights and experiences from these engagements.


Strategic Relationships: Establish trusted advisor relationships with senior business and technology executives (CDO, CIO, CISO, CTO) in top accounts by consistently delivering value through Azure-led innovation, while amplifying Microsoft’s thought leadership by actively shaping and participating in CDO community forums, executive panels, and strategic storytelling platforms.
Drive Data & AI Platform Standardization: Influence CDOs to standardize on the Microsoft Data & AI platforms end-to-end, across their Analytics platform, Data Governance, and Databases to support their companies’ AI transformation.
Accelerate Azure Data Services Growth: Drive the increase of Azure Data Services share in key accounts, with a focus on MACC accounts. Key outcome: Increase ADS (Azure Data Services) share of ACR (Azure Consumed Revenue) in MACC agreements / MACC accounts, win new MACCs (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitments).
Remove blockers and accelerate sales: Identify and resolve roadblocks that may hinder customer progress, bring values into deal strategy to assist sellers with deep expertise in top partner offerings globally, capacity and pricing/SKU/model, use case scenarios, process, business value articulation for assigned specialization area.
Win Over Competitors & Business Commitment: Expert in compete coaching against major Public Cloud Hyper Scalers competitors by defining winning competitive strategies (win back, surround), demonstrating superior solutions and securing business commitment.
Incubation to Mainstream: Spot repeatable patterns in sales motions (e.g., commercial constructs, customer scenarios) and scale them across the field.
Sales Strategy Feedback Loop: Working with Go-To-Market team to capture insights from customer engagements and field feedback to identify sales patterns, blockers, and opportunities. Share these insights with MCAPS to help shape better sales strategies that continuously meet customer needs and field realities.
Knowledge Transfer to Sales Roles: Work with enablement team as a scale mechanism to skill specialist, specialist managers, and sales leaders through deal coaching, structured knowledge sharing, and training.
Thought Leadership: Be a leading industry expert and drive awareness and adoption through speaking at events, publishing articles, and sharing best practices.


Key Outcomes


Increase ADS share of ACR in MACC agreements / MACC accounts.
Enhanced consistency and effectiveness in CDO engagements across the timezone.
Documented best practices and winning formulas for CDO engagements.
Successful execution of Data & AI solution plays, driving business growth and customer success.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications (RQs/MQs):


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration,
OR related field AND growing experience in technology-related sales or account management;
OR highly experienced in technology-related sales or account management
Significant experience leading the sales of large cloud engagements, especially those involving Data, Analytics and AI solutions to large/global enterprise customers.

Additional Or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Sales Account Planning and Management: Strong and disciplined pipeline management, identification and analysis of customer usage trends, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation experience, understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.
Executive Presence: Experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the business value and cost savings of the solution to the customer’s overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.
Collaborative: Orchestrate and influence virtual sales/technical/support/partner teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead virtual teams through influence.
Consumption Business Strategy / Project Management: Experience leveraging cloud adoption methodologies and frameworks to structure application migration projects.
Deep understanding of the Microsoft Data platform and Azure Data and AI Services.
Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud & AI competitor landscape including AWS and GCP.
Microsoft Partners: Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.

For Austria Only: The salary for this role is starting from EURO 182,600 per annum depending on experience.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. Title: Data Specialist – CDO Global Black Belt
Description:
Microsoft’s Commercial Solution Area (CSA) sets the sales strategy, leads technical sales, and operations as a hub for the Commercial Solution Areas and Support Services that power the Microsoft Cloud. Data & Analytics is a growth opportunity for Microsoft Azure, as well as its partners and customers. It includes a rich portfolio of products providing unified Data Platform supporting customers’ Data needs in the era and AI.

The Azure Global Black Belt (GBB) Cloud & AI Data Specialist is a pivotal role in building trust with the Chief Data Officers (CDOs) of our customers, guiding them to build the Data Foundations for their companies’ AI Transformation and influencing them to standardize on the Microsoft Intelligent Data platform. This role is crucial for driving the adoption of Azure Data & AI Services, with a particular focus on the MACC (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitment) accounts.

The role engages with CDOs of our largest accounts and accounts in complex competitive situations, documenting best practices and learnings. The role also involves guiding the broader field on the winning formulas for successful CDO engagements.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

Accelerate Data & AI growth while influencing Product Excellence and Go-To-Market with the insights and experiences from these engagements.


Strategic Relationships: Establish trusted advisor relationships with senior business and technology executives (CDO, CIO, CISO, CTO) in top accounts by consistently delivering value through Azure-led innovation, while amplifying Microsoft’s thought leadership by actively shaping and participating in CDO community forums, executive panels, and strategic storytelling platforms.
Drive Data & AI Platform Standardization: Influence CDOs to standardize on the Microsoft Data & AI platforms end-to-end, across their Analytics platform, Data Governance, and Databases to support their companies’ AI transformation.
Accelerate Azure Data Services Growth: Drive the increase of Azure Data Services share in key accounts, with a focus on MACC accounts. Key outcome: Increase ADS (Azure Data Services) share of ACR (Azure Consumed Revenue) in MACC agreements / MACC accounts, win new MACCs (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitments).
Remove blockers and accelerate sales: Identify and resolve roadblocks that may hinder customer progress, bring values into deal strategy to assist sellers with deep expertise in top partner offerings globally, capacity and pricing/SKU/model, use case scenarios, process, business value articulation for assigned specialization area.
Win Over Competitors & Business Commitment: Expert in compete coaching against major Public Cloud Hyper Scalers competitors by defining winning competitive strategies (win back, surround), demonstrating superior solutions and securing business commitment.
Incubation to Mainstream: Spot repeatable patterns in sales motions (e.g., commercial constructs, customer scenarios) and scale them across the field.
Sales Strategy Feedback Loop: Working with Go-To-Market team to capture insights from customer engagements and field feedback to identify sales patterns, blockers, and opportunities. Share these insights with MCAPS to help shape better sales strategies that continuously meet customer needs and field realities.
Knowledge Transfer to Sales Roles: Work with enablement team as a scale mechanism to skill specialist, specialist managers, and sales leaders through deal coaching, structured knowledge sharing, and training.
Thought Leadership: Be a leading industry expert and drive awareness and adoption through speaking at events, publishing articles, and sharing best practices.


Key Outcomes


Increase ADS share of ACR in MACC agreements / MACC accounts.
Enhanced consistency and effectiveness in CDO engagements across the timezone.
Documented best practices and winning formulas for CDO engagements.
Successful execution of Data & AI solution plays, driving business growth and customer success.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications (RQs/MQs):


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration,
OR related field AND growing experience in technology-related sales or account management;
OR highly experienced in technology-related sales or account management
Significant experience leading the sales of large cloud engagements, especially those involving Data, Analytics and AI solutions to large/global enterprise customers.

Additional Or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Sales Account Planning and Management: Strong and disciplined pipeline management, identification and analysis of customer usage trends, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation experience, understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.
Executive Presence: Experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the business value and cost savings of the solution to the customer’s overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.
Collaborative: Orchestrate and influence virtual sales/technical/support/partner teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead virtual teams through influence.
Consumption Business Strategy / Project Management: Experience leveraging cloud adoption methodologies and frameworks to structure application migration projects.
Deep understanding of the Microsoft Data platform and Azure Data and AI Services.
Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud & AI competitor landscape including AWS and GCP.
Microsoft Partners: Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.

For Austria Only: The salary for this role is starting from EURO 182,600 per annum depending on experience.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Business Analyst (DWH, ETL, Data)
Description:
Beschreibung:

Für ein anspruchsvolles Projektumfeld suchen wir eine/n erfahrene/n Business Analyst / Data Analyst. Sie unterstützen mit fundierter Erfahrung in Daten- und Businessanalyse, erstellen Fachkonzepte und fungieren als Schnittstelle zwischen Fachbereichen und IT. Sie bringen praktische Erfahrung aus grösseren Data-Warehouse-Projekten mit.




Durchführung von Business- und Datenanalysen in komplexen Projektumgebungen
Erarbeitung und Dokumentation von Spezifikationen und Fachkonzepten
Unterstützung bei der Erstellung von technischen Designs im Datenumfeld
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Business-Stakeholdern, Architekten und Entwicklungsteams
Beitrag zur erfolgreichen Umsetzung von Data-Warehouse-Lösungen




Anforderung:

Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Business Analyst oder Data Analyst
Praxis in grösseren Data-Warehouse- oder BI-Projekten wünschenswert
Erfahrung in der Analyse und Aufbereitung von Daten sowie im Erstellen von präzisen Fachspezifikationen
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und gute Kommunikationsskills
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse, Englisch von Vorteil




Einsatzort:

Bern (1 Tag onsite, Rest Remote innerhalb der Schweiz)




Startdatum:

01.09.2025




Pensum:

100%




Projektdauer:

6 Monate ++

Title: Data Engineer H/F
Description:
📢 𝗤𝗨𝗜 𝗘𝗦𝗧 𝗥𝗘𝗗𝗦𝗘𝗡 ?




Redsen est un cabinet de conseil de 160 collaborateurs en 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗱𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗲𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗴𝗮𝗻𝗶𝘀𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗲. Cela signifie que notre mission est d’accompagner nos clients lors de leurs projets informatiques et métiers de 3 manières :




✅ Conseil stratégique et opérationnel

✅ Mise à disposition d’expertises

✅ Développement technique par le biais de notre centre de services




Dans le cadre d’une mission, nous recherchons un(e) Data Engineer pour renforcer nos équipes et intervenir auprès de nos clients sur des projets stimulants.




📍 Envie d’un nouveau défi ? Regardez s’il vous correspond ! 👇







📝 VOS MISSIONS PRINCIPALES




Concevoir, implémenter et maintenir des pipelines de données performants, évolutifs et optimisés sur Databricks, en assurant leur migration depuis les systèmes existants et leur intégration dans des workflows CI/CD.
Déployer, administrer et surveiller les pipelines et la plateforme Databricks via des pratiques d’automatisation et de CI/CD, en garantissant leur disponibilité, leur intégrité et leurs performances.
Collaborer avec les équipes internes et les parties prenantes pour comprendre les besoins métier et proposer des solutions analytiques adaptées.
Structurer et préparer les données en collaboration avec les ingénieurs data pour répondre aux besoins d’analyse et de reporting.
Réaliser des analyses exploratoires pour identifier des modèles, tendances et insights à forte valeur ajoutée.
Concevoir, développer et maintenir des tableaux de bord et rapports décisionnels clairs et exploitables.
Fournir un support technique aux utilisateurs internes exploitant Databricks et accompagner leur montée en compétence.
Rédiger et mettre à jour la documentation technique, tout en assurant une veille technologique pour identifier des opportunités d’amélioration, d’innovation et d’optimisation des processus CI/CD.







💼 VOTRE PROFIL




Diplômé(e) d'études supérieures en systèmes d'information (École d’ingénieurs / HES / Master) avec au minimum 5 ans d'expérience comme Data Engineer
Exellente maitrise de Databricks
Excellente maîtrise de Python et des bonnes pratiques d’ingénierie logicielle
Compétences avancées en SQL pour la conception et l’optimisation de requêtes et de workflows de données, avec une bonne maîtrise de Git et des pipelines CI/CD
Bonne connaissance des environnements cloud AWS et/ou Azure, ainsi que de leurs principaux services de traitement et stockage (Lambda, Functions, S3, RDS, etc.)
Idéalement vous connaissez Terraform
Maîtrise du français (langue maternelle ou niveau C1 minimum) et de l’anglais (niveau B2 minimum).




📌 INFORMATIONS DU POSTE




📄Type de contrat : CDI

📅Date de début : début octobre au plus tard

📍Localisation : Genève (résidence suisse souhaitée au démarrage)

💻Télétravail : Oui, selon les règles en vigueur pour les frontaliers & clients







🎁 POURQUOI REDSEN SUISSE ?




Rejoignez un cabinet à taille humaine, indépendant, au service de clients variés.
Profitez d’un cadre exceptionnel en Suisse : qualité de vie, nature⛰, activités, culture, ...
📈Une évolution qui suit votre ambition : un plan de carrière personnalisé et l'accès à des formations et certifications.
🤝Un accompagnement sur mesure : un management de proximité et une équipe RH toujours disponible pour vous guider dès votre arrivée et vous soutenir lors de vos missions.
Les activités insolites de la Redsen League : poterie, wakesurf, paddle, stand de tir, quizzroom… et bien sûr, le week-end ski ! ⛷




Un cabinet engagé dans la Responsabilité Sociétale et Environnementale, reconnue par la certification B Corp 🌱




Vous souhaitez rejoindre l’aventure Redsen ?




📩 Candidatez dès maintenant ! 🚀😊

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Show more

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.



Qualification Path


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process.   • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.


Equal Opportunity

Title: Data Specialist – CDO Global Black Belt
Description:
Microsoft’s Commercial Solution Area (CSA) sets the sales strategy, leads technical sales, and operations as a hub for the Commercial Solution Areas and Support Services that power the Microsoft Cloud. Data & Analytics is a growth opportunity for Microsoft Azure, as well as its partners and customers. It includes a rich portfolio of products providing unified Data Platform supporting customers’ Data needs in the era and AI.

The Azure Global Black Belt (GBB) Cloud & AI Data Specialist is a pivotal role in building trust with the Chief Data Officers (CDOs) of our customers, guiding them to build the Data Foundations for their companies’ AI Transformation and influencing them to standardize on the Microsoft Intelligent Data platform. This role is crucial for driving the adoption of Azure Data & AI Services, with a particular focus on the MACC (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitment) accounts.

The role engages with CDOs of our largest accounts and accounts in complex competitive situations, documenting best practices and learnings. The role also involves guiding the broader field on the winning formulas for successful CDO engagements.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

Accelerate Data & AI growth while influencing Product Excellence and Go-To-Market with the insights and experiences from these engagements.


Strategic Relationships: Establish trusted advisor relationships with senior business and technology executives (CDO, CIO, CISO, CTO) in top accounts by consistently delivering value through Azure-led innovation, while amplifying Microsoft’s thought leadership by actively shaping and participating in CDO community forums, executive panels, and strategic storytelling platforms.
Drive Data & AI Platform Standardization: Influence CDOs to standardize on the Microsoft Data & AI platforms end-to-end, across their Analytics platform, Data Governance, and Databases to support their companies’ AI transformation.
Accelerate Azure Data Services Growth: Drive the increase of Azure Data Services share in key accounts, with a focus on MACC accounts. Key outcome: Increase ADS (Azure Data Services) share of ACR (Azure Consumed Revenue) in MACC agreements / MACC accounts, win new MACCs (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitments).
Remove blockers and accelerate sales: Identify and resolve roadblocks that may hinder customer progress, bring values into deal strategy to assist sellers with deep expertise in top partner offerings globally, capacity and pricing/SKU/model, use case scenarios, process, business value articulation for assigned specialization area.
Win Over Competitors & Business Commitment: Expert in compete coaching against major Public Cloud Hyper Scalers competitors by defining winning competitive strategies (win back, surround), demonstrating superior solutions and securing business commitment.
Incubation to Mainstream: Spot repeatable patterns in sales motions (e.g., commercial constructs, customer scenarios) and scale them across the field.
Sales Strategy Feedback Loop: Working with Go-To-Market team to capture insights from customer engagements and field feedback to identify sales patterns, blockers, and opportunities. Share these insights with MCAPS to help shape better sales strategies that continuously meet customer needs and field realities.
Knowledge Transfer to Sales Roles: Work with enablement team as a scale mechanism to skill specialist, specialist managers, and sales leaders through deal coaching, structured knowledge sharing, and training.
Thought Leadership: Be a leading industry expert and drive awareness and adoption through speaking at events, publishing articles, and sharing best practices.


Key Outcomes


Increase ADS share of ACR in MACC agreements / MACC accounts.
Enhanced consistency and effectiveness in CDO engagements across the timezone.
Documented best practices and winning formulas for CDO engagements.
Successful execution of Data & AI solution plays, driving business growth and customer success.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications (RQs/MQs):


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration,
OR related field AND growing experience in technology-related sales or account management;
OR highly experienced in technology-related sales or account management
Significant experience leading the sales of large cloud engagements, especially those involving Data, Analytics and AI solutions to large/global enterprise customers.

Additional Or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Sales Account Planning and Management: Strong and disciplined pipeline management, identification and analysis of customer usage trends, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation experience, understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.
Executive Presence: Experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the business value and cost savings of the solution to the customer’s overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.
Collaborative: Orchestrate and influence virtual sales/technical/support/partner teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead virtual teams through influence.
Consumption Business Strategy / Project Management: Experience leveraging cloud adoption methodologies and frameworks to structure application migration projects.
Deep understanding of the Microsoft Data platform and Azure Data and AI Services.
Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud & AI competitor landscape including AWS and GCP.
Microsoft Partners: Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.

For Austria Only: The salary for this role is starting from EURO 182,600 per annum depending on experience.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Engineer Intern
Description:
Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.

Eligibility Requirements:


EU / EEA citizenship
Must be graduating within or after November 2025


These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

Let’s talk about the role!

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.

By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.

Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:


Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.


What You Bring

What will make a candidate successful?


Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.


Competences Required:


Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.


A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.

We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:


The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.


What’s In It For You

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential—fueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people—you can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:


Participate in dedicated skill-building workshops
Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership


In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.

We want you to focus on what matters, that’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:


A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands


Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

ARE YOU IN? Apply now – early application increases your chances!

R-20250710-0008

Title: SENIOR BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
Description:
DonTouch SA is a digital company based in Switzerland that operates some of the largest marketplaces in Europe: Italy, Spain, Germany, and the UK.

With over 60,000 paying advertisers annually, our properties reach more than 7 million unique monthly active users, across the web and mobile apps for both iOS and Android.

For our Headquarters in Chiasso (CH), we are hiring:

SENIOR BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST

(NO REMOTE)

For this position we are looking for a professional accustomed to making technological decisions and managing requests from various departments based on business priorities and needs.

This role requires combining strong analytical skills with knowledge and experience in Business Intelligence solutions, with excellent written and verbal communication skills, to interact clearly and convincingly with cross-functional stakeholders.

The ideal profile is able to work closely with key stakeholders (mainly at C-level) to create systematic insights, data visualization, intuitive dashboards and data modeling to support strategically analysis in decision-making processes.

An innovative and open-minded individual, able to work independently and and in fruitful collaboration with the team

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders (Sales, Marketing, Finance, ICT) to capture requirements, policies and procedures for the collection and analysis, develop tools, processes, and best practices for continuous data collection, analysis, massive outputs, and presentations/reports.
Cooperate with ICT Department to implement software and hardware upgrades to leverage big data use cases
Build and iterate dashboards for Revenue/Pipeline, Marketing Performance (ROAS, CAC, LTV, attribution), and Customer360 with solid UX and governance.
Design and develop LOOK ML (views, joins, explores, refinements/extends) and define reusable measures/dimensions.
Performance & governance: PDTs/Aggregate Awareness, datagroups/cache, query optimization; implement RLS via user attributes and folder permissions.
Own the KPI Catalog (definitions, business rules, owners, granularity) and maintain documentation/playbooks.
Implement new data procurement and data analysis
Implement new techniques and technologies, data visualization and modeling, trend identification
Balance the line between ICT and the business:
Programming, data modeling and statistics
Analytical thinking and problem-solving
Communication
Monitor analytics and metrics results
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:


Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science, data science, engineering, or a related field
5 + years of work experience Database and data architecture design
5 + years of experience in Data Warehouse Business Intelligence
Deep Knowledge of BI principles, Data Analytics, Data Warehousing, Data Modelling and reporting tools
Deep expertise with Looker and LookML (explores, joins, reusable views, PDTs/aggregate tables, datagroups, user attributes/RLS, performance tuning).
Exposure to web analytics and MarTech (Matomo, Mautic/CRM, Ads APIs/platforms).
Power BI for creating charts, graphs and other data visualizations
Strong SQL and dimensional data modeling (facts/dimensions)
Experience with Dataform/dbt on BigQuery (tests, documentation, CI/CD)
Cost governance on BigQuery (materializations, partitions, aggregate tables)
Proficient in ETL - extract, transform, load (e.g., Airbyte)
Hands‑on delivery for Sales/Marketing/Finance analytics
Ability to define and compute KPI such as ROAS, CAC, LTV, ARPU/ARPA, pipeline metrics
Familiarity with attribution (last‑click and position‑based 40/20/40)
Excellent knowledge of the most common end-user tools (Excel) and DBMS’s (SQL, Elastic, Redis, Postgres)
Practical experience with programming languages for extracting and manipulating data sets (Python, SQL, R, etc.)
A/B testing basics and statistics
Critical thinking and problem-solving
A good understanding of business practices
Excellent communication skills
Leadership and project management experience
Git workflows



TECH STACK


LOOK ML
BigQuery, Looker, Dataform/dbt, Airbyte, Matomo, Mautic/CRM, Power BI, Ads platforms (Google/Meta),Python, Git.



LANGUAGES

ITALIAN Fluent (verbally and written)

ENGLISH Fluent (verbally and written)

Additional Languages will be considered a plus.

Benefits and Values - What you can expect from us:

TRAINING: You will work with an experienced and dynamic team, with whom you will grow and expand your professional skills.

VALORISATION: Proactive people with initiative are in our interest: your proposals will always be taken into consideration and, if feasible, we will be happy to put them into practice together.

CONCRETE: We offer a concrete opportunity for professional growth that will allow you to discover and come into direct contact with the challenges and fascination of an unconventional sector related to the digital world. The contract and RAL will be commensurate with experience.

TECHNOLOGY: Technology is the basis of our structure; we provide the necessary supports to perform the activities to the best of our ability. When you arrive, you will find Microsoft or Apple technical equipment at your workstation, depending on the tasks to be performed.

ENVIRONMENTS: Facility equipped with areas for conviviality among colleagues with free coffee and drinks.

Dontouch SA is an equal opportunity employer.

Contract: Permanent employment contract according to Swiss Law (equal to 40 hours per week).

Job location: Chiasso, Canton Ticino (Switzerland) - NO REMOTE

You can apply on LinkedIn or send your CV to hr@dontouch.ch

Please specify the type of projects in which the above-mentioned skills were used.

Applications whose profiles do not meet the above requirements will not be considered.


For non-EU/AELS citizens: Please state your eligibility status to work in Switzerland and note that if you do not own a valid Swiss work permit, DonTouch cannot guarantee your final employment due to authority regulations.

  • Exposure to web analytics and MarTech (Matomo, Mautic/CRM, Ads APIs/platforms).
  • Power BI for creating charts, graphs and other data visualizations
  • Strong SQL and dimensional data modeling (facts/dimensions)
  • Experience with Dataform/dbt on BigQuery (tests, documentation, CI/CD)
  • Cost governance on BigQuery (materializations, partitions, aggregate tables)
  • Proficient in ETL - extract, transform, load (e.g., Airbyte)
  • Hands‑on delivery for Sales/Marketing/Finance analytics
  • Ability to define and compute KPI such as ROAS, CAC, LTV, ARPU/ARPA, pipeline metrics
  • Familiarity with attribution (last‑click and position‑based 40/20/40)
  • Excellent knowledge of the most common end-user tools (Excel) and DBMS’s (SQL, Elastic, Redis, Postgres)
  • Practical experience with programming languages for extracting and manipulating data sets (Python, SQL, R, etc.)
  • A/B testing basics and statistics
  • Critical thinking and problem-solving
  • A good understanding of business practices
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Leadership and project management experience
  • Git workflows


TECH STACK

  • LOOK ML
  • BigQuery, Looker, Dataform/dbt, Airbyte, Matomo, Mautic/CRM, Power BI, Ads platforms (Google/Meta),Python, Git.


LANGUAGES

ITALIAN Fluent (verbally and written)

ENGLISH Fluent (verbally and written)

Additional Languages will be considered a plus.

Benefits and Values - What you can expect from us:

TRAINING: You will work with an experienced and dynamic team, with whom you will grow and expand your professional skills.

VALORISATION: Proactive people with initiative are in our interest: your proposals will always be taken into consideration and, if feasible, we will be happy to put them into practice together.

CONCRETE: We offer a concrete opportunity for professional growth that will allow you to discover and come into direct contact with the challenges and fascination of an unconventional sector related to the digital world. The contract and RAL will be commensurate with experience.

TECHNOLOGY: Technology is the basis of our structure; we provide the necessary supports to perform the activities to the best of our ability. When you arrive, you will find Microsoft or Apple technical equipment at your workstation, depending on the tasks to be performed.

ENVIRONMENTS: Facility equipped with areas for conviviality among colleagues with free coffee and drinks.

Dontouch SA is an equal opportunity employer.

Contract: Permanent employment contract according to Swiss Law (equal to 40 hours per week).

Job location: Chiasso, Canton Ticino (Switzerland) - NO REMOTE

You can apply on LinkedIn or send your CV to hr@dontouch.ch

Please specify the type of projects in which the above-mentioned skills were used.

Applications whose profiles do not meet the above requirements will not be considered.

  • For non-EU/AELS citizens: Please state your eligibility status to work in Switzerland and note that if you do not own a valid Swiss work permit, DonTouch cannot guarantee your final employment due to authority regulations.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Show more

Title: Data engineer (H/F)
Description:
Pour renforcer ses équipes, WIT PARTNERS est à la recherche d'un(e) Data engineer Senior H/F.

Cette opportunité vous permettra de rejoindre nos équipes dans le canton de Genève.

Il s'agit d'une mission ponctuelle.




Dans le cadre de sa stratégie digitale, notre client met en place un Data Hub centralisé sur Azure destiné à regrouper l’ensemble des données issues de ses principaux outils métiers. Ce Hub permettra de répondre efficacement aux besoins de reporting interne.

L’objectif principal de la mission est de finaliser la construction du Data Hub et d’assurer sa mise en production opérationnelle.




🧳 Responsabilités :




En tant que Data engineer, vous serez responsable de :




Définir et formaliser les besoins en collaboration avec les responsables applicatifs et les Business Analysts.
Participer, en lien avec le Data Architect, à la conception de la solution cible (fonctionnelle et technique).
Contribuer au développement et à l’évolution du Data Hub et des applications de restitution de données.
Analyser, corriger et documenter les anomalies détectées.
Respecter les standards et bonnes pratiques internes, concevoir et exécuter les tests unitaires.
Intervenir en mode projet, aussi bien en autonomie qu’en coordination avec l’équipe.
Transférer les connaissances et assurer la formation des équipes support.




🎓 Profil :

Expérience confirmée en tant que Data Engineer ou Développeur Data.
Diplôme en ingénierie informatique ou équivalent.
Excellente maîtrise de PySpark.
Bonnes connaissances de SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL un plus).
La maîtrise de Azure Synapse et Azure Logic Apps est un atout.
Une expérience dans le secteur bancaire et/ou en reporting réglementaire est un fort avantage.
Maîtrise du français (indispensable) et bonne pratique de l’anglais.
Esprit d’analyse, capacité de résolution de problèmes, adaptabilité et sens du travail en équipe.




🔑 WIT PARTNERS est un cabinet de conseil Suisse, dédié a la gestion du capital humain dans les domaines de l'IT et de la finance. Nous recherchons des candidats motivés, passionnés et soucieux de la qualité

Show more

Title: Working Student PowerBI Development and Data Analytics 40-60%
Description:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow

Siemens Smart Infrastructure combines the real and digital worlds across energy systems, buildings and industries, enhancing the way people live and work and significantly improving efficiency and sustainability.

Together, we create an impact

We work together with customers and partners to create an ecosystem that both intuitively responds to the needs of people and helps customers achieve their business goals. It helps our customers to thrive, communities to progress and supports sustainable development to protect our planet for the next generation.

As a working student, intern or trainee, you are an important part of our #TeamSiemens Switzerland. We offer a flexible and open workplace culture for an optimal balance between studies, work and private life, so that your work-life balance is sure to be good. As a member of the Siemens Student Association, you will have regular opportunities to exchange ideas with your community and expand your network. And who knows: perhaps national or international career opportunities will open up for you with us after your studies.

Why not find out for yourself and see what other working students have to say about their experience at Siemens?

Your New Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain interactive PowerBI dashboards and reports to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) and operational metrics for our SaaS business
Collaborate closely with key stakeholders across R&D, Finance, Quality, and other domains to understand their data challenges and priorities. Translate these insights into impactful dashboard solutions that empower data-driven decision-making across the organization
Apply best practices in data visualization and user experience to ensure dashboards are intuitive, actionable, and support data-driven decision-making.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data infrastructure and reporting capabilities
Manage and version control PowerBI assets and related scripts using GitLab
Support in connecting to various data sources, performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, ensuring data accuracy and consistency
Contribute to implementing complex DAX formulas and M-queries to create robust data models and insightful calculations


Your Talents And Experience


You are currently enrolled pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, Business Informatics, or a related quantitative field or University of Applied Sciences in Switzerland
1 to 2 years of experience with Microsoft PowerBI Desktop, or a strong interest and aptitude for learning its functionalities
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Basic understanding of software development processes and methodologies
Familiarity with version control systems, preferably GitLab
Proficiency in a programming language commonly used for data manipulation (e.g., Python, SQL, TypeScript) is a plus
You are a motivated and proactive student with excellent problem-solving skills and a dedicated, results-oriented work style
Fluent in English is a must, knowledge of German will be a benefit in this role


Employee Benefits


Mobile working from anywhere within Switzerland
Opportunity to develop an international professional network
Gain experience at one of the largest tech employers in Switzerland
Membership in the Siemens Students Association comprising 200 members


What It’s Like Working For Us

We place significant emphasis on fostering an inclusive and flexible working culture that encourages everyone to be their authentic selves. Equal opportunities and diversity are important to us and contribute to an enriching corporate culture. We actively embrace mobile working to provide every colleague with more autonomy and the chance to achieve a good work-life balance. Learn more here

Are you a good fit?

Our culture at Siemens Switzerland is defined by more than just the working environment. It is the heart of our daily interactions and the key to our success. Do you have what it takes to become a Siemens employee? Take our quiz now and find out! Culture quiz

Frequently asked questions and contact information

Here you will find a collection of frequently asked questions and a way to contact us directly.

I look forward to receiving your application

Olger

Talent Acquisition Partner

Information for recruitment agencies: Siemens is not accepting applications from recruitment agencies for this position. Thank you for your understanding.
Show more

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Mission


Core Banking - Contractor IT Business Analyst with strong functional & technical skills on Security, Settlements, Asset Servicing


Main responsibilities


Responsibilities

As a member of the Core Banking team in the IT department, the successful candidate as Core Banking Business Analyst will partner with the business and IT stakeholders on the acquistion projects related to core banking platform focusing on Security, Settlements, Asset Servicing. His/her main responsibilities would be the followings:


Compliance with UBP architecture, procedures and standards
Business Analysis and formalization of business needs on Security, Settlements, Asset Servicing
Definition and design of the solution along with SMEs and Service owners
Submit for approval analysis and specifications to Users
High level business requirements specification
High level development workload estimation


Requested Skills And Experience

Strong experience (over 15+ years) in banking industry

Experience with Operational Processes within Wealth Management


Strong IT delivery transformation experience
Seniority and good communication skills
Experience with core banking landscape in a bank or in software firm
Autonomous
Structured methodology
Capability to communicate in French and English (spoken and written ideal)
Client oriented
Capability to drive onshore/offshore teams
Education: Bachelor Degree
Experience Technical skills:
Strong experience (over 15+ years) in banking industry
Experience with Operational Processes within Wealth Management


Personal Skills


Autonomous
Structured methodology
Capability to communicate in French and English (spoken and written ideal)
Capacity to respect confidentiality of both the bank and the mission
Client oriented
Ability to work in a high-pressure environment given fixed timeframe


Practical


Others- Swiss Residence: Optional


Core Competencies : Adherence to the company’s values: Dedication, Conviction, Agility and Responsibility - Compliance with regulations and internal directives

  • Compliance with UBP architecture, procedures and standards
  • Business Analysis and formalization of business needs on Security, Settlements, Asset Servicing
  • Definition and design of the solution along with SMEs and Service owners
  • Submit for approval analysis and specifications to Users
  • High level business requirements specification
  • High level development workload estimation

Requested Skills And Experience

Strong experience (over 15+ years) in banking industry

Experience with Operational Processes within Wealth Management

  • Strong IT delivery transformation experience
  • Seniority and good communication skills
  • Experience with core banking landscape in a bank or in software firm
  • Autonomous
  • Structured methodology
  • Capability to communicate in French and English (spoken and written ideal)
  • Client oriented
  • Capability to drive onshore/offshore teams
  • Education: Bachelor Degree

  • Strong experience (over 15+ years) in banking industry

Personal Skills

  • Autonomous

Title: Business Analyst (DWH, ETL, Data)
Description:
Beschreibung:

Für ein anspruchsvolles Projektumfeld suchen wir eine/n erfahrene/n Business Analyst / Data Analyst. Sie unterstützen mit fundierter Erfahrung in Daten- und Businessanalyse, erstellen Fachkonzepte und fungieren als Schnittstelle zwischen Fachbereichen und IT. Sie bringen praktische Erfahrung aus grösseren Data-Warehouse-Projekten mit.




Durchführung von Business- und Datenanalysen in komplexen Projektumgebungen
Erarbeitung und Dokumentation von Spezifikationen und Fachkonzepten
Unterstützung bei der Erstellung von technischen Designs im Datenumfeld
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Business-Stakeholdern, Architekten und Entwicklungsteams
Beitrag zur erfolgreichen Umsetzung von Data-Warehouse-Lösungen




Anforderung:

Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Business Analyst oder Data Analyst
Praxis in grösseren Data-Warehouse- oder BI-Projekten wünschenswert
Erfahrung in der Analyse und Aufbereitung von Daten sowie im Erstellen von präzisen Fachspezifikationen
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und gute Kommunikationsskills
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse, Englisch von Vorteil




Einsatzort:

Bern (1 Tag onsite, Rest Remote innerhalb der Schweiz)




Startdatum:

01.09.2025




Pensum:

100%




Projektdauer:

6 Monate ++

Title: Data & AI Engineer (Remote – Switzerland based)
Description:
About the job

Join MDW, a consulting firm specialized in Data, AI, and Business Applications, operating at the core of the Microsoft ecosystem.




We support leading Swiss companies in building secure, scalable, and future-ready platforms using Azure, Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, and Copilot Studio.

If you're passionate about working on high-impact data projects and want to grow in a dynamic, expert-driven environment this opportunity is for you.




Your responsibilities




Design and implement modern data platforms in cloud and hybrid environments
Build and optimize data pipelines using the Azure Data stack, Databricks, and open-source tools
Contribute to real-time architectures and lakehouse models
Collaborate with consultants and clients to bring innovation into production




Your profile




Experience in data engineering or AI solution delivery
Strong skills in Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Data Lake, Databricks, Python or PySpark
Familiar with CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, and architectures like Medallion or Fabric Eventhouse
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric, MLOps, or Generative AI is a strong plus
Fluent in French or English
Based in Switzerland




What we offer




Full remote work with flexible conditions
6 weeks of paid vacation per year
Competitive Swiss-level salary
Personalized career plan and continuous skills development
Access to Microsoft previews, early technologies, and strategic projects
A team of experts working on disruptive Data & AI solutions

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are currently seeking an experienced  Data Engineer to join a leading bank in Switzerland. This exciting opportunity will involve helping one of Switzerland’s leading banks build, secure and optimise data pipelines to ensure reliable data flow across the business

The role requires English language skills, and candidates to be based in Zurich or a commutable distance, as the role is hybrid.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines using Informatica PowerCenter/IDQ and Apache Spark.
Collaborate with business stakeholders, data analysts, and data scientists to gather requirements and translate them into scalable data solutions.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple banking domains (e.g., retail, risk, compliance, payments).
Implement best practices for data integration, quality, lineage, and governance to meet banking regulatory and compliance standards.
Optimise Spark jobs and workflows for performance, scalability, and cost efficiency.
Partner with infrastructure and cloud teams to support deployment and monitoring of data pipelines on-premises and/or in cloud environments (AWS/Azure/GCP).
Develop and maintain technical documentation, data dictionaries, and process workflows.
Support production operations by troubleshooting, resolving issues, and implementing preventive measures
 
Desirable Requirements:
 

Strong background in Data Engineering
Experience with Spark
Informatica experience
Python and SQL experience
 
The role offers the flexibility of a hybrid work arrangement and is a 6-12 month contract with possibility of extension.

Title: Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management
Description:
Switzerland

Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management

Organization


International Organization for Migration


Posted 1 Sep 2025 Closing date 11 Sep 2025

Job Identification (Reference Number): 16354

Position Title: Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management

Duty Station City: Geneva

Duty Station Country: Switzerland

Classification: Intern, Grade Other

Type of Appointment : Internship, four months with possibility of extension

Closing date: 11 September 2025

Introduction

Established in 1951, IOM is a Related Organization of the United Nations, and as the leading UN agency in the field of migration, works closely with governmental, intergovernmental and non-governmental partners. IOM is dedicated to promoting humane and orderly migration for the benefit of all. It does so by providing services and advice to governments and migrants.

Context

IOM established the Global Data Institute to harness the power of its data for operations, making meaning of global migration patterns, and providing foresight. The Global Data Institute capitalizes on synergies between its two units--the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) and the Global Migration Data Analysis Center (GMDAC)--and collaborates with a network of regional data specialists to illuminate the global data story of human mobility.

The Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) has been IOM’s main operational tool for tracking and monitoring the movements and evolving needs of displaced populations since 2004. It has been systematically deployed in medium to large-scale humanitarian response operations in the last four years, including in all Level 3 emergencies. As of 2023, DTM was active in 100 countries, tracking and monitoring over 57 million IDPs.

Under the overall supervision of the Global DTM Coordinator and direct supervision of the Data Science Support Officer, the DTM Visualization and Data Management Intern will be responsible and accountable for providing support to the activities and services provided by DTM support team in headquarters for DTM implementation in the field worldwide, to support development and implementation of supplementary and interoperable systems for quality assurance and further improvement of global DTM data and analysis.

Responsibilities

Technical


Utilization of relevant business intelligent tool for interpreting and analysing raw data into meaningful information and key findings.
Visualizing data, designing, and creating reports for accessibility in compliance with the DTM standards


Teamwork


Provide support to ensure standards in published DTM data on IOM websites, primarily displacement.iom.int, but may include any other portal as required by operations and global developments.
Implement data quality control mechanisms for DTM operations worldwide as set by the global standard.
Contribute to the implementation and roll out of responsible data mechanisms in DTM implementation worldwide. This includes the aspect of data governance, data protection, data security, and ethics in the collection and use of DTM data.
Support the development and adaptation of standard operating procedures for DTM field data collection and management.
Support the implementation of global DTM survey, tracking system for DTM operations worldwide, as well as addressing queries on data collected by DTM field operations, based on data consolidated in the Central Data Warehouse and any other databases available.
Support the development and implementation of Kobo forms to support DTM field operations worldwide.
Perform any other tasks as assigned.


Training Components and Learning Elements


Gain a thorough understanding of DTM methodologies, forms development and data management at DTM.
Develop technical knowledge of DTM data quality standards and tools used to support DTM operations at global, regional and country levels.
Gain a good understanding of humanitarian data collection and the use of data collection, management and analysis tools in the context of emergencies.
Develop communication skills to analyze, report and present on status, challenges and solutions related to data collection and management at country level.


Qualifications

Education


Pursuing degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Analytics or related field; with two years of relevant professional experience. Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured.


Accredited Universities are those listed in the UNESCO World Higher Education Database.

Experience


Knowledge of databases management, querying, quality assurance and control systems. Additional work experience is an advantage;
Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured;
Experience in the development and implementation of the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) or similar assessment and information management activities; and,
Experience in building interactive dashboards using Microsoft Power BI and/or Tableau is preferred.


Skills


Good data visualization skills in HTML5 or JavaScript environments; experience with AngularJS, NodeJS, or D3 is a plus;
Valued proficiency in using two or more of the following tools: XLS forms for ODK or Kobo, Microsoft Access, Python, Stata, or R;
Strong skills in working with relational databases, including SQL and/or Azure SQL, particularly for managing survey data;
Excellent communication skills, with a high degree of efficiency and adaptability;
Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage multiple tasks;
Strong attention to detail, commitment to data quality, and ability to meet tight deadlines; and,
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with a creative approach to data interpretation and visualization


Languages

For this position, fluency in English and Spanish is required (oral and written). Working knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, French, Chinese, and Spanish) is an advantage.

IOM’s official languages are English, French and Spanish. All staff members are required to be fluent in one of the the three languages.

Proficiency of language(s) required will be specifically evaluated during the selection process, which may include written and/or oral assessments

Note

Eligibility and Selection

In general, the Internship Programme aims at attracting talented students and graduates who:


have a specific interest in, or whose studies have covered, areas relevant to IOM programmes and activities;
are holding a scholarship for internship placements in international organizations and/or for whom internship is required to complete their studies; or
are sponsored by governmental/non governmental institutions and/or academia to work in specific areas relevant to both IOM and the sponsor.
are either enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (minimum Bachelor’s level or equivalent) or have graduated in the last 12 months.
are between 20 and 36 years of age.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, and additional enquiries will only be addressed if the candidate is shortlisted.
Depending on experience and location, IOM provides a small monthly stipend to help offset costs.
Please consider the cost of living in the duty station prior to applying.


Required Competencies

IOM’s competency framework can be found at this link Competencies will be assessed during the selection process.

Values - all IOM staff members must abide by and demonstrate these values:


Inclusion and respect for diversity: Respects and promotes individual and cultural differences. Encourages diversity and inclusion.
Integrity and transparency: Maintains high ethical standards and acts in a manner consistent with organizational principles/rules and standards of conduct.
Professionalism: Demonstrates ability to work in a composed, competent and committed manner and exercises careful judgment in meeting day-to-day challenges.
Courage: Demonstrates willingness to take a stand on issues of importance.
Empathy: Shows compassion for others, makes people feel safe, respected and fairly treated.


Core Competencies – behavioural indicators


Teamwork: Develops and promotes effective collaboration within and across units to achieve shared goals and optimize results.
Delivering results: Produces and delivers quality results in a service-oriented and timely manner. Is action oriented and committed to achieving agreed outcomes.
Managing and sharing knowledge: Continuously seeks to learn, share knowledge and innovate.
Accountability: Takes ownership for achieving the Organization’s priorities and assumes responsibility for own actions and delegated work.
Communication: Encourages and contributes to clear and open communication. Explains complex matters in an informative, inspiring and motivational way.


How to apply

To apply, interested applicants are invited to submit their applications HERE via the IOM Career Gateways by 11 September 2025.
